original: de la tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The four immeasurables are the accumulation of merit.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The samadhi endowed with the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: yang na sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Alternatively, the three of generosity, morality and patience are the accumulation of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The two of meditative stabilization and wisdom are the accumulation of wisdom.

original: tshogs de gnyis bsag pa la chog mi shes par sbyor ba ni mi ngoms pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs de gnyis bsag pa la chog mi shes par sbyor ba ni mi ngoms pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The application to the accumulation of those two without satisfaction is called the inexhaustible application of non-satisfaction.

original: thos pa btsal ba la mi ngoms pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas ye shes kyi tshogs la sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: thos pa btsal ba la mi ngoms pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas ye shes kyi tshogs la sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The inexhaustible application of non-satisfaction in seeking learning teaches the application to the accumulation of wisdom.

original: tshogs kyi sgra ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgra ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: The term accumulation has the meaning of cause.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la chog mi shes par sbyor ba la ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la chog mi shes par sbyor ba la ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of wisdom occurs through the application of non-satisfaction in listening to the excellent teaching.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i shes pas mi ngoms pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i shes pas mi ngoms pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application of skill in means is called the inexhaustible application of the knowledge of the dedication of merit to enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa ni byang chub tu bsngo ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa ni byang chub tu bsngo ba shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the dedication of merit to enlightenment is the skill in dedicating all the roots of virtue to unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de ltar bsngos nas dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu yang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob kyi bar du bar ma dor zad par mi 'gyur bar brtson @52a * //
analyzed: de ltar bsngos nas dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu yang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob kyi bar du bar ma dor zad par mi 'gyur bar brtson @52a * //
translated: Having thus dedicated, even small roots of virtue will not be exhausted in the interim until unsurpassable enlightenment is attained.

original: 'grus mi zad pa'i skabs nas rgya mtsho chen po chu'i thigs pa ltung ba'i dpes bstan pa lta bu yin pas thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'grus mi zad pa'i skabs nas rgya mtsho chen po chu'i thigs pa ltung ba'i dpes bstan pa lta bu yin pas thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this is taught by the example of a drop of water falling into the great ocean in the context of inexhaustible diligence, it is called the application of skill in means.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Furthermore, there are four inexhaustible applications.

original: yi ge dang rtsis dang lag rtsis la sogs pa shes pa ni bgrang ba rtog pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang rtsis dang lag rtsis la sogs pa shes pa ni bgrang ba rtog pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
translated: The inexhaustible application of the knowledge of enumeration is knowing letters, calculation, arithmetic, and so forth.

original: bre dang srang la sogs pas gzhal ba shes pa ni gzhal ba rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //üîΩgos dang rin po che la sogs pa brtag pa shes pa ni dpyad pa rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: bre dang srang la sogs pas gzhal ba shes pa ni gzhal ba rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o // gos dang rin po che la sogs pa brtag pa shes pa ni dpyad pa rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of measuring with bushels, seers, etc. is the inexhaustible application of the realization of measuring.üîΩThe knowledge of examining cloth, jewels, etc. is the inexhaustible application of the realization of examining.

original: mi glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i sha mtshan dang dpyad la sogs pa shes pa ni so sor brtag pa rtog pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: mi glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i sha mtshan dang dpyad la sogs pa shes pa ni so sor brtag pa rtog pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the marks, the examination, etc. of human flesh, elephant, horse, etc. is the inexhaustible application of the realization of discriminating.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi ste zhes bya bas rnam grangs gzhan du sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi ste zhes bya bas rnam grangs gzhan du sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: Moreover, there are four other inexhaustible applications.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba rtogs pa la sbyor ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rtogs pa la sbyor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs brjod pa'i sbyor ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba rtogs pa la sbyor ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rtogs pa la sbyor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs brjod pa'i sbyor ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application to the realization of suffering and origin, the application to the realization of cessation and path, the application to the expression of the disadvantages of defilement, and the application to the expression of the benefits of purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba rtogs pa la sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba rtogs pa la sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The application to the realization of the cause of complete affliction, which is called ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù teaches the application to the realization of suffering and origin.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bya ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bya ste /
translated: Complete affliction is suffering,

original: khams gsum gyi 'khor ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'khor ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because samsara in the three realms is complete affliction.

original: de'i rgyu ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin te /
translated: Its cause is the truth of origin,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kun 'byung ba yin par shes na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kun 'byung ba yin par shes na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because when one knows that the cause of suffering is origin, it is called ‚Äúthe application to complete affliction, which is called ‚Äòinexhaustible.‚Äô‚Äù

original: rnam par byang ba'i rgyu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas 'gog pa dang lam rtogs pa la sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rgyu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas 'gog pa dang lam rtogs pa la sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The application to the realization of the cause of complete purification, which is called ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù teaches the application to the realization of cessation and path.

original: rnam par byang ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin la /
translated: Complete purification is the truth of cessation,

original: de'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa yin te /
translated: and its cause is the truth of the path.

original: de ltar shes nas rnam par byang ba'i rgyu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes nas rnam par byang ba'i rgyu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Knowing this, one is said to be engaged in the inexhaustibility of the realization of the cause of purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs brjod pa'i sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs brjod pa'i sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The engagement in the inexhaustibility of the expression of the cause of affliction teaches the engagement in the expression of the disadvantage of affliction.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa yin la /
translated: The truth of suffering is permanent, painful, empty, and selfless.

original: de'i rgyu kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen yin te /
translated: Its cause is origination, full arising, cause, and condition.

original: de ltar ston pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu @52b yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ston pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu @52b yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Teaching this is called the engagement in the inexhaustibility of the expression of the cause of affliction.

original: rnam par byang ba'i yon tan dang / phan yon yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas rnam par byang ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i yon tan dang / phan yon yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya bas rnam par byang ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The engagement in the inexhaustibility of the expression of the qualities and benefits of purification teaches the engagement in the expression of the benefits of purification.

original: de la 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de la 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The truth of cessation is cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byung par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byung par byed pa yin te /
translated: The truth of the path is the path, correctness, achievement, and definitive release.

original: de ltar ston pa ni rnam par byang ba'i yon tan dang / phan yon yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba ni mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ston pa ni rnam par byang ba'i yon tan dang / phan yon yongs su brjod pa'i sbyor ba ni mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the application of teaching the qualities and benefits of purification is called inexhaustible.

original: tshig de dag nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan du don rnam pa bzhis ston te /
analyzed: tshig de dag nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan du don rnam pa bzhis ston te /
translated: These very words are taught in another enumeration with four topics:

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu ston pa la sbyor ba dang / mya ngan 'das pa'i lam ston pa la sbyor ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyu'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sbyor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i sbyor bas te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu ston pa la sbyor ba dang / mya ngan 'das pa'i lam ston pa la sbyor ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyu'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sbyor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i sbyor bas te /
translated: application to teaching the cause of samsara, application to teaching the path of nirvana, application to teaching the disadvantages of the cause of samsara, and application to teaching the benefits of nirvana.

original: mdo'i tshig bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are applied in order to the four lines of the sutra.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi ste zhes bya bas rnam grangs gzhan du sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi bstan te /üîΩphung po rnams sgyu ma lta bur mkhas pa la sbyor ba dang / khams gsum grong stong pa lta bur mkhas pa la sbyor ba dang / skye mched rnams sbrul gdug pa'i dug bzhin du ma rungs par byed par mkhas pa la sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi ste zhes bya bas rnam grangs gzhan du sbyor ba mi zad pa bzhi bstan te / phung po rnams sgyu ma lta bur mkhas pa la sbyor ba dang / khams gsum grong stong pa lta bur mkhas pa la sbyor ba dang / skye mched rnams sbrul gdug pa'i dug bzhin du ma rungs par byed par mkhas pa la sbyor ba dang /
translated: This passage teaches four kinds of inexhaustible application in another way.

original: dngos po rnams rkyen las 'byung ba yin par mkhas pa la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rkyen las 'byung ba yin par mkhas pa la sbyor ba ste /
translated: They are: application to the skill of knowing that the aggregates are like an illusion; application to the skill of knowing that the three realms are like an empty town; application to the skill of knowing that the sense spheres are like the poison of a virulent snake; and application to the skill of knowing that things arise from conditions.

original: de la phung po lnga ni sgyu ma dang 'dra /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ni sgyu ma dang 'dra /
translated: The five aggregates are like an illusion.

original: khams bco brgyad ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral te grong stong pa dang 'dra /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral te grong stong pa dang 'dra /
translated: The eighteen constituents are devoid of self and mine and are like an empty town.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs te /
translated: The sense spheres such as the eyes focus on form and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa'i sgo nas rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba srog dang 'dra ba ma rungs par byed pas skye mched ni sbrul gdug pa lta bu'i dug dang 'dra /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa'i sgo nas rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba srog dang 'dra ba ma rungs par byed pas skye mched ni sbrul gdug pa lta bu'i dug dang 'dra /
translated: The sense-fields are like the poison of a virulent snake, because they destroy the roots of one's virtue, which are like one's life, by giving rise to desire and so forth.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba yin no zhes phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de ltar shes na phung po dang / khams dang ; skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa la brtag pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya ba go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba yin no zhes phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de ltar shes na phung po dang / khams dang ; skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa la brtag pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya ba go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: One should understand that all internal and external things arise from causes and conditions. When one understands the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, sense-fields and dependent origination in this way, one should apply the terms inexhaustible application and so forth, respectively.

original: yang sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes rnam grangs gzhan du ston te /
analyzed: yang sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes rnam grangs gzhan du ston te /
translated: Again, the inexhaustible application is taught in another enumeration.

original: 'du byed mi rtag par yongs su brtan pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya la /üîΩji tsam 'du byed du gyur pa thams @53a * //
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag par yongs su brtan pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya la / ji tsam 'du byed du gyur pa thams @53a * //
translated: The inexhaustible application is the thorough examination of impermanent formations.

original: cad ni mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: cad ni mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: All that is a formation is impermanent.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang de ltar bstan pa la sbyor ba mi zad pa'i phyir 'du byed mi rtag par yongs su bstan pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang de ltar bstan pa la sbyor ba mi zad pa'i phyir 'du byed mi rtag par yongs su bstan pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because the bodhisattva's application to such teaching is inexhaustible, it is called the inexhaustible application of teaching the impermanence of compounded things.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba ste /
translated: Similarly, all contaminated compounded things are suffering, all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are selfless, and the nirvana free from afflictions is peace.

original: de la dgod pa'i phyir bstan pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dgod pa'i phyir bstan pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it establishes those, it is called the inexhaustible application of teaching.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, in brief, and so on.

original: gong du smos pa'i sbyor ba de dag ci'i phyir mi zad pa'i gtan tshigs mdor bsdus nas ston te /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i sbyor ba de dag ci'i phyir mi zad pa'i gtan tshigs mdor bsdus nas ston te /
translated: This teaches in brief the reason why those applications mentioned above are inexhaustible.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zad mi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zad mi shes pa yin la /
translated: The wisdom of omniscience is inexhaustible like space.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba kun kyang de la gzhol zhing 'bab la bab pas mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba kun kyang de la gzhol zhing 'bab la bab pas mi zad pa ste /
translated: All the bodhisattva practices are also inexhaustible, since they are directed toward that, and since they flow from it and descend from it.

original: sbyor ba dang po rtsom pa dang / bar du sgom pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i bye brag gis tshig gsum smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang po rtsom pa dang / bar du sgom pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i bye brag gis tshig gsum smos so //
translated: The three phrases refer to the beginning of practice, the cultivation in the middle, and the culmination at the end.

original: sbyor ba mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sbyor ba mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustibility of practice has been explained.

original: // / khyad par du 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i mchog gi gnas mngon par tshol ba'i tshul dang / thabs la mang du bstan pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / khyad par du 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i mchog gi gnas mngon par tshol ba'i tshul dang / thabs la mang du bstan pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is progressing to a higher stage is seeking a superior state that is higher and higher.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The method of teaching that has been taught many times is stated in the passage beginning with the words, ‚ÄúMoreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the superior intention of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible.‚Äù

original: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa yang /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa yang /
translated: Therein, the inexhaustibility of the superior intention is as follows.

original: rang bzhin mi zad pa dang / las mi zad pa dang / rgyu mi zad pa rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi zad pa dang / las mi zad pa dang / rgyu mi zad pa rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as threefold: the inexhaustibility of its nature, the inexhaustibility of its action, and the inexhaustibility of its cause.

original: de dag gis rim bzhin du mi zad pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar mi zad pa dang / gang dag gis mi zad pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis rim bzhin du mi zad pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar mi zad pa dang / gang dag gis mi zad pa bstan to //
translated: These respectively show what is inexhaustible, how it is inexhaustible, and what is inexhaustible.

original: rang bzhin mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the inexhaustibility of its nature,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhy is that? ‚Äù and so on.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nges par 'byed pa dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nges par 'byed pa dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva‚Äôs superior intention is the aspiration for the qualities of a buddha, the discernment of them, and the prior practice of the factors that lead to enlightenment, which is preceded by faith and the discernment of the teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag kyang mdor bsdus na bco lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag kyang mdor bsdus na bco lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: These superior intentions of the bodhisattva should be understood in brief as fifteenfold.

original: bco lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bco lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fifteen?

original: mchog gi bsam pa dang / @53b tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang / de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa dang / mthu'i bsam pa dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: mchog gi bsam pa dang / @53b tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang / de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa dang / mthu'i bsam pa dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: the superior intention, the intention of morality, the intention of the perfections, the intention of the meaning of reality, the intention of power, the intention of benefit, the intention of happiness,

original: lhug pa'i bsam pa dang / brtan pa'i bsam pa dang / mi slu ba'i bsam pa dang / ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang / dag pa'i bsam pa dang / shin tu dag pa'i bsam pa dang / tshar gcad pa'i bsam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: lhug pa'i bsam pa dang / brtan pa'i bsam pa dang / mi slu ba'i bsam pa dang / ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang / dag pa'i bsam pa dang / shin tu dag pa'i bsam pa dang / tshar gcad pa'i bsam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: the intention of freedom, the intention of firmness, the intention of nondeception, the intention of impurity, the intention of purity, the intention of complete purity, the intention of annihilation, and the innate intention.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi bsam pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi bsam pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The bodhisattva's superior intention with regard to the Jewels of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community is called the superior intention.

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of morality is the superior intention toward the vow of morality of the bodhisattva.

original: sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of the perfections is the superior intention to accomplish generosity, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa don dam pa chos kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa don dam pa chos kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of the meaning of reality is the superior intention toward the profound reality of ultimate truth, the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mthu'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mthu'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of power is the superior intention toward the inconceivable power of the superknowledges of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sems can rnams la dge ba'i sems nye bar sgrub par 'dod pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dge ba'i sems nye bar sgrub par 'dod pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to establish virtuous states of mind in sentient beings is called the intention to benefit.

original: sems can rnams la zang zing med pa'i sems dang / sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i sems ni lhug pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la zang zing med pa'i sems dang / sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i sems ni lhug pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to benefit sentient beings without seeking material reward or the desire for a pleasant karmic result is called the intention to liberate.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems gcig tu nges pa ni brtan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems gcig tu nges pa ni brtan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The single-minded intention to attain supreme enlightenment is called the intention to be firm.

original: sems can gyi don gyi thabs dang / byang chub kyi thabs la phyin ci ma log pa'i shas pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa ni mi slu ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi thabs dang / byang chub kyi thabs la phyin ci ma log pa'i shas pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa ni mi slu ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspiration that is endowed with the unerring understanding of the means to benefit sentient beings and to attain enlightenment is called the intention to be nondeceptive.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni ma dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni ma dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention of the bodhisattvas on all the levels of earnest aspiration is called the impure superior intention.

original: bsam pa dag pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the level of the utterly pure superior intention onward,

original: spyod pa nges pa'i sa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni @54a * //üîΩdag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa nges pa'i sa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni @54a * // dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention of the bodhisattvas on the stages from the stage of action in faith up to the stage of certain conduct is called pure intention.

original: mthar thug par gyur pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams lhag pa'i bsam pa ni shin tu dag pa'i bsam ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par gyur pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams lhag pa'i bsam pa ni shin tu dag pa'i bsam ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention of the bodhisattvas on the stage of the fulfilled aim is called extremely pure intention.

original: de la ma dag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de nyid ni tshar bcad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma dag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de nyid ni tshar bcad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The impure superior intention is also called to be overcome.

original: so sor brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: so sor brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is to be examined.

original: / dag pa dang shin tu dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / dag pa dang shin tu dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The pure and extremely pure superior intentions are called innate intentions.

original: rang bzhin gyi de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / rten la shin tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / rten la shin tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are naturally and essentially present and because they are well established in the life of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mdor bsdu na lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba thams cad du rtogs pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis bya ba bcu byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mdor bsdu na lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba thams cad du rtogs pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis bya ba bcu byed de /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattvas perform ten actions through these fifteen realizations of virtuous superior intention.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: mchog gi bsam pas ni dgon mchog la mchod ba byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mchog gi bsam pas ni dgon mchog la mchod ba byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The intention of the highest object causes one to apply oneself to the highest of all aspects of the requisites for enlightenment, the worship of the supreme object, the Three Jewels.

original: tshul khrims kyi bsam pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la srog gi phyir bsams bzhin du nyes par 'byung bar mi byed la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bsam pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la srog gi phyir bsams bzhin du nyes par 'byung bar mi byed la /
translated: The intention of morality causes one not to commit a fault intentionally, even at the cost of one's life, in the vow of morality of the bodhisattva.

original: nyes par byung na yang myur ba myur bar so sor 'chags par byed do //
analyzed: nyes par byung na yang myur ba myur bar so sor 'chags par byed do //
translated: And if one should happen to commit a fault, one quickly confesses it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa rtag tu byed bas bag yod par gnas shing mchog tu bag yod par gnas par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa rtag tu byed bas bag yod par gnas shing mchog tu bag yod par gnas par byed do //
translated: The intention of the perfections causes one to abide in heedfulness, to abide in the highest heedfulness, by constantly cultivating the virtuous natures.

original: de kho na'i don gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa ni sems can gyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor bar yang byed la /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa ni sems can gyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor bar yang byed la /
translated: The intention of the ultimate reality causes one to revolve in cyclic existence with a nonaddicted mind for the sake of sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa lhag pa'i bsam pa mi gtong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa lhag pa'i bsam pa mi gtong bar yang byed do //
translated: And they do not abandon the superior intention of nirvana.

original: mthu'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni bstan pa la snying thag pa nas dad cing ston par yang byed la /
analyzed: mthu'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni bstan pa la snying thag pa nas dad cing ston par yang byed la /
translated: By the superior intention of power, they have deep faith in the teaching and teach it from the depths of their hearts.

original: bsgom pa la yang gces par 'dzin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa la yang gces par 'dzin te /
translated: And they value meditation.

original: 'dod pa skyes pas shas cher gnas la /
analyzed: 'dod pa skyes pas shas cher gnas la /
translated: They live mainly by the arising of desire.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin to //
translated: And they are not satisfied with mere study and reflection.

original: phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang / lhug pa'i bsam pas ni sems can don gyi bya ba rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang / lhug pa'i bsam pas ni sems can don gyi bya ba rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: By the superior intention of benefit, the superior intention of happiness, and the superior intention of freedom, they engage in all the activities that are to be done for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sbyor ba byas nas kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba byas nas kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: And once they have engaged in them, they do not get discouraged.

original: brtan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / brtson 'grus rgya chen po yang dag par rtsom par gnas te /üîΩsbyor ba lhod par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: brtan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / brtson 'grus rgya chen po yang dag par rtsom par gnas te / sbyor ba lhod par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: By the superior intention of steadfastness, they maintain the blazing of effort and the undertaking of vast effort.üîΩThey do not relax their practice.

original: sbyor ba nyams par mi 'gyur @54b ro ;
analyzed: sbyor ba nyams par mi 'gyur @54b ro ;
translated: And they do not let their practice decline.

original: / mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni dge ba'i chos mngon par sgrub pa de dang de dag la mngon bar shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni dge ba'i chos mngon par sgrub pa de dang de dag la mngon bar shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /
translated: With an irreversible intention, he quickly gains the superknowledges in regard to the various kinds of spiritual practices.

original: khyad par thob pa dma' ba dang // chung du tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: khyad par thob pa dma' ba dang // chung du tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin to //
translated: He does not consider himself satisfied with a small amount of spiritual attainment, or with a low or middling spiritual attainment.

original: tshar bcad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni lhan cig skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam par 'dren to //
analyzed: tshar bcad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni lhan cig skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam par 'dren to //
translated: With a crushing intention, he draws forth a spontaneous intention.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
translated: With a spontaneous intention, he quickly attains supreme enlightenment for the sake of the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po de dag dang / mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'byung ba dag kyang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po de dag dang / mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'byung ba dag kyang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: These fifteen kinds of intention, as well as the intentions taught in this sutra and in the BodhisattvagocaropƒÅyavi·π£ayavikurvƒÅ·πáanirde≈õa Sutra, should be applied in the appropriate manner.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa la ci'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya snyam nas dri ba'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa la ci'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya snyam nas dri ba'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes smos te /
translated: In order to ask this, it says, why is that?

original: gong du bshad pa'i bsam pa bas kyang /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i bsam pa bas kyang /
translated: It is superior to the intention explained above.

original: dmigs pa dang yon tan 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul lta bur 'phags pa 'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang yon tan 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul lta bur 'phags pa 'am /
translated: It is superior in terms of the object and qualities that will be explained below.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ni rtag tu bdag dang gzhan gyi don du sems pas na lhag pa'i bsam ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ni rtag tu bdag dang gzhan gyi don du sems pas na lhag pa'i bsam ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, the bodhisattvas' intention is always to think of benefit for self and other, so it is called superior intention.

original: des na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says, because it is superior observation of all roots of virtue and so on.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la ji ltar lhag par dmigs pa ni tha na byang chub sems dpa' gang ci sems pa de thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la lhag pa'i bsam pas dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya bas bshad de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la ji ltar lhag par dmigs pa ni tha na byang chub sems dpa' gang ci sems pa de thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la lhag pa'i bsam pas dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya bas bshad de /
translated: How is it superior observation of all roots of virtue? It is explained by whatever a bodhisattva thinks, all of that becomes superior observation of roots of virtue.

original: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji tsam du sems kyi g-yo ba dang / rtog pa 'byung ba thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la lhag par dmigs par byed kyi /
analyzed: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji tsam du sems kyi g-yo ba dang / rtog pa 'byung ba thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la lhag par dmigs par byed kyi /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are on the first stage, to whatever extent they have the movement of mind and the occurrence of thoughts, they all focus on the wholesome roots.

original: mi dge ba la ma yin pas lhag pa'i bsam ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la ma yin pas lhag pa'i bsam ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They do not focus on the unwholesome, so it is called the superior intention.

original: sa dang po la sogs pa nas gnyis pa la sogs par 'phar zhing de la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sa gong ma'i yon tan thob par sems pa ni //
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa nas gnyis pa la sogs par 'phar zhing de la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sa gong ma'i yon tan thob par sems pa ni //
translated: From the first stage and so forth, the thought of attaining the qualities of the higher stages in order to leap to the second stage and so forth, and to abide there,

original: 'pho ba'i lhag pa'i bsam ba'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i lhag pa'i bsam ba'o //
translated: is the superior intention of leaping.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams khams gsum las bye brag tu 'phags par 'gro ba'i phyir rgal ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams khams gsum las bye brag tu 'phags par 'gro ba'i phyir rgal ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The superior intention of crossing is because the bodhisattvas go to a place that is especially exalted above the three realms.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos la ltos nas rang sangs rgyas bye brag tu 'phags pa @55a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos la ltos nas rang sangs rgyas bye brag tu 'phags pa @55a * //
translated: In comparison to the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, the pratyekabuddhas are especially exalted,

original: yin la ; byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de gnyis ka las bye brag tu 'phags pas na /
analyzed: yin la ; byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de gnyis ka las bye brag tu 'phags pas na /
translated: and the bodhisattvas are especially exalted above both of them.

original: gong dang gong du khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: gong dang gong du khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: It is superior to the previous ones.

original: de ltar kun gyi gtso bo'am dam par gyur pas rtse mor lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun gyi gtso bo'am dam par gyur pas rtse mor lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the best or most excellent of all, so it is the superior intention of the peak.

original: sa dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas skad cig ma gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sa dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas skad cig ma gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Having perfected the perfection of generosity on the first ground, one can cause a hundred world systems to shake in a single instant and so forth.

original: sa re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa re re rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: sa re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa re re rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Having perfected each perfection on each ground,

original: yon tan gong nas gong du lhag par gyur pa la /
analyzed: yon tan gong nas gong du lhag par gyur pa la /
translated: one's qualities become increasingly superior.

original: bye brag gi chos kun 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi chos kun 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the Dharma of distinction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnams kyi shes rab kyi dbang pos bsam gtan la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par smin pa'i tshul gyis gsal bar mngon sum du gyur pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon sum du lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnams kyi shes rab kyi dbang pos bsam gtan la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par smin pa'i tshul gyis gsal bar mngon sum du gyur pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon sum du lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention of the bodhisattva who is in the eighth stage is called the direct realization of all the qualities of the Buddha, because his faculty of wisdom directly realizes all the qualities of the Buddha, such as the concentrations, the elements that lead to enlightenment, the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc., in the manner of their full development.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gong nas gong du khyad par du thob bar byed pa'i rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i cha dang mthun ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gong nas gong du khyad par du thob bar byed pa'i rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i cha dang mthun ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: The factors that contribute to enlightenment are the perfections, the immeasurables, etc., which are the causes for attaining the ever increasing stages of the bodhisattva.

original: de dag la 'dris par byed pa ni lhag par dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'dris par byed pa ni lhag par dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior perception is the familiarity with those factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: rtsom pa thams cad ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa thams cad ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'o //
translated: All undertakings are for the sake of benefiting oneself and others.

original: nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa ni mthar 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa ni mthar 'byin pa ste /
translated: The final step is to bring the practice to consummation.üîΩ

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar 'byin pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar 'byin pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The finalization of the realizations is the finalization of the realizations of self and other.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob pa'i 'og tu sa de nyid las sa bcu pa'i bar gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams las yongs su tshol zhing 'dri bas
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob pa'i 'og tu sa de nyid las sa bcu pa'i bar gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams las yongs su tshol zhing 'dri bas
translated: After attaining the first bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva, on that stage, inquires of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the spiritual masters, about the resistances and remedies on the ten stages up to the tenth stage.

original: mi skyo bar byas pa'i phyir sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i khyad par la nges te /
analyzed: mi skyo bar byas pa'i phyir sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i khyad par la nges te /
translated: He does this without becoming discouraged, and so he is certain about the special purification of the stages.

original: de ltar na 'bad pas yongs su mi skyo bas na nges par byas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bad pas yongs su mi skyo bas na nges par byas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he is not discouraged by striving, he is said to have the superior intention that is certain.

original: rgyan dang glu gar la sogs pa dregs pa'i yan lag spangs te /
analyzed: rgyan dang glu gar la sogs pa dregs pa'i yan lag spangs te /
translated: He has abandoned the branches of pride, such as adornments, singing, dancing, and so on.

original: skra dang kha spu bregs pa la sogs pa rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs 'dzin cing brtul zhugs kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed ba ni /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs pa la sogs pa rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs 'dzin cing brtul zhugs kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed ba ni /
translated: He takes on the appearance of a monk, shaving his head and beard, and so on, and he perfects the collection of ascetic practices.

original: brtul zhugs thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of all ascetic practices.

original: de lta bu la goms pas cha lugs mdzes pa lhun gyis @55b grub pa la brtul zhugs grub pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la goms pas cha lugs mdzes pa lhun gyis @55b grub pa la brtul zhugs grub pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By being accustomed to that, the spontaneous beauty of his appearance is the superior intention of the perfection of ascetic practices.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub pa la grogs bdag yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub pa la grogs bdag yin te /
translated: He is the friend of himself in accomplishing unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: gzhan gyi grogs byas shing btang du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi grogs byas shing btang du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he does not abandon the practice of being a friend to others,

original: go skabs med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: go skabs med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: this is the superior intention of no opportunity.

original: dmu rgod rnam pa bzhi po yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la 'dug tu mi btub pas gnas la dmu rgod dang / yang dag pa'i lam du 'jug tu mi btub pas 'jug pa la dmu rgod dang / spyod pa nyams bzhin du dad pas byin pa chud gson par byed pas spyod pa dmu rgod dang /
analyzed: dmu rgod rnam pa bzhi po yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la 'dug tu mi btub pas gnas la dmu rgod dang / yang dag pa'i lam du 'jug tu mi btub pas 'jug pa la dmu rgod dang / spyod pa nyams bzhin du dad pas byin pa chud gson par byed pas spyod pa dmu rgod dang /
translated: The four kinds of wildness are: wildness in place, because one cannot be made to stay in the right practice; wildness in engagement, because one cannot be made to enter the right path; wildness in conduct, because one squanders the gifts of faith while one‚Äôs conduct is declining; and wildness in view, because one cannot be made to enter the right view.

original: byang chub sems dpa' cang shes rnams kyi nang na lta ba dang spyod pa la sogs pa mi mthun par 'grogs pa dmu rgod de /üîΩrta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba'i skyon de dag spangs te /üîΩdmu rgod ma yin pas na cang shes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ste /üîΩrta cang shes bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' cang shes rnams kyi nang na lta ba dang spyod pa la sogs pa mi mthun par 'grogs pa dmu rgod de / rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba'i skyon de dag spangs te / dmu rgod ma yin pas na cang shes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ste / rta cang shes bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas are like wellbred horses, but they are unruly, going in different directions with different views and conduct.üîΩThey have the fault of being unruly like a wild horse.üîΩBut they are not unruly, so they are said to have the superior attitude of being wellbred.üîΩThey are like a wellbred horse.üîΩüîΩ

original: bslab pa gsum la gnas te so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pas 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum la gnas te so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pas 'phags pa yin la /
translated: The bodhisattvas are called the noble ones because they abide in the three trainings and transcend the stage of ordinary beings.

original: bslab pa gsum gyis dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pas sems dul bar gyur pas na dul ba'i sa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyis dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pas sems dul bar gyur pas na dul ba'i sa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: They are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of self-discipline because they have self-discipline through restraining their senses and so on with the three trainings.üîΩThey are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the good person because they are not mixed with bad people.

original: skye bo gang dag mthong na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo mi srun pa dang ma 'dres la /
analyzed: skye bo gang dag mthong na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo mi srun pa dang ma 'dres la /
translated: They are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the wise because they are not mixed with the afflictions.üîΩThey are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the trainee because they are trainees.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid dang ma 'dres pas na ma 'dres pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid dang ma 'dres pas na ma 'dres pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: They are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the non-trainee because they are non-trainees.üîΩThey are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the pratyekabuddha because they are pratyekabuddhas.üîΩThey are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the bodhisattva because they are bodhisattvas.üîΩThey are called the noble ones with the superior intention of the stage of the buddha because they are buddhas.

original: yan lag gi dam pa mgo yongs su gtong ba la sogs pas ni shin tu bya dka' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di lta bu dag 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan gyi bya dka' ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi dam pa mgo yongs su gtong ba la sogs pas ni shin tu bya dka' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di lta bu dag 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan gyi bya dka' ste /
translated: The six perfections are very difficult to practice, such as giving away one's head, the best of limbs.

original: kun gyi spyod pa las lhag pas lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kun gyi spyod pa las lhag pas lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bshad de /
translated: They are explained as the superior intention because they surpass the practice of all others, such as arya sravakas.

original: sbyin pa ni dngos su zad de //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni dngos su zad de //
translated: Generosity is directly exhausted.

original: tshul khrims ni gtsug lag khang nas byung ba la sogs pa chad pa bcad par 'os pa dag gi dpung gnyen byed pa dang / sems can mthu chung ba gdol pa la sogs pas spyo ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang du len pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni gtsug lag khang nas byung ba la sogs pa chad pa bcad par 'os pa dag gi dpung gnyen byed pa dang / sems can mthu chung ba gdol pa la sogs pas spyo ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang du len pa dang /
translated: Morality is the protection of those who deserve to be punished, such as those who leave the monastery and so on, and the acceptance of the faults of those who are weak, such as the insults of untouchables and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub lag mthil du 'ong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub lag mthil du 'ong ste /
translated: The transcendent result is the palm of the hand that reaches enlightenment as all sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: thob zin pa yang bor nas bla na med pa'i byang chub btsal dka' ba tshol ba dang / 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad kyi mchog ni bsam gtan gyi ro yin na /üîΩde la ma chags pa dang / sbyin ba dang tshul @56a * //
analyzed: thob zin pa yang bor nas bla na med pa'i byang chub btsal dka' ba tshol ba dang / 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad kyi mchog ni bsam gtan gyi ro yin na / de la ma chags pa dang / sbyin ba dang tshul @56a * //
translated: He is not attached to the supreme bliss of the world, which is the taste of the meditative absorptions.

original: khrims la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin na 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu tsam du zad pas shes rab kyis smad pa'i bya ba yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la yang mi smod pas na pha rol tu phyin pa de
analyzed: khrims la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin na 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu tsam du zad pas shes rab kyis smad pa'i bya ba yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la yang mi smod pas na pha rol tu phyin pa de
translated: And he does not disparage the roots of virtue, such as generosity and morality, even though they are merely causes for rebirth in cyclic existence if they are not embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: dag bsgrub pa ni bya dka' ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag bsgrub pa ni bya dka' ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of those perfections is called the superior attitude of difficult practice.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ni tshe 'di la bde ba dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ni tshe 'di la bde ba dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa'o //
translated: The activity of all sentient beings is the happiness of this life and the benefit of the next life.

original: shes rab kyi khams rab tu dbye ba la sogs par rab tu brtags pas na nga rgyal rnam pa bdun med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi khams rab tu dbye ba la sogs par rab tu brtags pas na nga rgyal rnam pa bdun med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The superior attitude free from the seven kinds of pride is the superior attitude of the absence of pride.

original: lan re ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas bzang po gdams te gtong bar byed kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni lan re ba med pas na sems can thams cad la 'dra bar sbyin pa'i gnas su sems pa'o //
analyzed: lan re ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas bzang po gdams te gtong bar byed kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni lan re ba med pas na sems can thams cad la 'dra bar sbyin pa'i gnas su sems pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, however, is impartial in giving to all sentient beings, because he has no expectation of reward.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo ni kun gyis 'jug par dka' ba la bya ste stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo ni kun gyis 'jug par dka' ba la bya ste stong pa nyid do //
translated: The profound Dharma of the Buddha is to be understood as emptiness, which is difficult for everyone to comprehend.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyis rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir mi sdang ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyis rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir mi sdang ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is not hostile to it, because he has realized it through his wisdom.

original: mi skrag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi skrag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is not afraid of it.

original: byin gyi rlabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab la sogs pa gong nas gong du 'bogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab la sogs pa gong nas gong du 'bogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The consecration of the bodhisattva is to be understood as the increase of his wisdom, etc.

original: des sa nas sar 'gro bar khyad par du 'gro ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des sa nas sar 'gro bar khyad par du 'gro ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention is the special progress from stage to stage by means of that consecration.

original: khur ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: khur ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The burden is of four kinds:

original: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / dam bcas pa'i khur dang / brtson pa'i khur rnams te /
analyzed: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / dam bcas pa'i khur dang / brtson pa'i khur rnams te /
translated: the burden of the aggregates, the burden of the passions, the burden of vows, and the burden of striving.

original: khur dor bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: khur dor bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: in order to put down the burden, to abandon, to accomplish, and to perfect.

original: de la sdug bsngal yongs su shes pas ni phung po'i khur blangs pa bor te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal yongs su shes pas ni phung po'i khur blangs pa bor te /
translated: By fully understanding suffering, one puts down the burden of the aggregates.

original: des phung po med pa'i bde ba thob bo //
analyzed: des phung po med pa'i bde ba thob bo //
translated: By that, one obtains the happiness of the absence of aggregates.

original: kun 'byur ba spangs pas ni nyon mongs pa'i khur blangs pa bor te /
analyzed: kun 'byur ba spangs pas ni nyon mongs pa'i khur blangs pa bor te /
translated: By abandoning the origin, one puts down the burden of the afflictions.

original: des rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob po //
analyzed: des rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob po //
translated: By that, one obtains the happiness of liberation.

original: lam bsgoms pas ni dam bcas pa'i khur blangs pa bor te /
analyzed: lam bsgoms pas ni dam bcas pa'i khur blangs pa bor te /
translated: By cultivating the path, one puts down the burden of one's vow.

original: des rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba thob po //
analyzed: des rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba thob po //
translated: By that, one obtains the happiness of perfect enlightenment.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas ni brtson 'grus kyi khur blangs pa por te /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas ni brtson 'grus kyi khur blangs pa por te /
translated: By realizing cessation, one puts down the burden of striving.

original: des nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob po //
analyzed: des nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob po //
translated: By that, one obtains the happiness of peace.

original: de bas na khur blangs pa sgrol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na khur blangs pa sgrol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the liberation of one who has taken up the burden.

original: sgrol ba ni bor ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrol ba ni bor ba'i don to //
translated: Liberation means the meaning of having put down.

original: yang na khur blangs pa ni dam bcas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na khur blangs pa ni dam bcas pa la bya ste /
translated: Or, taking up the burden is taking up a vow.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub par dam bcas pa bzhin byed pas na @56b sgrol ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub par dam bcas pa bzhin byed pas na @56b sgrol ba ste /
translated: It is liberating because it acts in accordance with the vow to achieve unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir ma zhum pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma zhum pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the superior intention that is not discouraged.

original: sems can dang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu brtson pas na brtson pa mi zad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu brtson pas na brtson pa mi zad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the superior intention that is inexhaustible effort because it is always striving in order to ripen sentient beings and the qualities of buddhahood.

original: las mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate inexhaustible activity,üîΩhe says,

original: yang lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, the so-called superior intention is... and so on.

original: 'byung po ni mi ma yin pa ste /üîΩde dag la gnod pa mi byed pas ni /
analyzed: 'byung po ni mi ma yin pa ste / de dag la gnod pa mi byed pas ni /
translated: Beings are non-humans.

original: des pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one does not harm them, it is called gentleness.

original: sems can rnams ni 'gro ba drug gis bsdus pa'i sems can thams cad la bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni 'gro ba drug gis bsdus pa'i sems can thams cad la bya ste /
translated: Sentient beings refers to all sentient beings included in the six realms.

original: de dag kun la bu gcig po bzhin du byams pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kun la bu gcig po bzhin du byams pa'o //
translated: One has love for them all, as if they were one's only child.

original: 'phags pa ni gang zag chen po brgyad la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni gang zag chen po brgyad la sogs pa ste /
translated: The noble ones are the eight great beings and so on.

original: de dag bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur par shes nas de dag la chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang snyun gyi rkyen sman gyi yo byad la sogs bas phan par byed do //
analyzed: de dag bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur par shes nas de dag la chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang snyun gyi rkyen sman gyi yo byad la sogs bas phan par byed do //
translated: Knowing that they are his spiritual benefactors, he benefits them with robes, alms, and medicines for the sick.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni so so'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni so so'i skye bo ste /
translated: The non-noble are the ordinary persons.

original: de dag la las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur zhes snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur zhes snying rje ba'o //
translated: He has compassion for them, thinking, ‚ÄúThey are subject to the power of karma and the afflictions.

original: bla ma ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bla ma ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù The gurus are the preceptors, the masters, and so on.

original: de dag la lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byed pas na gus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byed pas na gus pa'o //
translated: He has devotion for them, because he does prostrations and so on with his body.

original: dpung gnyen med pa ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa ste /
analyzed: dpung gnyen med pa ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa ste /
translated: The helpless are those who are afflicted by the sufferings of birth, aging, and so on.

original: de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las sgrol bar byed pas na dpung gnyen no //
analyzed: de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las sgrol bar byed pas na dpung gnyen no //
translated: He is their protector, because he liberates them from the sufferings of birth and so on.

original: skyabs med pas ni lhag mthong dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: skyabs med pas ni lhag mthong dang bral ba ste /
translated: The shelterless are those who are devoid of insight.

original: de dag la lhag mthong ston par byed pas skyabs so //
analyzed: de dag la lhag mthong ston par byed pas skyabs so //
translated: He is their shelter, because he teaches them insight.

original: gling med pa ni chu bo chen po bzhis bdas pa ste /
analyzed: gling med pa ni chu bo chen po bzhis bdas pa ste /
translated: Those without an island are carried away by the four great rivers.

original: de dag chu bo bzhi las rlon par byed pas na gling ngo ;
analyzed: de dag chu bo bzhi las rlon par byed pas na gling ngo ;
translated: They are islands because they rescue those in the four rivers.

original: / mgon med pa ni zhi gnas dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: / mgon med pa ni zhi gnas dang bral ba ste /
translated: Those without a protector are those who lack serenity.

original: de dag la zhi gnas ston pas na mgon no //
analyzed: de dag la zhi gnas ston pas na mgon no //
translated: They are protectors because they teach serenity to those who lack it.

original: grogs med pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i zhing blas dang bsod nams la sogs pa grogs med pa ste /
analyzed: grogs med pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i zhing blas dang bsod nams la sogs pa grogs med pa ste /
translated: Those without friends are those who lack friends in this life and the next, such as fields, merit, and so on.

original: de dag la tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i don du gyur pa'i grogs ci rigs par byed pas na grogs so //
analyzed: de dag la tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i don du gyur pa'i grogs ci rigs par byed pas na grogs so //
translated: They are friends because they act as friends for those who lack them in this life and the next.

original: gya gyu can ni bsam pa mi drang ba'o //
analyzed: gya gyu can ni bsam pa mi drang ba'o //
translated: Those with crooked minds are those with dishonest intentions.

original: dmu rgod ni smra ba'i don gsal bar mi ston pa'o /
analyzed: dmu rgod ni smra ba'i don gsal bar mi ston pa'o /
translated: Those with unruly minds are those who do not clearly reveal the meaning of what they say.

original: g-yon can ni bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ste /
analyzed: g-yon can ni bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ste /
translated: Those with deceitful minds are those who take up the means to conceal their own faults.

original: gtam rlung la bskur ba'o //
analyzed: gtam rlung la bskur ba'o //
translated: They are deceitful because they spread rumors.

original: thibs po spyod pa ni gzhan la slu ba'i phyir bdag nyid gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa'o //
analyzed: thibs po spyod pa ni gzhan la slu ba'i phyir bdag nyid gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa'o //
translated: Those with obscured conduct are those who deceive others by living in one way and appearing in another.

original: @57a * // byas pa mi gzo ba ni phan btags pa mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: @57a * // byas pa mi gzo ba ni phan btags pa mi dran pa'o //
translated: Not remembering kindness is not remembering help received.

original: 'khu ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la rku thabs kyis rgol ba ste /
analyzed: 'khu ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la rku thabs kyis rgol ba ste /
translated: Harming is attacking a bodhisattva with the intention to kill.

original: de dag la 'dis bdag la phan btags so snyam du byas pa tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'dis bdag la phan btags so snyam du byas pa tshor ba'o //
translated: Here, one should remember that they have helped oneself.

original: gnod pa byed pa ni tshe phyi ma'i don gyi bgegs byed ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa ni tshe phyi ma'i don gyi bgegs byed ba'o //
translated: Causing harm is obstructing their aims in future lives.

original: log par gyur pa ni lam log par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: log par gyur pa ni lam log par zhugs pa ste /
translated: Those who have gone astray have entered a wrong path.

original: de dag yang dag pa'i lam la 'god pas bden pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa'i lam la 'god pas bden pa'o //
translated: Here, one should establish them in the right path.

original: legs par byas pa ni dge ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa ni dge ba byas pa'o //
translated: Those who have done good have done what is wholesome.

original: gzhan gyi 'khrul pa ni pha rol gyi nyes pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khrul pa ni pha rol gyi nyes pa byas pa'o //
translated: Those who have erred are those who have committed faults.

original: log par zhugs pa ni mi dge ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa ni mi dge ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Those who have gone astray are those who have entered what is unwholesome.

original: de dag mi dge ba las slar bzlog pas na kun srung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag mi dge ba las slar bzlog pas na kun srung ba'o //
translated: Here, one should protect them by turning them away from what is unwholesome.

original: thabs kyi dge ba spyod pa ni rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsngo ba la mkhas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas dge ba spyod pa ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi dge ba spyod pa ni rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsngo ba la mkhas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas dge ba spyod pa ste /
translated: Those who practice virtue by means are those who practice virtue by means of skill in rejoicing and dedication, etc.

original: de dag la nyes par mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la nyes par mi lta ba'o //
translated: Here, one should not see them as faulty.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas ni gang zag yon tan can te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas ni gang zag yon tan can te /
translated: The worthy recipient is a person who has good qualities.

original: de dag la rnyed pa dang bkur stis rim gro byed pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag la rnyed pa dang bkur stis rim gro byed pa'o ;
translated: One serves him with gain and honor.

original: / rjes su bstan pas ni 'di gyis shig /'di ni ma byed cig ces ston pa ste /
analyzed: / rjes su bstan pas ni 'di gyis shig /'di ni ma byed cig ces ston pa ste /
translated: Instruction is teaching, saying, ‚ÄúDo this, don‚Äôt do that.‚Äù

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du byed pas na mthun par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du byed pas na mthun par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One is agreeable because one does what is taught.

original: gdams ngag gis gang zag pha rol po'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal la sogs pa rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag gis gang zag pha rol po'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal la sogs pa rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Admonition is the understanding of the thoughts, propensities, etc., of the other person.

original: de dag gi gnyen por mi sdug pa 'am byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por mi sdug pa 'am byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: One is applied to the cultivation of the antidotes to those, such as the cultivation of the unlovely or of loving-kindness.

original: rjes su bstan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa ste /
translated: Teaching is the teaching of the supramundane path.

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin bsgrubs pas na bka' blo bde ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin bsgrubs pas na bka' blo bde ba'o //
translated: One is obedient because one practices as taught.

original: dgon par gnas pa la rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i phyir phu dud byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa la rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i phyir phu dud byed pa'o //
translated: One is respectful because one always acts respectfully toward the person who lives in the forest.

original: chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa bkur sti dang / bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag la ma chags pas na don du mi gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa bkur sti dang / bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag la ma chags pas na don du mi gnyer ba'o //
translated: He is not interested in gain, such as robes, etc., or in honor, such as salutation, etc., or in the verses of praise.

original: dam pa'i chos btsal ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir lus dang srog la mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos btsal ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir lus dang srog la mi lta ba'o //
translated: He is not concerned with his body or life in order to seek the Dharma and to work for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yon tan yod par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir spyod lam sgyur ba'i tshul 'chos pa med pa'o //üîΩngag bsdams pas na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bdag gi yon tan gleng ba 'am /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yon tan yod par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir spyod lam sgyur ba'i tshul 'chos pa med pa'o // ngag bsdams pas na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bdag gi yon tan gleng ba 'am /
translated: He is not hypocritical, since he has a pure superior attitude, and so does not pretend to have good behavior in order to inspire confidence that he has good qualities.

original: bstan pa'i tshul gyis tshig gi lam 'jam po @57b kun tu spyod pa'i kha gsag med ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul gyis tshig gi lam 'jam po @57b kun tu spyod pa'i kha gsag med ba'o //
translated: He is not a flatterer, since he is restrained in speech and so does not use sweet talk to promote his own interests.

original: nan gyis slong ba ni thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: nan gyis slong ba ni thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
translated: He does not use threats, since he is not interested in gain and honor.

original: sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gnas ngan len dang bral te rtse gcig tu gnas su btub pas na las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gnas ngan len dang bral te rtse gcig tu gnas su btub pas na las su rung ba'o //
translated: The mind that is not emotionally tainted is fit for action, since it is free from the assumption of bad states and is capable of remaining one-pointedly.

original: ye shes kyi mthus 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs par byas kyang 'khor bar skye ba'i bsod nams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad stsogs pas na 'khor bar gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mthus 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs par byas kyang 'khor bar skye ba'i bsod nams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad stsogs pas na 'khor bar gzhol ba'o //
translated: It is directed to the lifecycle, since it accumulates all the roots of virtue of the merit that produces birth in the lifecycle, even though it turns away from the lifecycle by the power of intuition.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar khas blangs pas na sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshe phyi nang ki sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar khas blangs pas na sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshe phyi nang ki sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam ste /
translated: It is directed to the benefit of beings, since it is committed to the task of benefiting all beings, and so it is indifferent to all the inner and outer sufferings that occur when it is engaged in benefiting beings.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,üîΩHaving abandoned the thought

original: dka' 'am sla 'am snyam pa yi //
analyzed: dka' 'am sla 'am snyam pa yi //
translated: ‚ÄúIs it difficult or easy?,‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs nas ni ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs nas ni ;
translated: You have declared,

analyzed: /'gro ba 'di dag nyam thag ces //üîΩkhyod bdag nyid kyi zhal gyis bzhes //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese beings are helpless!‚Äù
