analyzed: rgyu mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir de'i phyir na skyes bu dam pa de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa thams cad mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pha gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, all the superior attitudes of those holy beings are inexhaustible.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams su bgrang ngo cog thams cad kyi nye bar bstan te brtas shing smin par byas pa dang / sems can mtha' yas thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams su bgrang ngo cog thams cad kyi nye bar bstan te brtas shing smin par byas pa dang / sems can mtha' yas thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
translated: All the enumerations of merit such as generosity and morality are demonstrated, increased, and matured, and all infinite sentient beings are sustained.

original: gsos su gyur pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi zad pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa rgyu rnam par dag pa 'di gsum gyi phyir 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis zad par mi nus zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsos su gyur pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi zad pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa rgyu rnam par dag pa 'di gsum gyi phyir 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis zad par mi nus zhes gsungs so //
translated: By this superior attitude, the inexhaustible gnosis of omniscience is accomplished. For these three reasons, it is said that the afflictions of sa·πÉsƒÅra cannot exhaust it.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustibility of superior attitude has been explained.

original: // / chos la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni drug ste /
analyzed: // / chos la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni drug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the Dharma is of six kinds.

analyzed: phan pa'i chos thams cad byed pa dang ; chos bzhin byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su srung bar byed pa dang / chos la brtson pa dang / chos las mi g-yo ba dang / chos las mi nyams pa ste /
translated: not wavering from the Dharma,üîΩand not falling away from the Dharma.

original: de dag bstan pa'i phyir de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de dag bstan pa'i phyir de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: In order to teach those, then the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra said this to the bodhisattva Ak·π£ayamati:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi zad pa gzhan la lta yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi zad pa gzhan la lta yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of good family, are there any other inexhaustibles of the bodhisattvas?‚Äù and so on, extensively teaching the six perfections.

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The six perfections teach the perfection of accomplishing one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô goals.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa @58a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa @58a * //
translated: Generosity, moral discipline, and patience

original: gsum gyis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: gsum gyis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: teach the perfection of others‚Äô goals.

analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis kyis ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
translated: The perfections of meditative absorption and wisdom are taught as the excellence of one's own goal.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnyi gar 'gro bar bstan to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnyi gar 'gro bar bstan to //
translated: And effort is taught as going to both.

original: de dag mi zad pa yang byang chub tu sems skyed pa dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir mi zad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mi zad pa yang byang chub tu sems skyed pa dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir mi zad par rig par bya'o //
translated: And their inexhaustibility should be understood as arising from the inexhaustibility of the generation of the Thought of enlightenment, of the aspiration, of the application, and of the superior intention.

original: yang na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di dag ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi ched du bsgrubs pa dang / chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid zad mi shes pa rtogs par bya ba'i rgyur bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: yang na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di dag ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi ched du bsgrubs pa dang / chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid zad mi shes pa rtogs par bya ba'i rgyur bsgrub pa dang /
translated: Or else, these bodhisattva practices, the generation of the Thought of enlightenment, etc., are inexhaustible because they are dedicated to unsurpassed enlightenment, because they are accomplished for the sake of all sentient beings, because they are accomplished as the cause for realizing the inexhaustibility of the reality of all things,

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zad mi shes pa thob par bya ba'i rgyur bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zad mi shes pa thob par bya ba'i rgyur bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: and because they are accomplished as the cause for attaining the inexhaustibility of non-abiding nirvana.

original: mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i spyod pa de dag mi zad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i spyod pa de dag mi zad par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that those practices taught in this sutra are inexhaustible.

original: mi zad pa brgyad cu re re la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa brgyad cu re re la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And each of the eighty inexhaustibles should be extensively applied.

original: sbyin pa mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phan ba'i chos thams cad byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phan ba'i chos thams cad byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the inexhaustibility of generosity is called the bodhisattva who performs all the practices of benefit.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, ‚ÄúThe generosity of the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyin ba mi zad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin ba mi zad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The inexhaustibility of generosity is threefold:

original: 'bras bu yongs su bzung ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa dang / gnyen po yongs su bzung ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pas sbyin pa mi zad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su bzung ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa dang / gnyen po yongs su bzung ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pas sbyin pa mi zad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that generosity is inexhaustible due to the purity of the nature of taking up the result, the purity of the nature of abandoning the opposing side, and the purity of the nature of taking up the antidote.

original: 'bras bu yongs su bzung ba yang phyi dang nang gi sbyin pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su bzung ba yang phyi dang nang gi sbyin pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Taking up the result is twofold: the external and the internal, due to the distinction of generosity.

original: de la phyi'i sbyin pa ni zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa nas /
analyzed: de la phyi'i sbyin pa ni zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa nas /
translated: The first, outer generosity, is to give food to those who want food, and so on.

original: rtsed mo thams cad gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i bar gyis bstan /
analyzed: rtsed mo thams cad gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i bar gyis bstan /
translated: The external generosity is taught by the giving of food to those who desire food, up to the giving of all games.

original: nang gi sbyin ba ni rkang pa sbyin pa nas rus pa dang rkang sbyin pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: nang gi sbyin ba ni rkang pa sbyin pa nas rus pa dang rkang sbyin pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: The internal generosity is taught by the giving of feet, up to the giving of bones and marrow.

original: de dag kyang phyi'i rgyal srid yongs su btang ba'i dpes nang gi yon tan gyi rgyal srid phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir phyi'i sbyin pa ni bsdus pa'i don nyi shu bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang phyi'i rgyal srid yongs su btang ba'i dpes nang gi yon tan gyi rgyal srid phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir phyi'i sbyin pa ni bsdus pa'i don nyi shu bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, the external generosity has twenty-four topics of meaning, in order to teach the perfection of the internal kingdom of good qualities by the example of the total giving of the external kingdom.

original: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i @58b mthu'i bsam pa'i sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems can byams pa dran pas yid bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i @58b mthu'i bsam pa'i sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems can byams pa dran pas yid bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The perfection of wealth, the perfection of enjoyment, the perfection of the door of the intention of the power of enjoyment, the perfection of the mental satisfaction of beings through the recollection of love,

original: skyes bu chen po shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor rgya chen po zil gyis gnon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa dang / chos phun sum tshogs pa dang / dgos pa bsam pa la mkhas pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor rgya chen po zil gyis gnon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa dang / chos phun sum tshogs pa dang / dgos pa bsam pa la mkhas pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The perfection of great beings, the perfection of overwhelming a vast retinue, the perfection of great acceptance, the perfection of Dharma, the perfection of skill in intention,

original: dbang phun sum tshogs pa dang / chung ma phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang phun sum tshogs pa dang / chung ma phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: the perfection of power, and the perfection of wife.

original: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba yongs su gtong ba dang / grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa gtong ba'i tshig gnyis kyis dbang phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba yongs su gtong ba dang / grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa gtong ba'i tshig gnyis kyis dbang phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
translated: The two lines giving wealth, grain, treasuries, and granaries and giving villages, cities, and so on show the perfection of power.

original: gzhan ni tshig re re dang go rims bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni tshig re re dang go rims bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: The others are to be applied to each line in order.

original: nang gi sbyin pa ni bsdus pa'i don brgyad po gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / bgo bshas skye bo bskyang ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang rgol ba'i mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / las kyi mtha' la rtog pas bag med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /

original: de dag kyang sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu la sogs pa brgyad cu mdo dag las gsungs pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa rgyan sna tshogs sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu la sogs pa brgyad cu mdo dag las gsungs pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa rgyan sna tshogs sbyin pa'o //
translated: The sutras teach that these are the eighty marks, such as nails the color of copper, and so on.

original: gtsug gi nor bu dang cod pan ni yan lag gi dam pa mgo bo'i rgyan te /
analyzed: gtsug gi nor bu dang cod pan ni yan lag gi dam pa mgo bo'i rgyan te /
translated: The crown jewel and diadem are the head ornament, the best of the body ornaments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dbu'i gtsug tor tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas kyang bltar mi mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir mgo'i rgyan sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dbu'i gtsug tor tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas kyang bltar mi mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir mgo'i rgyan sbyin par byed do //
translated: One gives the head ornament in order to obtain the Tathagata's mark of the ushnisha on the head, which is so lofty that even the Brahma world cannot be seen from its peak.

original: rta la sogs pa bzhon pas ni bgrod par bya ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pas theg pa chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu 'bras bu dang bcas pa 'dis phyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rta la sogs pa bzhon pas ni bgrod par bya ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pas theg pa chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu 'bras bu dang bcas pa 'dis phyin par byed pa'am /
translated: Since vehicles such as horses carry one to the place to be gone to, they are the Great Vehicle, the ten Bodhisattva stages together with their results.

original: 'dir phyin par bya ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rta dang ba glang dang dpung bu chung dang bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyin par bya ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rta dang ba glang dang dpung bu chung dang bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: One gives horses, elephants, carriages, and vehicles in order to go by means of them, or in order to complete the going by means of them.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i dang po la yan lag lnga /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i dang po la yan lag lnga /
translated: The first of the four meditative concentrations has five branches,üîΩthe second has four branches and so on.

original: gnyis pa la bzhi la sogs pa dang / yan lag de dag gi tshogs dge ba la 'dun pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir lus dang sems bde bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skyed mos tshal la sogs pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la bzhi la sogs pa dang / yan lag de dag gi tshogs dge ba la 'dun pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir lus dang sems bde bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skyed mos tshal la sogs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to perfect those branches, he gives the garden and so forth, which are the basis for the physical and mental bliss of virtue, such as the aspiration to virtue, the restraint of the sense faculties and the moderation of food.

original: gang gi gong na byang chub gzhan med pa ni bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi gong na byang chub gzhan med pa ni bla na med pa ste /
translated: Unsurpassed means that there is no enlightenment above it.

original: de'ang yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par rdzogs pa ma lus par chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar thugs su chud pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par rdzogs pa ma lus par chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar thugs su chud pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: It refers to the gnosis of omniscience that fully and perfectly realizes all phenomena without exception in a perfect and unmistaken manner.

original: dga' ba'o cog gi nang na de ni dga' ba mchog yin pas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dga' zhing sdug pa'i mchog bu pho la sogs pa sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'o cog gi nang na de ni dga' ba mchog yin pas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dga' zhing sdug pa'i mchog bu pho la sogs pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: Since it is the supreme joy among all joys, in order to attain that, he gives the supreme joy and delight of the world, such as his son.

original: 'bras bu gang 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po gang sbyin pa 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po gang sbyin pa 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The giving of any object for the sake of any desired result should be applied in the same way to the following perfections.

original: gnas gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnams gnas shing 'dzin pa'i gnas de ni dam pa'i chos kyi mdzod dang bang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnams gnas shing 'dzin pa'i gnas de ni dam pa'i chos kyi mdzod dang bang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The place where the twelve branches of the Tathagata's Excellent Speech are preserved and held is called the treasury and granary of the holy Dharma.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang dran pa gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang dran pa gnyis la bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the two of a bodhisattva's wisdom and mindfulness.

original: byang chub nyid snying po yin pas na byang chub kyi snying po sta /
analyzed: byang chub nyid snying po yin pas na byang chub kyi snying po sta /
translated: Since enlightenment itself is the essence, it is the essence of enlightenment.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /üîΩ'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa @61a * //
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa @61a * //
translated: What is it like?

original: thams cad dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: It is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, endowed with all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: de ltar phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dbang dang ldan pas dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dbang dang ldan pas dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, it is the king of the holy Dharma, endowed with mastery over all perfections.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i chos bdag med pa rtogs pa'i chos la dga' zhing mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lus kyi bde ba dang / sems kyi dga' ba dang / rgyud sim par byed pa'i rtsed mo thams cad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i chos bdag med pa rtogs pa'i chos la dga' zhing mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lus kyi bde ba dang / sems kyi dga' ba dang / rgyud sim par byed pa'i rtsed mo thams cad sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to attain delight and interest in the Dharma, which is the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, free from the stain of subject and object, he gives all the games that bring about physical pleasure, mental joy, and satisfaction of the mind.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi rkang pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pa lhag ma bdun nam bslab pa gsum las lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ma gtogs pa gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi rkang pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pa lhag ma bdun nam bslab pa gsum las lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ma gtogs pa gnyis la bya'o //
translated: The feet of the holy Dharma are the seven remaining members of the holy path of the noble ones, excluding right view, or the three educations, excluding the education in wisdom.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi lag pa ni gdul bya sems can la dam pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi lag pa ni gdul bya sems can la dam pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: The hands of the holy Dharma are the teaching of the holy Dharma to sentient beings, the disciples.

original: de bas na sems can rnams la dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i lag pa byin nas khams gsum gyi 'dam las drang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na sems can rnams la dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i lag pa byin nas khams gsum gyi 'dam las drang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, having given the hand of teaching the holy Dharma to sentient beings, he is said to be the one who pulls them out of the swamp of the three realms.

original: dbang po ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faculties are faith and so on, and the eye and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni don dam pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni don dam pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The eye of the Buddha is the realization of the ultimate.

original: chos kyi spyan ni gsung rab kyi yan lag rnams rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi spyan ni gsung rab kyi yan lag rnams rtogs pa'o //
translated: The eye of the Dharma is the realization of the branches of the scriptures.

original: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas yin la de dag gi mchog ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas yin la de dag gi mchog ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The best of all the disciples and hermit buddhas, who are superior to all the worlds, is called the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: snying po med pa'i lus ni las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa'i lus ni las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: The body without essence is the five aggregates produced by karma and the afflictions.

original: snying po med pa'i lus de la brten nas /
analyzed: snying po med pa'i lus de la brten nas /
translated: Based on that body without essence,

original: snying po de chos kyi sku blang zhing mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir srog gnas pa'i rgyu sha dang khrag yongs su gtong zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: snying po de chos kyi sku blang zhing mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir srog gnas pa'i rgyu sha dang khrag yongs su gtong zhes sbyar ro //
translated: in order to take up the essence, the Dharma body, and to live in nirvana, he gives away his flesh and blood, the causes of life.

original: 'jam pa la sogs pa ni pags pa 'jam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa la sogs pa ni pags pa 'jam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Smoothness and so on are smooth skin and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku ni nang gi nyon mongs pa dang / phyi'i rlung la sogs pas gnod pa byar med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku ni nang gi nyon mongs pa dang / phyi'i rlung la sogs pas gnod pa byar med pa'i phyir /
translated: The body of the Buddha is not harmed by inner afflictions or outer winds, and so on.

original: rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing sra ba dang / sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing sra ba dang / sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be indestructible and solid like a diamond, and firm like the son of NƒÅrƒÅya·πáa.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa yang sbyin pa'i skyon rnam pa bzhi spangs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa yang sbyin pa'i skyon rnam pa bzhi spangs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: The purity of the nature of abandoning adverse factors should be understood through abandoning the four faults of generosity.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po'i skyon dang / bsam pa'i skyon dang / len pa mgron du gnyer ba'i skyon dang / @61b len pa la 'bul ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po'i skyon dang / bsam pa'i skyon dang / len pa mgron du gnyer ba'i skyon dang / @61b len pa la 'bul ba'i skyon no //
translated: The faults of the thing to be given, the faults of the intention, the faults of inviting the recipient, and the faults of offering to the recipient.

original: de dag kyang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de dag kyang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: Moreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the bodhisattvas do not have generosity that seeks out adverse enjoyments, and so on.

original: mi mthun pa'i longs spyod pa dang / sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa dang / gzhan yang de dang mthun pa dag ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po'i skyon no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i longs spyod pa dang / sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa dang / gzhan yang de dang mthun pa dag ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po'i skyon no //
translated: Giving that is not in accord with the Dharma, giving that harms sentient beings, and other similar things are faults in the substance that is given.

original: nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa ni bsam pa'i skyon no //üîΩmgron du gnyer te yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa ni len pa mgron du gnyer ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa ni bsam pa'i skyon no // mgron du gnyer te yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa ni len pa mgron du gnyer ba'i skyon no //
translated: Giving that is motivated by pride and so on is a fault in the intention.üîΩGiving that is given to guests and so on is a fault in the recipient.

original: ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni len pa la 'bul ba'i skyon te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni len pa la 'bul ba'i skyon te /
translated: Giving that is less than what was promised and so on is a fault in the offering to the recipient.

original: mdo'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyang skyon rnam pa 'di bzhi dang mthun mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyang skyon rnam pa 'di bzhi dang mthun mthun du sbyar te /
translated: The remaining words of the sutra should be connected with these four faults in the appropriate manner.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la skyon de dag med pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la skyon de dag med pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva's giving is free of these faults, it is called pure by virtue of eliminating counteragents.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa ni bab col dang / chos bzhin ma yin par longs spyod dag bsgrubs nas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa ni bab col dang / chos bzhin ma yin par longs spyod dag bsgrubs nas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: The generosity of seeking out wealth that is not in accordance with Dharma is the giving of wealth that is acquired through improper means, such as rashness.

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The generosity of bodhisattvas is free of such giving.

original: dngos po'i skyon la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la med par 'og ma dag la yang rgya tshar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i skyon la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la med par 'og ma dag la yang rgya tshar sbyar ro //
translated: The faults of the thing given and so on are also absent in the generosity of bodhisattvas and should be applied to the following.

original: sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa ni nad kyis gdungs pa la sogs pa nad kyi sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir gsod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa ni nad kyis gdungs pa la sogs pa nad kyi sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir gsod par byed pa'am /
translated: The generosity of harming sentient beings is giving that kills those who are afflicted by disease and so on in order to free them from the suffering of disease.

original: srog chags bsad pa'i thabs bslab pa sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: srog chags bsad pa'i thabs bslab pa sbyin pa'am /
translated: Or it is giving the training in the means of killing living beings.

original: mchod sbyin ngan pa yo lang chen po gang du srog chags mang po bsogs nas gsod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa byed cing sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin ngan pa yo lang chen po gang du srog chags mang po bsogs nas gsod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa byed cing sbyin pa'o //
translated: Or it is giving that performs such sacrifices and so on, where many living beings are slaughtered in great festivals of sacrifice.

original: sems khengs pa sngon du byas te /
analyzed: sems khengs pa sngon du byas te /
translated: Giving with a mind that is puffed up,

original: nga rgyal gyi bsam pas gtong ba ni nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi bsam pas gtong ba ni nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: with a thought of pride, is called ‚Äúgiving that produces pride.

original: sems can dgra bos 'jigs pa dang / sems can mdza' bshes la sdug pa dang / sems can tha mal pa la mdzes pas sbyin pa byang chub sems dpa' la med do //
analyzed: sems can dgra bos 'jigs pa dang / sems can mdza' bshes la sdug pa dang / sems can tha mal pa la mdzes pas sbyin pa byang chub sems dpa' la med do //
translated: ‚Äù Giving that is not of a bodhisattva is giving that is fearful of enemies, giving that is fond of friends, and giving that is attractive to strangers.

original: slang ba po sngar mgron du gnyer la phyis mi gtong ba'i sbyin pa med do //üîΩji skad smras pa dang / ji ltar dam bcas pa las bsnyungs te /
analyzed: slang ba po sngar mgron du gnyer la phyis mi gtong ba'i sbyin pa med do // ji skad smras pa dang / ji ltar dam bcas pa las bsnyungs te /
translated: ‚Äú Giving that is not of a bodhisattva‚Äù is giving that invites a guest and then does not give.

original: sbyin pa mi byed kyi /üîΩmtshungs pa 'am @62a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi byed kyi / mtshungs pa 'am @62a * //
translated: ‚Äú Giving that is not of a bodhisattva‚Äù is giving that does not give less than what was said and promised.

original: lhag par byed pas ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: lhag par byed pas ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: ‚Äú Giving that is not of a bodhisattva‚Äù is giving that does not give less than what was said, but gives the same or more.

original: dngos po bzang po yod pa tha chad dang ngan pa sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po bzang po yod pa tha chad dang ngan pa sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: ‚Äú Giving that is not of a bodhisattva‚Äù is giving that does not give a bad thing, a worthless thing, a thing of poor quality, when a good thing is available.

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la mi mkho ba'i dngos po gtong ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la mi mkho ba'i dngos po gtong ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Giving that is not of a bodhisattva‚Äù is giving that gives a thing that is not useful to either oneself or others.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pas sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pas sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Giving that is not of a bodhisattva‚Äù is giving that is not done with a superior intention.

original: dngos po dam pa slang ba'i phyir ngan pa gtong ba ni /üîΩg-yo sgyu'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dam pa slang ba'i phyir ngan pa gtong ba ni / g-yo sgyu'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is given with a bad attitude is giving that is given with a bad attitude.üîΩGiving that is given with deceit is giving that is given in order to obtain a valuable object in return.

original: nor bu dang mu tig dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa 'dra bar bcos pa sbyin pa ni bcos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa 'dra bar bcos pa sbyin pa ni bcos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is given with a pretense is giving that is given with a pretense of being a benefactor.

original: rol mo'i rnam par smin pa la chags shing 'phral du yang rtsed mo'i dga' bas sems g-yengs bzhin rol mo byed pa rol mo mkhan la gtong ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgod pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rol mo'i rnam par smin pa la chags shing 'phral du yang rtsed mo'i dga' bas sems g-yengs bzhin rol mo byed pa rol mo mkhan la gtong ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgod pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is given with a view to the maturation of karma is giving that is given by one who is attached to the maturation of karma, who is distracted by the joy of play, and who is playing a musical instrument, such as a flute, while giving to a musician.

original: smad 'tshong ma la sogs pa'i yan lag spyad pa'i phyir gtong ba ni log pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma la sogs pa'i yan lag spyad pa'i phyir gtong ba ni log pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is given with a wrong view is giving that is given in order to enjoy the limbs of a prostitute, and so on.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa la yid mi ches pa'i sbyin pa ni gti mug gi bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa la yid mi ches pa'i sbyin pa ni gti mug gi bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is given with a deluded attitude is giving that is given by one who does not believe in karma and its maturation.

original: dngos po 'di la ma btang na gdon mi za bas chad pas bcad pa dang bsad pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam nas gtong ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po 'di la ma btang na gdon mi za bas chad pas bcad pa dang bsad pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam nas gtong ba ni /
translated: Giving that is given with a fear of loss is giving that is given with the thought, ‚ÄúIf I do not give this object, I will certainly be punished, killed, and so on.‚Äù

original: tshol ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving with the thought of seeking is giving with a distorted thought.

original: rtag par lta ba la sogs pa la zhen nas gtong ba ni phyin ci log gi bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par lta ba la sogs pa la zhen nas gtong ba ni phyin ci log gi bsam pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving while attached to the view of permanence, etc. is giving with a distorted thought.

original: gtong ba la dga' ba'i bsam pa mngon du ma gyur bzhin du gtong ba ni ma dad par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba la dga' ba'i bsam pa mngon du ma gyur bzhin du gtong ba ni ma dad par sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving while the thought of delight in giving is not manifest is giving without faith.

original: dngos po gtong bar mi 'dod bzhin du gtong ba ni mi dga' bar sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gtong bar mi 'dod bzhin du gtong ba ni mi dga' bar sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving while not desiring to give the thing is giving without joy.

original: dngos po la chags bzhin du gtong ba ni nye bar gnas pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la chags bzhin du gtong ba ni nye bar gnas pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving while attached to the thing is giving with attachment.

original: gang zag 'di la ma sbyin na pha ma la sogs pa su yang rung ba bdag la mi dga' bar 'gyur ro snyam nas gtong ba ni ngor bltas nas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag 'di la ma sbyin na pha ma la sogs pa su yang rung ba bdag la mi dga' bar 'gyur ro snyam nas gtong ba ni ngor bltas nas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving while thinking, ‚ÄúIf I do not give to this person, anyone of them, father, mother, etc. will be displeased with me‚Äù is giving with regard to one‚Äôs reputation.

original: 'di la ni sbyin 'di la ni mi sbyin snyam pa'i bsam pas gtong ba ni sems can tha dad pa'i sbyin pa ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni sbyin 'di la ni mi sbyin snyam pa'i bsam pas gtong ba ni sems can tha dad pa'i sbyin pa ste bstan pa'o //
translated: Giving with the thought, ‚ÄúI will give to this one, but not to that one‚Äù is giving with discrimination among sentient beings.

original: tshig lhag ma gsum ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: tshig lhag ma gsum ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The remaining three terms are explanations.

original: 'di la sbyin na 'bras bu dang phan yon che bar 'gyur snyam nas de la gtong ba ni /üîΩsbyin pa'i gnas 'dam zhing sbyin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la sbyin na 'bras bu dang phan yon che bar 'gyur snyam nas de la gtong ba ni / sbyin pa'i gnas 'dam zhing sbyin pa yin la /
translated: One gives to that person, thinking, If I give to this person, the result and benefit will be great.

original: 'di la byin na 'bras bu dang phan yon chung bar 'gyur snyam nas gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin par brnyas shing sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la byin na 'bras bu dang phan yon chung bar 'gyur snyam nas gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin par brnyas shing sbyin pa ste /
translated: One gives, thinking, If I give to this person, the result and benefit will be small.

original: bsam pa'i sgo nas sems can tha dad par dbye ba de lta bu @62b yang med la /üîΩtshig gis kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i sgo nas sems can tha dad par dbye ba de lta bu @62b yang med la / tshig gis kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa la /
translated: There is no such differentiation of sentient beings in terms of intention.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o zhes bstod pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba la tshul khrims 'chal ba'o zhes smad de mtho dman du phye nas sbyin pa med par sbyar ro //üîΩ'di la 'di lta bu zhig sbyin na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o zhes bstod pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba la tshul khrims 'chal ba'o zhes smad de mtho dman du phye nas sbyin pa med par sbyar ro // 'di la 'di lta bu zhig sbyin na /
translated: One gives, thinking, I will praise the one who has morality, saying, 'He has morality,' and I will disparage the one who lacks morality, saying, 'He lacks morality.'

original: phyir yang dngos po 'ga' zhig sbyin par 'gyur ro snyam nas gtong ba ni lan la re ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir yang dngos po 'ga' zhig sbyin par 'gyur ro snyam nas gtong ba ni lan la re ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: One gives, thinking, If I give this to this person, he will give me something in return.

original: gang zag 'di ni sbyin pa byed pa gtong phod pa'o zhes grags pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i phyir gtong ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni sbyin pa byed pa gtong phod pa'o zhes grags pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i phyir gtong ba ni /
translated: Giving for the sake of fame, etc.

original: grags pa la sogs pa'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa la sogs pa'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
translated: is giving for the sake of reputation, etc.üîΩGiving while boasting,

original: bdag ni gtong phod cing sbyin pa'i bdag po yin gyi gzhan ni de lta ma yin no zhes smra zhing gtong ba ni /
analyzed: bdag ni gtong phod cing sbyin pa'i bdag po yin gyi gzhan ni de lta ma yin no zhes smra zhing gtong ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúI am a generous donor, but not others,‚Äù

original: bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: is giving for the sake of self-praise and disparaging others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i snga rol nyid nas kyang yid dga' la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i snga rol nyid nas kyang yid dga' la /
translated: The bodhisattva is joyful even before giving,

original: sbyin pa'i tshe na yang sems dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshe na yang sems dga' bar byed cing /
translated: and his mind is joyful while giving.üîΩAnd after giving, he has no regrets.

original: byin pas kyang 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba dang / yid la gcags pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sbyin pa med par rim bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: byin pas kyang 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba dang / yid la gcags pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sbyin pa med par rim bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, he has no regretful giving, no remorseful giving, and no regretful giving.

original: slong ba po legs par 'dos na skyen par mi sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: slong ba po legs par 'dos na skyen par mi sbyin pa ni /
translated: Giving slowly to a beggar who is in a hurry

original: gnod par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par sbyin pa'o //
translated: is giving harm.

original: slang ba po'i rigs dang rus la sogs pa'i skyon brjod nas gtong ba ni gzhan gyi re ba 'bab pa'i sbyin pa'o//
analyzed: slang ba po'i rigs dang rus la sogs pa'i skyon brjod nas gtong ba ni gzhan gyi re ba 'bab pa'i sbyin pa'o//
translated: Giving after mentioning the faults of the recipient's class, caste, and so on, is giving that causes others to lose hope.

original: sbyin pa byin nas slong ba rnams la khyod 'di dang 'di ltar phan btags so zhes spyos te gtong ba ni smad pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin nas slong ba rnams la khyod 'di dang 'di ltar phan btags so zhes spyos te gtong ba ni smad pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving after reproaching the recipients, saying, I have helped you in this and that way, is giving that is contemptuous.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la chags bzhin du gtong ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa la re ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la chags bzhin du gtong ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa la re ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving while attached to the fruitions of giving is giving that hopes for the ripening of karma.

original: 'di tsam cig sbyin no zhes gtong ba ni dpags te sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam cig sbyin no zhes gtong ba ni dpags te sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving by measuring, saying, I will give this much, is giving that is measured.

original: dngos po gang thabs ji lta bur btang na slong ba po'i khro ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i sbyin pa ni khro ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang thabs ji lta bur btang na slong ba po'i khro ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i sbyin pa ni khro ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that generates anger and so on in the recipient, depending on the thing given and the manner in which it is given, is giving that generates anger and so on.

original: slong ba zas la brkam pa dang nad pa la sogs pa la ha cang bsod pa dang mang du sbyin pa ni slong ba rnams gnod pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba zas la brkam pa dang nad pa la sogs pa la ha cang bsod pa dang mang du sbyin pa ni slong ba rnams gnod pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving very good and abundant things to those who beg, such as those who are greedy for food and the sick, is giving that harms the recipients.

original: slong ba po'i lus gzugs dang / chas la sogs pa 'phyas btags nas me tog phreng la sogs pa ltar dngos po de dag mgo dang mgrin pa la sogs par btags shing bcings nas gtong ba ni 'phya ba dang co 'dri ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba po'i lus gzugs dang / chas la sogs pa 'phyas btags nas me tog phreng la sogs pa ltar dngos po de dag mgo dang mgrin pa la sogs par btags shing bcings nas gtong ba ni 'phya ba dang co 'dri ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The derisive gift is when one gives to beggars after having insulted their bodies, their dress, etc., as if they were garlands of flowers, having tied and bound their heads, necks, etc.

original: phyin phyogs su byin pa ni sa la sogs pa ni dngos @63a * //üîΩsu zad do //
analyzed: phyin phyogs su byin pa ni sa la sogs pa ni dngos @63a * // su zad do //
translated: The contrary gift is when one gives earth, etc., which are not gifts.

original: ched 'ga' gtong ched 'ga' mi gtong ba ni mi rtag pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ched 'ga' gtong ched 'ga' mi gtong ba ni mi rtag pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The uncertain gift is when one gives sometimes and sometimes one does not give.

original: sbyin pa la ma goms pas gang gi tshe slong ba po 'ongs pa de dang de'i tshe sbyin pa'i tshul la ma byang bar gtong ba ni shin tu ma sbyangs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la ma goms pas gang gi tshe slong ba po 'ongs pa de dang de'i tshe sbyin pa'i tshul la ma byang bar gtong ba ni shin tu ma sbyangs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The unrefined gift is when one gives without skill, not knowing the proper way to give, when the petitioner has come at an improper time.

original: gang zag de yang gtong bar byed na bdag gis ci'i phyir mi gtong zhes gtong ba ni gzhan la snyogs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag de yang gtong bar byed na bdag gis ci'i phyir mi gtong zhes gtong ba ni gzhan la snyogs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The rivalrous gift is when one gives, thinking, If that person gives, I also should give.

original: bdag nyid tshe'i mchod rten dang / bran g-yog la sogs pa'i phyir gtong ba ni yongs su chad par byas te sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid tshe'i mchod rten dang / bran g-yog la sogs pa'i phyir gtong ba ni yongs su chad par byas te sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is interrupted is giving that is interrupted for the sake of one's own life, or for the sake of a stupa, or for the sake of a slave or servant.

original: mang du gzas pa las nyung du gtong ba ni ji ltar bstabs pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa'o //üîΩgtang bar bya ba'i dngos po nges par gtang bar bya bar bsams pa las /
analyzed: mang du gzas pa las nyung du gtong ba ni ji ltar bstabs pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa'o // gtang bar bya ba'i dngos po nges par gtang bar bya bar bsams pa las /
translated: Giving that is less than what was offered is giving less than what was offered.

original: chags pa'i dbang du gyur bzhin du gtong ba ni spro ba las mi spro bar gyur ba'i sbyin pa'o //üîΩbkren zhing phongs pa'i slong ba po yod bzhin du /
analyzed: chags pa'i dbang du gyur bzhin du gtong ba ni spro ba las mi spro bar gyur ba'i sbyin pa'o // bkren zhing phongs pa'i slong ba po yod bzhin du /
translated: Giving that is not enthusiastic is giving that is done while under the influence of attachment, although one has reflected on the necessity of giving up the object that is to be given.üîΩGiving that is not to a worthy recipient is giving to someone who is not a worthy recipient, although there is a worthy recipient present.

original: zhing ma yin no snyam nas bkren pa ma yin zhing phongs pa ma yin pa la gtong ba ni sems can zhing ma yin zhes sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhing ma yin no snyam nas bkren pa ma yin zhing phongs pa ma yin pa la gtong ba ni sems can zhing ma yin zhes sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving that is not to a sentient being is giving to someone who is not a sentient being, although there is a sentient being present.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gtang bar bya ba'i dngos po che chung ci bdog pa gtang bar bya ba yin pas dngos po chung du la brnyas shing sbyin par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gtang bar bya ba'i dngos po che chung ci bdog pa gtang bar bya ba yin pas dngos po chung du la brnyas shing sbyin par yang mi byed la /
translated: A bodhisattva does not give with contempt, thinking that a small gift is not worthy of being given, because whatever he or she has that is to be given is to be given.

original: dngos po snying po med par rigs pas rgya chen po la snyems shing sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po snying po med par rigs pas rgya chen po la snyems shing sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: One should not give with pride, thinking, ‚ÄúI am giving a great deal,‚Äù because things are not really substantial.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub las gzhan du bsngo ba ni log par bsgrub pa'i sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub las gzhan du bsngo ba ni log par bsgrub pa'i sbyin pa ste /
translated: Giving that is wrongly accomplished is giving that is dedicated to a result other than unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de yang skye bar 'dod pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya bas bshad de /
analyzed: de yang skye bar 'dod pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya bas bshad de /
translated: This is explained in the verse, ‚ÄúGiving that is desired as rebirth.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pas skye ba gang yang rung bar smin pa la skye bar 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pas skye ba gang yang rung bar smin pa la skye bar 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving that is desired as rebirth is giving that ripens in any rebirth.

original: gang dag tu skye bar 'dod pa ni gzugs dang longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig phyi ma rnams kyis bshad de /
analyzed: gang dag tu skye bar 'dod pa ni gzugs dang longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig phyi ma rnams kyis bshad de /
translated: The verse explains that one desires rebirth in places where there is beauty, wealth, and so on.

original: de la gzugs bzang po dang / longs spyod chen po dang / dbang phyug chen po la mngon par dga' bas sbyin pa gtong ba ni mi'i nang du skye bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs bzang po dang / longs spyod chen po dang / dbang phyug chen po la mngon par dga' bas sbyin pa gtong ba ni mi'i nang du skye bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Giving that is desired as rebirth in the human realm is giving that is dedicated to the result of rebirth in the human realm.

original: brgya byin la sogs par skye bar smon cing sbyin pa btang ba ni lha'i nang du skye bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs par skye bar smon cing sbyin pa btang ba ni lha'i nang du skye bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Giving while aspiring to be born as Indra and so on is giving with the desire for birth in the god realms.

original: gzhon nu ni rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ni rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug ma thob pa'o //
translated: A youth is one who has not yet obtained the sovereignty of a kingdom.

original: tshe 'di nyi tshe la sbyin pa gtong ba ni tshe gcig tu zad pa'i sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyi tshe la sbyin pa gtong ba ni tshe gcig tu zad pa'i sbyin pa ste /
translated: Giving in this life alone is giving that is exhausted in a single lifetime.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshe gcig sbyin pa btang ba tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas phyin chad chog cing mi bdog pa'i sbyin pa med @63b ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshe gcig sbyin pa btang ba tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas phyin chad chog cing mi bdog pa'i sbyin pa med @63b ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not consider giving in a single lifetime to be sufficient, they do not give with the thought that they will be satisfied in this life and will have nothing left to give in future lives.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par smin pa la mi lta zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par smin pa la mi lta zhing /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not look to the maturation of their giving and so on,

original: sems can thams cad la lta bas sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams thams cad tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu khyad par du 'gyur zhing rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar bsngo'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta bas sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams thams cad tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu khyad par du 'gyur zhing rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar bsngo'o //
translated: but they dedicate all their merit of giving and so on from one lifetime to the next to the attainment of the result that accords with the cause, the result of separation, the result of conscious effort and the result of separation.

original: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa'i phyed du ni mi bsngo la /
analyzed: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa'i phyed du ni mi bsngo la /
translated: They do not dedicate it to the result of karmic maturation, the result of separation or the result of conscious effort.

original: de ltar sbyin pa'i tshogs bsags pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa las gzhan du mi bsngo bas /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa'i tshogs bsags pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa las gzhan du mi bsngo bas /
translated: Thus, the accumulation of the giving collection is not dedicated to anything other than omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa med do zhes gsungs so //üîΩsdom brtson pa rnams la zas dang skom lhag par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa med do zhes gsungs so // sdom brtson pa rnams la zas dang skom lhag par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Therefore, there is no giving that is not dedicated to the mind of omniscience.üîΩGiving to those who are diligent in vows is giving that is excessive in food and drink.

original: sgog btsong dang sha chang mi za zhing mi mthun pa dag la de dag bsres shing 'bags pa gtong ba ni rung ba ma yin pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sgog btsong dang sha chang mi za zhing mi mthun pa dag la de dag bsres shing 'bags pa gtong ba ni rung ba ma yin pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving to those who do not eat garlic, onions, meat, or alcohol, but who are given food that is mixed with or contaminated by those things, is improper giving.

original: rang gi g-yog 'khor la sogs pa ma byin par dang po gzhan dag la gtong ba ni dus la ma bab par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi g-yog 'khor la sogs pa ma byin par dang po gzhan dag la gtong ba ni dus la ma bab par sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving to others first, without giving to one's own retinue and so forth, is giving at the wrong time.

original: dug dang mtshon sbyin pa'i nang du chang sbyin pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: dug dang mtshon sbyin pa'i nang du chang sbyin pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: Giving poison and weapons should be included in giving alcohol.

original: lug la sogs pa bsad de sha khrag la sogs pa ni sems can la tho 'tshams shing sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lug la sogs pa bsad de sha khrag la sogs pa ni sems can la tho 'tshams shing sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving the flesh, blood, and so forth of sheep and so forth that have been killed is giving that harms sentient beings.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rab tu dbye ba rgya cher bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor ba'i rab tu dbye ba rgya cher bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the divisions of the avoidance of adverse factors in detail,

original: mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach them in brief,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa ni mkhas pas smad pa med do zhes gsungs te /üîΩsbyin pa gang tshe 'di la bde yang tshe phyi ma la mi phan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la mi bde zhing mi phan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa ni mkhas pas smad pa med do zhes gsungs te / sbyin pa gang tshe 'di la bde yang tshe phyi ma la mi phan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la mi bde zhing mi phan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúThe generosity of the bodhisattvas is not disparaged by the wise.‚ÄùüîΩGenerosity that is pleasant in this life but not beneficial in future lives, that is neither pleasant nor beneficial in this life or future lives, and that is reprehensible in this life,

original: tshe phyi ma la kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa ni /
translated: reprehensible in future lives, and reprehensible in this life and future lives,

original: mkhas pas smad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas smad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called ‚Äúdisparaged by the wise.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa byang chub sems dpa' la med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa byang chub sems dpa' la med do //
translated: The bodhisattvas do not have such generosity.

original: gnyen po yongs su bzung ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni gnyen po rnam pa gsum yongs su bzung bas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po yongs su bzung ba'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni gnyen po rnam pa gsum yongs su bzung bas rig par bya ste /
translated: The purity of the nature of taking up the remedies should be understood as taking up the three kinds of remedies:

original: 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa'i gnyen po dang / bla na med pa'o //üîΩde la sbyin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa'i gnyen po dang / bla na med pa'o // de la sbyin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the mundane remedies, the supramundane remedies of the training, and the unsurpassable remedies.

original: khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po bstan /üîΩsbyin pa de ni 'bras bu @64a * //üîΩrgyu mthun pa rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po bstan / sbyin pa de ni 'bras bu @64a * // rgyu mthun pa rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The mundane remedies are indicated by the passage from ‚ÄúThis generosity is accomplished in the aspect of emptiness‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is not mixed with the three realms.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs bsags pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa'i gnyen po bstan /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs bsags pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa'i gnyen po bstan /
translated: The supramundane remedies of the training are indicated by the passage from ‚ÄúThis generosity is the cause and condition for attaining the result of separation‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is the accumulation of the path to enlightenment.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa de ni yang dag par bsngos pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni yang dag par bsngos pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The unsurpassable remedies are indicated by the passage from ‚ÄúThis generosity is dedicated‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is the cause for the attainment of the great enlightenment.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bla na med pa bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bla na med pa bstan to //
translated: This generosity is dedicated to the pristine wisdom of omniscience.üîΩThis generosity is accomplished by the aspect of emptiness.

original: sbyin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa de dag rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis bskyed cing de dag dang ma bral bar spyad pas 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa dngos po dang mtshan mar bzung nas
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa de dag rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis bskyed cing de dag dang ma bral bar spyad pas 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa dngos po dang mtshan mar bzung nas
translated: Since those generosities are produced by the three doors of liberation and are practiced without being separated from them, they are not exhausted like the generosity of mundane beings who give while apprehending things and signs.

original: byin pa ltar de dag mi zad de stong pa nyid la sogs pa ltar na nam yang mi zad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin pa ltar de dag mi zad de stong pa nyid la sogs pa ltar na nam yang mi zad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnever exhausted‚Äù is that they are never exhausted like emptiness and so on.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'i chos yang dag pa'i mtha' la bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'i chos yang dag pa'i mtha' la bya ste /
translated: Unconditioned phenomena are ultimate reality, which is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: de thob pa'i phyir bsngos pas na mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir bsngos pas na mi zad pa'o //
translated: Since it is dedicated for the sake of attaining that, it is inexhaustible.

original: yang dag par zin pas ni phyin ci ma log par zin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par zin pas ni phyin ci ma log par zin pa ste /
translated: Correctly grasped means grasped without error.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas zin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas zin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it is ‚Äúaccompanied by the bodhisattva‚Äôs proper mental attention.‚Äù

original: khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa ni khams gsum pa de dang / de dag gis sred pas bdag gis ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa ni khams gsum pa de dang / de dag gis sred pas bdag gis ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúnot mixed with the three realms‚Äù because it is not made by craving for the three realms.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i sku la bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i sku la bya bar 'dod de /
translated: ‚ÄúLiberation‚Äù is to be understood as the body of liberation.

original: de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs kyis 'grub la /
analyzed: de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs kyis 'grub la /
translated: It is accomplished by the collection of generosity and so forth.

original: de las kyang sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas sbyin pa de ni 'bras bu rgyu mthun pas rnam pa re grol ba ste /
analyzed: de las kyang sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas sbyin pa de ni 'bras bu rgyu mthun pas rnam pa re grol ba ste /
translated: And from that, generosity arises uninterruptedly. Therefore, that generosity is liberated in every way by its natural outcome.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason, it is called ‚Äúinexhaustible.‚Äù

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa ni bdud rnams tshar gcod par 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gtogs pas lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pa tshar gcod cing de dag gis med pa'i byar mi nus
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa ni bdud rnams tshar gcod par 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gtogs pas lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pa tshar gcod cing de dag gis med pa'i byar mi nus
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs generosity is included in the collections of merit and wisdom. Therefore, it conquers the mƒÅras, such as the mƒÅra of the sons of the gods, and cannot be destroyed by them.

original: pas na sbyin pa de ni bdud thams cad shin tu tshar gcod pa ste de'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pas na sbyin pa de ni bdud thams cad shin tu tshar gcod pa ste de'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that generosity is the complete destruction of all demons. For that reason, it is called ‚Äúinexhaustible.‚Äù

original: ser sna dang bdag dang gzhan du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas te /
analyzed: ser sna dang bdag dang gzhan du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas te /
translated: It does not coexist with the afflictions such as stinginess and the grasping of self and other,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zad par bya bar mi nus pas na mi zad par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zad par bya bar mi nus pas na mi zad par sbyar ro //
translated: and it is applied as inexhaustible because the opposing side is unable to destroy it.

original: sa dang po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas thob par 'gyur bas na khyad @64b par 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas thob par 'gyur bas na khyad @64b par 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the first ground is attained by completing the perfection of generosity, it is called ‚Äúthe progress of distinction.‚Äù

original: kha cig gi sbyin pa yin yang dug dang mtshon la sogs pa skyon dang bcas pa lta bu ma yin gyi byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pas na legs par byas pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gi sbyin pa yin yang dug dang mtshon la sogs pa skyon dang bcas pa lta bu ma yin gyi byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pas na legs par byas pa nges pa'o //
translated: The generosity of some, even though it is generosity, is like poison and weapons, etc., and has faults. But the bodhisattva‚Äôs generosity is completely irreproachable, so it is ‚Äúwell done and certain.‚Äù

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i lam ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yin la sbyin pa nyid bsod nams kyi tshogs su gtogs pas byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i lam ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yin la sbyin pa nyid bsod nams kyi tshogs su gtogs pas byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The path for attaining unsurpassed enlightenment is the accumulations of merit and wisdom. Since generosity is included in the accumulation of merit, it is the accumulation of the path to enlightenment.

original: gong du bsngo bar bya ba der bsngos pa ni yang dag par bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bsngo bar bya ba der bsngos pa ni yang dag par bsngos pa'o //
translated: The dedication of generosity to unsurpassed enlightenment is the dedication of the gift.üîΩThat generosity is the result that is the natural outflow of the ornament of the array of the essence of enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa de ni byang chub snying po rgyan bkod pa rnam par grol ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste zhes bya ba byang chub kyi snying po ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni byang chub snying po rgyan bkod pa rnam par grol ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste zhes bya ba byang chub kyi snying po ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: The essence of enlightenment is the attainment of manifest enlightenment.

original: de'i rgyan bkod pa ni gang gis byang chub de thob pa'i rgyu de sbyin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyan bkod pa ni gang gis byang chub de thob pa'i rgyu de sbyin pa la bya'o //
translated: The ornament of the array of that is the cause of attaining that enlightenment, which is generosity.

original: de'i phyir rnam par grol ba 'bras bur gyur pa dang mthun pa'i rgyu yin pas na rnam par grol ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par grol ba 'bras bur gyur pa dang mthun pa'i rgyu yin pas na rnam par grol ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is the cause that is concordant with the result that is the natural outflow of liberation, it is called the result that is the natural outflow of liberation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho ba yin pas de'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho ba yin pas de'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva is the livelihood of all sentient beings in this life and in other lives, and therefore it is inexhaustible.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung bar mi nus pas na mu med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung bar mi nus pas na mu med pa'o //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva cannot be measured by saying it is this much, and therefore it is boundless.

original: nams kyang zad cing 'bri ba med pas na yongs su mi 'bri ba'o //
analyzed: nams kyang zad cing 'bri ba med pas na yongs su mi 'bri ba'o //
translated: It is never exhausted or diminished, and therefore it is not diminished.

original: sbyin pa de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs su yang ma gyur pas kun tu mi gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs su yang ma gyur pas kun tu mi gtogs pa'o //
translated: That generosity is not on the side of samsara or nirvana, and therefore it is not included in either.

original: 'das pa'i dus su sbyin la ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mi sbyin pa med pas yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su sbyin la ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mi sbyin pa med pas yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: It is not that one gives in the past and does not give in the future, and therefore it is not interrupted.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad 'dra bar gtong bas na yangs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad 'dra bar gtong bas na yangs pa'o //
translated: It is vast, for one gives away all outer and inner things equally.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la ma chags pas na mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la ma chags pas na mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is not located, for one is not attached to the results of generosity.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'khor ba'i bar du thug pa med pas na thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'khor ba'i bar du thug pa med pas na thug pa med pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible, for it lasts until the end of samsara in the future.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres pas na kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres pas na kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: It is irreproachable, since it is not mixed with sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: sus kyang skyon gdags su med pas na ma skur ba'o //
analyzed: sus kyang skyon gdags su med pas na ma skur ba'o //
translated: It is not deprecatory, since it cannot be faulted by anyone.

original: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas na mi thul ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas na mi thul ba'o //
translated: It is invincible, since it is not overcome by the stinginess which is the resistance to generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni 'jig rten pa brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pas zil gyis ma non pas na zil gyis mi non pa'o //üîΩthams cad @65a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni 'jig rten pa brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pas zil gyis ma non pas na zil gyis mi non pa'o // thams cad @65a * //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva is not overcome by the generosity of worldly people such as Sakra and Brahma, or by the supramundane generosity of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: mkhyen pa nyid ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste /
translated: It is dedicated to the knowledge of a Omniscient One, since it is dedicated to the attainment of the knowledge of a Omniscient One.

original: rnam pa de dag gi phyir mi zad pa yang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gi phyir mi zad pa yang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: These are the aspects of inexhaustibility, which should be applied appropriately.

original: sbyin pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: Generosity has been explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / tshul khrims mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos bzhin byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: // / tshul khrims mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos bzhin byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the imperishability of morality is called the bodhisattva who acts in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,üîΩit is said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa drug cu rtsa lngas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa mi zad pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa drug cu rtsa lngas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa mi zad pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the aggregate of morality of the bodhisattvas is imperishable through thirty-five aspects.‚Äù

original: de la tshul khrims mi zad pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims mi zad pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Therein, the imperishability of morality is fivefold:

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos nyid kyi tshul khrims dang / lam gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dag pas zab pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos nyid kyi tshul khrims dang / lam gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dag pas zab pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of correct undertaking, the morality of reality, the morality characterized by the two paths, the morality characterized by the three doors of liberation, and the morality of profundity due to the purification of the counteragents to morality.

original: de la rnam pa drug cu rtsa lngas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa mi zad pa yin no zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa la sogs pa rnam pa drug cu rtsa lnga lta bu'i
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug cu rtsa lngas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa mi zad pa yin no zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa la sogs pa rnam pa drug cu rtsa lnga lta bu'i
translated: The purity of the bodhisattvas' aggregate of morality is imperishable through the sixty-five aspects.

original: tshul gyis yongs su dag pas na sems can gzhan dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims ltar rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi zad pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshul gyis yongs su dag pas na sems can gzhan dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims ltar rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi zad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is imperishable because it is pure through the aspect of the sixty-five aspects such as non-harmfulness to all sentient beings, and so it is not interrupted like the morality of other sentient beings, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, the morality of true commitment is threefold:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don bya ba'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don bya ba'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings, and the morality of gathering virtuous dharmas.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With regard to the morality of restraint, it is said, not harming any sentient being, and so on.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyang mdor bsdus na rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyang mdor bsdus na rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: The ethics of restraint are also indicated in brief by four aspects:

original: nyes par spyod pa la phyir log pa dang / bdag nyid 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi snod du rung ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs yongs su bzung bas bstan te /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la phyir log pa dang / bdag nyid 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi snod du rung ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs yongs su bzung bas bstan te /
translated: refraining from negative action, making oneself a fit vessel for the noble ethics, eliminating counteragents and taking up the antidotes.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ni sems can gyi don du rang gi lus dang srog kyang gtong bar byed @65b na bdag gi don du sems can pha rol po'i srog gcod pa lta ga la byed pas sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ni sems can gyi don du rang gi lus dang srog kyang gtong bar byed @65b na bdag gi don du sems can pha rol po'i srog gcod pa lta ga la byed pas sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas give away their own bodies and lives for the sake of sentient beings, so how could they take the lives of other sentient beings for their own sake?

original: rang gi longs spyod kyang gzhan la gtong bar byed na gzhan gyi longs spyod ma byin par lta ga la len pas gzhan gyi longs spyod dag la mi rku ba dang / tshe rabs thams cad du tshangs par spyod pa'i phyir bdag gi chung ma yang sems can 'dod pa la yongs su gtong na gzhan gyi chung ma la lta chags par ga la byed pas gzhan gyi chung ma dag la ma chags pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi longs spyod kyang gzhan la gtong bar byed na gzhan gyi longs spyod ma byin par lta ga la len pas gzhan gyi longs spyod dag la mi rku ba dang / tshe rabs thams cad du tshangs par spyod pa'i phyir bdag gi chung ma yang sems can 'dod pa la yongs su gtong na gzhan gyi chung ma la lta chags par ga la byed pas gzhan gyi chung ma dag la ma chags pa dang /
translated: They do not have sexual relations with others' partners.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed /
translated: Bodhisattvas do what they say.

original: de bzhin du smra zhing gzhan du sgrub pa ma yin pas sems can thams cad la mi slu ba dang / pha rol po'i 'khor bdag gir bya ba'i ched du pha bi la blangs nas tshu bi la snyod pa dang / tshu bi la blangs nas pha bi la snyod par mi byed pa'i phyir bdag gi 'khor gyis chog par 'dzin pas phra ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra zhing gzhan du sgrub pa ma yin pas sems can thams cad la mi slu ba dang / pha rol po'i 'khor bdag gir bya ba'i ched du pha bi la blangs nas tshu bi la snyod pa dang / tshu bi la blangs nas pha bi la snyod par mi byed pa'i phyir bdag gi 'khor gyis chog par 'dzin pas phra ma med pa dang /
translated: They do not deceive sentient beings, for they do not say one thing and do another. They have no slander, for they are content with their own retinue and do not take the retinue of others for themselves, nor do they take the food of others and give it to their own retinue.

original: pha rol pos ngan du smras shing cho rigs la sogs pa'i sgo nas zher 'debs pa'i tshig mi smra ba'i phyir tshig drag po bzod pas mi brlang ba dang / rgyal po'i gtam dang / rkun po'i gtam la sogs pa'i tshig don med pa mi smra ste /
