original: gzhan bde ba la dga' bas pha rol po'i longs spyod bdag gir bya bar brnab sems med pa dang / 'phral du ngan du brjod pa dang / lkog nas ngan du smras pa'i tshig gi lan bzod pas gnod sems med pa dang ; mu stegs can la sogs pa ston pa gzhan gyi bstan pa med pas yang dag par lta ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan bde ba la dga' bas pha rol po'i longs spyod bdag gir bya bar brnab sems med pa dang / 'phral du ngan du brjod pa dang / lkog nas ngan du smras pa'i tshig gi lan bzod pas gnod sems med pa dang ; mu stegs can la sogs pa ston pa gzhan gyi bstan pa med pas yang dag par lta ba ste /

analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu skye bo mi srun pa la sogs pa dang / ma 'dres pas tshul khrims ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: tshig de lngas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa bstan to //

translated: It is called noble morality because it is not subject to the power of the addictions and the nonvirtuous spiritual guides which would cause the degeneration of morality, and because one goes as one wishes, through familiarity with the power of discernment and the power of meditation.

original: mkhas pa ni 'phags pa rnams so //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni 'phags pa rnams so //

original: tshul khrims ji ltar blangs pa'i dran pas tshul khrims ma nyams par bsrungs la /
analyzed: tshul khrims ji ltar blangs pa'i dran pas tshul khrims ma nyams par bsrungs la /
translated: One should protect morality without degeneration through mindfulness of the morality as it was undertaken.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i nyes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i nyes pa la sogs pa shes bzhin gyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i nyes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i nyes pa la sogs pa shes bzhin gyis rtogs par bya ste /

original: nyes pa byung ngo cog tshul bzhin du 'chos pa ni rnam pa mchog gi tshul khrims zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyes pa byung ngo cog tshul bzhin du 'chos pa ni rnam pa mchog gi tshul khrims zhes bya ste /
translated: The morality of the best aspect is the rectification of any faults that occur.

original: tshul khrims ji ltar blangs pa bzhin du bsrung ba dang / nyes pa byung ngo cog phyir 'chos pa gnyis kyis tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: It is the morality of the best aspect because it is the completion of morality by means of the two, the protection of morality just as it was received and the rectification of any faults that occur.

original: rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa'i 'khor thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa'i 'khor thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: It is the morality of the irreproachable because it is irreproachable in all circles, such as the circles of the nobility and the brahmans.

original: gang gi sgo nas kyang skyon gdags su med pas na ma smad pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi sgo nas kyang skyon gdags su med pas na ma smad pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the morality of the irreproachable because it is irreproachable in any way.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul rang dgar mi gtong ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul rang dgar mi gtong ste /
translated: It is the morality of the well-guarded because it does not let the eye faculty and so on run wild toward objects that would give rise to attachment, aversion, and so on.

original: dbang po bsrung pas shin tu sbas pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po bsrung pas shin tu sbas pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the morality of the well-guarded because it is well-guarded by the faculties.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /

original: de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu ma lus pa la sems pas /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu ma lus pa la sems pas /

original: rnam par grags pa'i tshul khrims de //
analyzed: rnam par grags pa'i tshul khrims de //

original: theg pa kun la rnam par grags //
analyzed: theg pa kun la rnam par grags //

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pas rab tu byung ba la 'os pa ni rung ba ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pas rab tu byung ba la 'os pa ni rung ba ste /
translated: Suitable for the renunciate with his alms-bowl, robes, etc., is proper.

original: de dag mang por rnyed kyang ji tsam dgos pa nyi tshe len te /
analyzed: de dag mang por rnyed kyang ji tsam dgos pa nyi tshe len te /
translated: Even if he finds many of these, he takes only what is necessary.

original: chog shes pas 'dod pa chung ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chog shes pas 'dod pa chung ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the morality of contentment and few desires.

analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa ngan don gyis chog shes shing mang po dang bzang po ma rnyed na yang gdung ba med pa /
translated: He is content with a poor alms-bowl, robes, etc. If he does not find many or good ones, he is not distressed.

analyzed: rnyed na yang zhen pa dang bcas pa med par longs spyod de /
translated: If he finds them, he uses them without attachment.

analyzed: de ltar chags pa spong bas chog shes pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o // 'du 'dzi'i nang na mi gnas pa dang / 'dod pa la @67a * //
translated: Thus, it is called the morality of contentment, which is the abandonment of desire.üîΩThe morality of solitude of mind is the non-reflection on desire, etc.,

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa la mi rtog pa ni sems dben pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa la mi rtog pa ni sems dben pa ste /
translated: and the non-dwelling in the midst of society.

original: de ltar tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral bas rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral bas rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ste /

analyzed: ji ltar lus dben pa ni 'du 'dzi'i rnam par spong bas dgon pa la gnas pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The solitude of body is taught by the morality of dwelling in the forest, which is the abandonment of the forms of society.

analyzed: ji ltar sems dben pa ni gzhan gyi ngor mi lta bas 'phags pa'i rigs kyis chog shes pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya bas bstan te /

analyzed: rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum gyi tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid rig pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: yang na mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis so //

translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúnot relying on the desire realm‚Äù explains morality as not relying on the sense objects, not relishing the taste of the concentrations of the form realm, and not being reborn in the formless realm even though one has attained the formless meditative attainments.

translated: The extensive explanation of the opposite of the ethics of bodhisattvas is The ethics of ordinary beings is exhausted by the abodes of beings.

analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes pa zad nas 'chi ba'i dus byas pa na gzugs med pa'i lha'i bu'i tshul khrims zad par 'gyur ro //

original: nyan thos thams cad ni slob pa bdun dang / mi slob pa gcig ste /

translated: All ≈õrƒÅvakas are seven learners and one non-learner.

original: gang zag brgyad la bya'o //

original: gang gi tshe rang sangs rgyas rnams sems can gyi don du rdzu 'phrul gyis sems can gyi don byed pa btang ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang sangs rgyas rnams sems can gyi don du rdzu 'phrul gyis sems can gyi don byed pa btang ste /

analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du bltas pa de'i tshe snying rje chen po dang bral ba zhes bya'o //

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub kyi sems mi zad pas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims mi zad pa ston to //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub kyi sems mi zad pas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims mi zad pa ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the morality of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible‚Äù and so forth shows the inexhaustibility of the bodhisattva‚Äôs morality through the inexhaustibility of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa zhes ci'i phyir bya snyam nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa zhes ci'i phyir bya snyam nas /
translated: Why is the morality of the bodhisattvas called ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dris pa'i lan du 'di ltar tshul khrims de las tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dris pa'i lan du 'di ltar tshul khrims de las tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In response to the question ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúBecause all morality comes from that morality.‚Äù

original: skabs 'dir tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems la bya la /
analyzed: skabs 'dir tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems la bya la /
translated: In this context, ethics is taken to be the thought of awakening.

original: de las de bzhin gshegs pa man chad kyi tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir mi zad pa sbyar te /
analyzed: de las de bzhin gshegs pa man chad kyi tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir mi zad pa sbyar te /
translated: Since all ethics from the TathƒÅgata on down arise from that, it is applied to the imperishability.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon mi zad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims @71a * //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon mi zad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims @71a * //
translated: Therefore, since the seed of the thought of awakening is imperishable, the ethics of the TathƒÅgata

original: mi zad par rig par bya zhes dngos su gsungs te /
analyzed: mi zad par rig par bya zhes dngos su gsungs te /
translated: should be known as imperishable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims mi zad pa de'i sa bon yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims de yin pas de'i phyir na skyes bu dam pa de dag ni tshul khrims mi zad pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims mi zad pa de'i sa bon yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims de yin pas de'i phyir na skyes bu dam pa de dag ni tshul khrims mi zad pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The seed of the imperishability of the ethics of the TathƒÅgata is also the ethics of the nature of the thought of awakening of the bodhisattva. Therefore, those holy beings are called ‚Äúthose whose ethics are imperishable.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: tshul khrims mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The imperishability of ethics has been explained.

original: // / bzod pa mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyis rjes su bsrung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: // / bzod pa mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyis rjes su bsrung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who stands in the imperishability of patience is called the bodhisattva who is protected by the Dharma.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: de bstan ba'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod par lta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bstan ba'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod par lta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe patience of the bodhisattvas is seen in thirty-two aspects.‚Äù

original: bzod pa mi zad pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bzod pa mi zad pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The imperishability of patience is also threefold:

original: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: patience in not retaliating in the face of harm done by others, patience in accepting suffering, and patience in reflecting on the Dharma.

original: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yang rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yang rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: Patience in accepting suffering is also taught in four ways:

original: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang bral ba dang / bzod pa'i gnyen po yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / bzod pa'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par 'dzin ba'o ;
analyzed: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang bral ba dang / bzod pa'i gnyen po yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / bzod pa'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par 'dzin ba'o ;
translated: The cause of patience is the absence of the cause of the antithesis of patience, the correct adoption of the antidote of patience, the purification of the path of patience, and the correct adoption of the result of patience.

original: / de la bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang bral ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: / de la bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang bral ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the absence of the cause of the antithesis of patience,

original: bag la nyal spangs nas bzod par lta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig brgyad gsungs te /
analyzed: bag la nyal spangs nas bzod par lta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig brgyad gsungs te /
translated: it is said that one should see patience as the abandonment of latent propensities.

original: mi bzod pa'i rgyu khong khro ba la sogs pa'i bag la nyal spangs te /
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i rgyu khong khro ba la sogs pa'i bag la nyal spangs te /
translated: The cause of impatience is the latent propensities of anger and so forth.

original: gang la yang mi bzod pa'i rgyu med pas bzod par lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gang la yang mi bzod pa'i rgyu med pas bzod par lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: One should see patience as the absence of any cause of impatience.

original: tshig mthun pa rnams ni 'og ma dag la yang ci rig par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig mthun pa rnams ni 'og ma dag la yang ci rig par sbyar ro //
translated: The same expression should be applied to the following.

original: mi gnod pa ni lag pa dang bong ba dang dbyug pa la sogs pas gnod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnod pa ni lag pa dang bong ba dang dbyug pa la sogs pas gnod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Non-violence is not harming with hands, clods, sticks, and so forth.

original: yongs su mi gdung ba ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi gdung ba ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Non-tormenting is the non-occurrence of suffering and displeasure even when harmed by others.

original: gnod sems med pa ni mtshon cha la sogs pa gang yang rung bas sems can pha rol po phung bar sbyor ba ni gnod sems te /üîΩde med pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems med pa ni mtshon cha la sogs pa gang yang rung bas sems can pha rol po phung bar sbyor ba ni gnod sems te / de med pa'o //
translated: Absence of malice is the non-occurrence of malice, which is the desire to destroy other sentient beings by any means, such as weapons and so on.

original: khon du 'dzin pa med pa ni gnod pa byas pa'i 'og tu khon gyi 'dud pa'i bsam pa mi 'dor zhing rgyun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa med pa ni gnod pa byas pa'i 'og tu khon gyi 'dud pa'i bsam pa mi 'dor zhing rgyun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: Absence of resentment is the non-occurrence of resentment, which is the non-abandonment of the intention to harm and its continuous occurrence.üîΩOr else, it is the nine bases of resentment:

original: yang @71b na 'dis bdag la gnod pa byas /
analyzed: yang @71b na 'dis bdag la gnod pa byas /
translated: ‚ÄúHe harmed me,üîΩis harming me,

original: byed / byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: byed / byed par 'gyur /
translated: will harm me.

original: bdag gi mdza' bo la gnod pa byas /
analyzed: bdag gi mdza' bo la gnod pa byas /
translated: He harmed my friends,üîΩis harming them,

original: byed / byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: byed / byed par 'gyur /
translated: will harm them.üîΩHe benefited my enemies,

original: 'dis bdag gi dgra la phan pa byas /üîΩbyed / byed par 'gyur zhes kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu ni khon du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis bdag gi dgra la phan pa byas / byed / byed par 'gyur zhes kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu ni khon du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: is benefiting them,üîΩwill benefit them.‚Äù

original: de lta bu med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu med pa'o //
translated: Absence of pretense is the non-occurrence of pretense, which is the desire to deceive others by means of one‚Äôs morality.

original: mi khro ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i dngos po dang phrad nas 'phral du gnod pa bya ba'i kun nas mnar sems ni khro ba ste /
analyzed: mi khro ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i dngos po dang phrad nas 'phral du gnod pa bya ba'i kun nas mnar sems ni khro ba ste /
translated: Not being angry is not being mentally tormented by the thought of immediately harming someone when encountering something unpleasant.

original: de med pa'o //üîΩ'thab mo ni pha ma'am /üîΩmkhan po'am / slob dpon nam /
analyzed: de med pa'o // 'thab mo ni pha ma'am / mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam /
translated: Non-anger is the absence of the intention to harm immediately upon encountering an unpleasant object.üîΩQuarrel is the mutual exchange of words for the sake of one's parents,

original: dkon mchog gi phyir phan tshun du tshig gis 'gyed pa ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gi phyir phan tshun du tshig gis 'gyed pa ste /
translated: teacher,

original: de med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'o //
translated: or the Three Jewels.

original: rtsod pa ni rigs dang rus la sogs pa smos nas ma tshang 'bru ba ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa ni rigs dang rus la sogs pa smos nas ma tshang 'bru ba ste /
translated: Dispute is the exchange of words with others, mentioning one's caste, family, etc.,

original: de med pa'o //üîΩbzod pa'i gnyen po yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de med pa'o // bzod pa'i gnyen po yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: in order to win.üîΩWith regard to the antidote of patience, six verses are stated beginning with:

original: yul gyi rma mi phyin pas bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig drug gsungs te /
analyzed: yul gyi rma mi phyin pas bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig drug gsungs te /
translated: Patience should be recognized as the non-wounding of others,üîΩand as the endurance of suffering.

original: khro bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i yul gyi rkyen gyi dbang du ma gyur pas rma mi phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khro bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i yul gyi rkyen gyi dbang du ma gyur pas rma mi phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the non-wounding of others, because one is not under the influence of the conditions of objects which would cause anger, etc.

original: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba ni bdag nyid kyang mi bzod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang mi bzod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar bsrung ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //üîΩbyang chub kyi sems dang mthun pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba ni bdag nyid kyang mi bzod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang mi bzod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar bsrung ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'o // byang chub kyi sems dang mthun pa ni /
translated: Protection of self and others is the skill in the means of protecting oneself from being overwhelmed by impatience and also protecting others from being overwhelmed by impatience.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa byed pa bzhin du kun la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa byed pa bzhin du kun la bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience in accordance with enlightenment is patience with all beings, as if one were a mother, having generated the thought of enlightenment and having generated love for all beings as if they were one‚Äôs only child.

original: tshul bzhin du rab tu rtog pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rab tu rtog pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Correct thorough analysis is the cultivation of love as the antidote to hatred.

original: yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba ni khams gsum gyi 'khor ba'i chos rnams la yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba ni khams gsum gyi 'khor ba'i chos rnams la yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Disenchantment and freedom from desire is disenchantment with and freedom from desire for the phenomena of the three realms of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar byung na mi mthun pa dang yid du mi 'ong ba rnams la mi bzod pa med pa'i phyir bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar byung na mi mthun pa dang yid du mi 'ong ba rnams la mi bzod pa med pa'i phyir bzod par blta'o //
translated: If one has become like that, one should be seen as patient because one has no impatience with what is disagreeable and unpleasant.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pa ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang phrad na 'di ni las kyi le lan yin te ;
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pa ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang phrad na 'di ni las kyi le lan yin te ;
translated: When one encounters suffering that arises from others' harmful actions, one should reflect on the ripening of karma:

original: des na bdag gis byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyis sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba nyams su myong la /
analyzed: des na bdag gis byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyis sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba nyams su myong la /
translated: I am experiencing this suffering that is the result of nonvirtuous karma that I myself created.

original: yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi bzod pa 'di yang dag par blangs te 'dug na ni bdag nyid la mi sdug pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid sbyor bar byed par nges @72a * //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi bzod pa 'di yang dag par blangs te 'dug na ni bdag nyid la mi sdug pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid sbyor bar byed par nges @72a * //
translated: If I continue to hold on to this intolerance, which is the cause of suffering, I will certainly be the one who binds himself to what is unpleasant.

original: so snyam nas gnod pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: so snyam nas gnod pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: Thus one should not inflict harm.

original: bzod pa'i las rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bzod pa'i las rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the pure action of patience,üîΩseven verses are stated, beginning with:

original: lus kyi rgyan gyi bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bdun gsungs te /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyan gyi bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bdun gsungs te /
translated: The patience of one who is endowed with patience is seen as an ornament of the body.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni khro gnyer dang bzhin gyi mdog 'gyur ba dang / mig dmar ba la sogs pa mi sdug pa med de /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni khro gnyer dang bzhin gyi mdog 'gyur ba dang / mig dmar ba la sogs pa mi sdug pa med de /
translated: A person who is endowed with patience is free of frowns, a pleasant expression, red eyes, and so forth, which are unpleasant.

original: dbang bo zhi zhing mdangs bzang ba la lus kyi rgyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bo zhi zhing mdangs bzang ba la lus kyi rgyan zhes bya'o //
translated: The physical ornament is the serenity of the senses and the beauty of the complexion.

original: rnam pa gnyis su na bzod pa ni ma 'ongs pa na yang lus mdzes par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su na bzod pa ni ma 'ongs pa na yang lus mdzes par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Patience is the cause of physical beauty in the future, in two ways:

original: 'di ltar bzod pas ni mdzes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pas ni mdzes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is said, Through patience, one becomes beautiful.

original: ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa ni ngag rtsub mo mi 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang gi bsam pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa ni ngag rtsub mo mi 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang gi bsam pa med pa ste /
translated: The purity of speech and mind is the absence of harsh speech and the absence of a hostile attitude.

original: de ltar sgo gsum rang bzhin du gnas pa ni bzod pa'i las yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar sgo gsum rang bzhin du gnas pa ni bzod pa'i las yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the natural state of the three doors is shown to be the action of patience.

original: bsam pa brtan pa ni bzod par 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rlung nye bar 'ongs kyang des bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa brtan pa ni bzod par 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rlung nye bar 'ongs kyang des bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The firm intention is because even if the wind of the object that causes patience arises, it cannot move it.

original: yi ge ya ma brla yin pa ni pha rol gyis ngan du smras pa dang / ngan du brjod pa 'di dag na yi ge tsam du zad do zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ya ma brla yin pa ni pha rol gyis ngan du smras pa dang / ngan du brjod pa 'di dag na yi ge tsam du zad do zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of syllables is the thought, These bad words and bad speech of the other are just syllables.

original: yang na stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i yi ge dang sgra tsam gyis 'jigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: yang na stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i yi ge dang sgra tsam gyis 'jigs par mi byed de /
translated: Or else, one should not be frightened by the mere letters and sounds of emptiness, selflessness, etc.

original: de dag ya ma brla yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ya ma brla yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that they are just empty sounds.

original: de dag gi don zab mo la rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don zab mo la rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: One should reflect on their profound meaning.

original: yongs su rtog pa med pa ni gang gis gnod par bya /üîΩgang la gnod par byas /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa med pa ni gang gis gnod par bya / gang la gnod par byas /
translated: What is there to be intolerant of in the absence of conceptual thought?üîΩWhat is there to be intolerant of in the absence of an object of intolerance?

original: gang la gnod par byed ces rnam pa gsum la yang yongs su mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gnod par byed ces rnam pa gsum la yang yongs su mi rtog pa'o //
translated: What is there to be intolerant of in the absence of an agent of intolerance?

original: rang gi sems la nges par sems pa ni mi bzod par byed pa 'di yang rang gi sems nyid las skyes par zad do zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems la nges par sems pa ni mi bzod par byed pa 'di yang rang gi sems nyid las skyes par zad do zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: One should reflect on one‚Äôs own mind, thinking, ‚ÄúThis intolerance arises from my own mind alone.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba ni bdag gis gnod pa byas na gzhan gyi sems gdung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba ni bdag gis gnod pa byas na gzhan gyi sems gdung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: One should protect the minds of others, thinking, ‚ÄúIf I act intolerantly, the minds of others will be tormented.‚Äù

original: bzod pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi lam du 'gro bas bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi lam du 'gro bas bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The result of patience is also mentioned in terms of the power of correct grasping: ‚ÄúOne should view patience as the path to the world of Brahma.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That result is also threefold:

original: 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa ste /

analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The passage beginning with in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm and so on,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur la /üîΩchos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa gcig cig yod na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag de dag gi ye shes gcig tu bsdoms kyang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur la / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa gcig cig yod na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag de dag gi ye shes gcig tu bsdoms kyang /
translated: If all the sentient beings in the great billion world universe were to possess the wisdom of one who follows by faith,

original: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag gcig po'i ye shes kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /
analyzed: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag gcig po'i ye shes kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /
translated: and if there were one who possessed the wisdom of one who follows the teaching, the wisdom of all those who follow by faith would not equal a hundredth part of the wisdom of one who follows the teaching,

original: rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: and so on up to it would not even bear comparison.

original: 'og ma dag la yang tshul des bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang tshul des bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: The same method should be applied to the following.

original: de la dad pas rjes su 'brad pa ni bdag nyid kyis shes pas rtogs pa med kyi /
analyzed: de la dad pas rjes su 'brad pa ni bdag nyid kyis shes pas rtogs pa med kyi /
translated: One who follows by faith does not realize by his own knowledge,

original: gzhan las thos pa bzhin du dad pas 'phags pa'i lam rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las thos pa bzhin du dad pas 'phags pa'i lam rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: but follows the noble path by faith, as he has heard it from others.

original: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba ni dbang bo rnon po gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa chos kyi @78a * //
analyzed: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba ni dbang bo rnon po gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa chos kyi @78a * //
translated: One who is a follower by faith is of sharp faculties and is not guided by others.

original: tshul dang mthun par rig pa dang sbyor zhing 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun par rig pa dang sbyor zhing 'jug pa'o //
translated: He is one who applies and engages himself in accordance with the Dharma.

original: brgyad pa ni rgyun du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni rgyun du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the stream-enterer.

original: dgra bcom pa nas thur du bgrangs na gang zag brgyad kyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nas thur du bgrangs na gang zag brgyad kyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the first of the eight persons when counted from the state of an arhat.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi rgyun du zhugs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi rgyun du zhugs pa la bya'o //
translated: One who is a stream-enterer is one who has entered the stream of the path to nirvana.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya bar nyon mongs pa drug man chad spangs pa ste /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya bar nyon mongs pa drug man chad spangs pa ste /
translated: One who is a once-returner is one who has abandoned up to six afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams 'dir yang skye ba len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams 'dir yang skye ba len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because he takes birth only once more in the desire realm.

original: nyon mongs pa dgu char spangs pa ni phyir 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i rgyu med pas phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgu char spangs pa ni phyir 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i rgyu med pas phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: One who is a non-returner is one who has abandoned all nine of the afflictions of the desire realm. He is so called because he has no cause for returning to the desire realm.

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i dgra ma lus par bcom pa 'am /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i dgra ma lus par bcom pa 'am /
translated: One who is an arhat is one who has completely conquered the enemy of the afflictions of the three realms.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi mchod pa'i 'os su gyur bas na dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi mchod pa'i 'os su gyur bas na dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: They are worthy of offerings from the three worlds, thus they are arhats.

original: sems can mang po'i don mi mdzad kyi /
analyzed: sems can mang po'i don mi mdzad kyi /
translated: They do not benefit many sentient beings,

original: bdag gcig bu byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub pas na rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bdag gcig bu byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub pas na rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: but they do attain enlightenment and nirvana for themselves alone, thus they are pratyekabuddhas.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa bzhi pa bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la bskal ba brgyas nges par byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa bzhi pa bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la bskal ba brgyas nges par byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who attain the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the fourth stage of resolute practice are called bodhisattvas who definitely emerge in one hundred eons,

original: bskal ba grangs med pa dang po la bskal ba brgya zhes btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med pa dang po la bskal ba brgya zhes btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the first countless eon is designated as one hundred eons.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa gang nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa gang nas bzung ste /
translated: From what point is samsara considered to be beginningless?

original: grangs med pa brtsams she na /
analyzed: grangs med pa brtsams she na /
translated: From what point is a countless eon counted?üîΩIt is said that bodhisattvasüîΩbegin the three countless eonsüîΩwith the stages of pure,üîΩaspiring,

original: bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang // sems brtan khyad par 'gro ba yi //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' grangs med gsum //
analyzed: bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang // sems brtan khyad par 'gro ba yi // byang chub sems dpa' grangs med gsum //
translated: and steadfast mind.üîΩIt is said that bodhisattvasüîΩbegin the three countless eons

original: kun tu rtsom par mdzad ces brjod //
analyzed: kun tu rtsom par mdzad ces brjod //
translated: with the stages of pure,

original: ces bshad de /
analyzed: ces bshad de /
translated: aspiring,üîΩand steadfast mind.

original: bzang po ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po ni dge ba'o //
translated: Pure refers to virtue.

original: smon pa ni smon lam te /
analyzed: smon pa ni smon lam te /
translated: Aspiring refers to aspiration.

original: de gnyis su la yod pa ni bzang ba dang smon pa'i stobs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis su la yod pa ni bzang ba dang smon pa'i stobs can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have both are called ‚Äúthe powerful ones who are good and aspirational.‚Äù

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the powerful ones in terms of roots of virtue are not overcome by counteragents.

original: smon lam gyi stobs can ni rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs can ni rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The powerful ones in terms of aspirational prayers are always in the company of spiritual teachers.

original: sems brtan pa ni mi dge ba'i grogs pos mos pa bzlog kyang byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems brtan pa ni mi dge ba'i grogs pos mos pa bzlog kyang byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those with steadfast intention never give up the spirit of enlightenment, even when their intention is blocked by unwholesome companions.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma la dge ba'i chos 'phel ba dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma la dge ba'i chos 'phel ba dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who make progress increase their wholesome actions in this life and the next, and they do not diminish.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / sems brtan pa de bar ma dor mi ldog pa dang / khyad @78b par du 'gro ba ste yon tan cung zad kyis chog par mi 'dzin pa de nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / sems brtan pa de bar ma dor mi ldog pa dang / khyad @78b par du 'gro ba ste yon tan cung zad kyis chog par mi 'dzin pa de nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, when the roots of virtue, the power of aspirational prayers, and steadfast intention are present, one does not turn back in the middle, and one makes progress, not being satisfied with a little virtue.

original: grangs med pa gsum rtsom mo //
analyzed: grangs med pa gsum rtsom mo //
translated: He begins the three incalculable aeons.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the first stage, the stage of the joyous, is called the bodhisattva who has attained acceptance.

original: gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa spangs nas stong ba nyid kyi don la bzod pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba thob pa ni /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa spangs nas stong ba nyid kyi don la bzod pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro // sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba thob pa ni /
translated: Because he has abandoned adherence to the individual and the general, and has attained the acceptance of the meaning of emptiness.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the eighth stage, the stage of steadiness, is called the irreversible bodhisattva.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa thams cad spangs nas der mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa thams cad spangs nas der mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has abandoned all conceptualizations of signs and signlessness, etc., and does not turn back from that.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni gleng gzhi'i skabs su bshad zin to /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni gleng gzhi'i skabs su bshad zin to /
translated: The bodhisattva who is impeded by one birth has been explained in the chapter on the introduction.

original: // / byang chub kyi snying bo la 'dug pa ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir byang chub kyi snying bor 'dug pa la mngon par sangs rgyas pa nyid ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: // / byang chub kyi snying bo la 'dug pa ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir byang chub kyi snying bor 'dug pa la mngon par sangs rgyas pa nyid ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is seated in the essence of enlightenment is called the bodhisattva who is seated in the essence of enlightenment, because he is about to fully awaken, but he is not one who has fully awakened.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni dge bas mtho ris su skye ba dang / mi dge bas ngan song du skye ba gnas yin pa dang / dge bas ngan song du skye ba dang / mi dge bas mtho ris su skye ba gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni dge bas mtho ris su skye ba dang / mi dge bas ngan song du skye ba gnas yin pa dang / dge bas ngan song du skye ba dang / mi dge bas mtho ris su skye ba gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of what is possible and impossible is the knowledge of what is possible, such as that one is born in the higher realms through virtue and in the lower realms through non-virtue, and what is impossible, such as that one is born in the lower realms through virtue or in the higher realms through non-virtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhan rnams ni yi ge mangs su dogs nas ma bris te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhan rnams ni yi ge mangs su dogs nas ma bris te /
translated: I have not written about the other qualities of a Buddha for fear of being too wordy.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: They should be understood as they appear in the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras and so forth.üîΩWhat is the bodhisattvas' imperishable accumulation of wisdom?

original: / de la byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / de la byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means, ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattvas' imperishable diligence in accomplishing the accumulation of wisdom?‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ni sems can kha cig 'dod chags spyod pa dang / kha cig zhe sdang spyod pa dang / kha cig gti mug spyod pa dang / kha cig nga rgyal spyod pa dang / kha cig rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i 'jug pa shes pa ni sems can gyi spyod pa de dag rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ni sems can kha cig 'dod chags spyod pa dang / kha cig zhe sdang spyod pa dang / kha cig gti mug spyod pa dang / kha cig nga rgyal spyod pa dang / kha cig rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i 'jug pa shes pa ni sems can gyi spyod pa de dag rtogs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of their engagement is the realization of those sentient beings' behaviors.

original: de yang ji ltar rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: Moreover, how does one realize them?üîΩIt is stated:

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As many minds as there are of all sentient beings in the past, future, and present...

original: dus gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyi sems sems can gcig gi sems kyi 'jug pa gcig la yod par gyur ba de lta bu'i tshul du sems gnyis dang gsum la sogs @79a * //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyi sems sems can gcig gi sems kyi 'jug pa gcig la yod par gyur ba de lta bu'i tshul du sems gnyis dang gsum la sogs @79a * //
translated: The minds of all sentient beings of the three times exist in a single mental engagement of a single sentient being.

original: pa sems can thams cad de snyed du tshad med pa'i sems kyis gang bar gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pas gang ba'i sems su gyur ba yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar te /
analyzed: pa sems can thams cad de snyed du tshad med pa'i sems kyis gang bar gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pas gang ba'i sems su gyur ba yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar te /
translated: And the minds of all sentient beings are filled with immeasurable such thoughts.üîΩAnd the minds that are filled with afflictions such as attachment and hostility are to be applied in the same way.

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i sems can gyi sems dang / nyon mongs pa shes par bya ba'i shes rab kyi tshogs kyis gcig bsgrubs pas ma lus pa shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i shes rab kyi tshogs bskyed par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i sems can gyi sems dang / nyon mongs pa shes par bya ba'i shes rab kyi tshogs kyis gcig bsgrubs pas ma lus pa shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i shes rab kyi tshogs bskyed par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And the accumulations of the wisdom that knows the minds and afflictions of such sentient beings are to be generated in such a way that by accomplishing one, all are known.

original: so so'i dmigs pas byung ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i dmigs pas byung ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs nas byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from individual objects refers to that which arises from observing form, sound, and so on.

original: zhig pa ni sems dang nyon mongs pa byung nas 'das pa'i dus su zhig pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni sems dang nyon mongs pa byung nas 'das pa'i dus su zhig pa'o //
translated: Destruction is that which is destroyed in the past after the mind and afflictions have arisen.

original: zhu ba ni da ltar byung nas 'jig pa la bltas pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhu ba ni da ltar byung nas 'jig pa la bltas pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Melting is that which is seen to be destroyed after arising in the present and that which will arise.

original: shes rab des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni da ltar byung ba'i sems dang nyon mongs pa'i gong du smos pa lta bu mang bo shes par ma zad kyi dus gsum dang ldan pa ma lus par shes pa ston to //
analyzed: shes rab des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni da ltar byung ba'i sems dang nyon mongs pa'i gong du smos pa lta bu mang bo shes par ma zad kyi dus gsum dang ldan pa ma lus par shes pa ston to //
translated: The phrase and by that wisdom and so forth shows that not only does one know the many minds and afflictions of the present as mentioned above, but one also knows all those of the three times.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes byaüîΩba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Regarding that, the phrase what is the bodhisattva's imperishable collection for the attainment of all buddha dharmas? means what is the imperishable collection of the striving for the attainment of all buddha dharmas?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni shes rab rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni shes rab rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The roots of virtue are endowed with the three types of wisdom and so forth.

original: de dag dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad bsags pas ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'grub par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad bsags pas ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'grub par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: And because of the accumulation of all the perfections and the factors of enlightenment, one accomplishes the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on. Therefore, it is called the accumulation that accomplishes all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de nyid mdor bsdus nas gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdang po'i sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid mdor bsdus nas gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir / dang po'i sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate just that in brief, he says:

original: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the knowledge of all modes, the bodhisattva's accumulation is to be known as the accumulation of merit and knowledge.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i par na gang ji tsam du bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya bar sems shing dmigs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par sbyor ba la sogs pa gang dag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i par na gang ji tsam du bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya bar sems shing dmigs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par sbyor ba la sogs pa gang dag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the knowledge of all modes, whatever is thought and whatever is taken as an objective support in the performance of one's own and others' aims, and whatever is applied to the accomplishment of one's own and others' aims, etc., by which one accomplishes all the qualities of a Buddha, that is called the accumulation that accomplishes all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: brtson 'grus thams cad kyi sgo bstan @79b pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus thams cad kyi sgo bstan @79b pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the teaching on the door of all effort,

original: gang lus kyi dge ba'i las kyi rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang lus kyi dge ba'i las kyi rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe basis of all virtuous actions of the body, and so on.‚Äù

original: sgo gsum nas dge ba spyad do cog gi rten ni brtson 'grus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo gsum nas dge ba spyad do cog gi rten ni brtson 'grus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because effort is the basis of all virtuous conduct of the three doors.

original: ci'i phyir sgo gsum nas dge ba spyad do cog gi rten brtson 'grus yin snyam nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgo gsum nas dge ba spyad do cog gi rten brtson 'grus yin snyam nas /
translated: Why is effort the basis of all virtuous conduct of the three doors?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dris pa dang / brtson 'grus gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad lus dang ngag dang sems dang ldan pa'i phyir de zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dris pa dang / brtson 'grus gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad lus dang ngag dang sems dang ldan pa'i phyir de zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response to this question, he says, ‚ÄúBecause all efforts are endowed with body, speech, and mind.‚Äù

original: sgo gsum dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus rnam pa thams cad du 'dra yang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo gsum dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus rnam pa thams cad du 'dra yang zhe na /
translated: If all efforts endowed with the three doors are the same, why is mental effort superior?

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis zin pa'i sems kyi brtson 'grus kyis brtson 'grus thams cad mdor bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis zin pa'i sems kyi brtson 'grus kyis brtson 'grus thams cad mdor bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the mental effort that is embraced by method and wisdom, he says, ‚ÄúThe mental effort that is embraced by method and wisdom is the best of all efforts.‚Äù

original: lus dang ngag gi brtson 'grus pas sems kyi brtson 'grus nyid mchog ces bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi brtson 'grus pas sems kyi brtson 'grus nyid mchog ces bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The effort of mind is superior to the effort of body and speech.

original: lus dang ngag gi sgo nas brtson 'grus 'byung ngo cog kyang sems kyis kun nas bslangs pa yin pas na sems kyi brtson 'grus mchog ces bshad do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sgo nas brtson 'grus 'byung ngo cog kyang sems kyis kun nas bslangs pa yin pas na sems kyi brtson 'grus mchog ces bshad do //
translated: Since all the efforts that arise through the doors of body and speech are motivated by the mind, the effort of mind is said to be superior.

original: de bas na mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: 'jig rten ni sems kyis khrid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni sems kyis khrid do //
translated: The world is led by the mind.

original: sems kyis drangs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kyis drangs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mind draws it along.

original: de bzhin du sems kyis sangs rgyas byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyis sangs rgyas byed pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the mind makes a buddha.

original: sems nyid kyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyid kyis mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the mind itself that sees.

original: sems nyid nga yi sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: sems nyid nga yi sangs rgyas te //
translated: The mind itself is my buddha.

original: sems nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The mind itself is the Tathagata.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: de la sems kyi 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yang rung ba la thog ma 'jug cing rtsom pa ste thabs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yang rung ba la thog ma 'jug cing rtsom pa ste thabs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The engagement of the mind is the initial entry into and undertaking of any bodhisattva activity, which is included in the category of method.

original: gnas pa ni spyod pa de dag mthar phyin cing grub pa ste shes rab kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni spyod pa de dag mthar phyin cing grub pa ste shes rab kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the culmination and accomplishment of those practices, which is included in wisdom.

original: de yang rab tu dbye ba dang mdor bsdus pas bstan te sems kyi 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i tshig phrugs nyi shu rtsa dgus ni dbye ba bstan /
analyzed: de yang rab tu dbye ba dang mdor bsdus pas bstan te sems kyi 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i tshig phrugs nyi shu rtsa dgus ni dbye ba bstan /
translated: That is taught by way of analysis and summary. The twenty-nine sections on the engagement and abiding of the mind teach by way of analysis.

original: tha ma'i tshig phrugs gsum gyis ni mdor bsdus te bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma'i tshig phrugs gsum gyis ni mdor bsdus te bstan to //
translated: The final three sections teach by way of summary.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsom pa ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsom pa ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The beginning of the thought of awakening is the initial generation of the thought of awakening and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems nye bar zhi ba ni rtsom pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nye bar zhi ba ni rtsom pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: The pacification of the thought of awakening is the absence of beginning and spontaneous accomplishment.

original: thabs dang shes rab dang go rims bzhin du kun la yang rgya cher sbyar ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dang go rims bzhin du kun la yang rgya cher sbyar ro //
translated: In accordance with method and wisdom, this should be applied in full to all.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje chen pos lta yang shes rab kyis sems can du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir @80a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje chen pos lta yang shes rab kyis sems can du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir @80a * //
translated: Even though one views sentient beings with great compassion, because of the wisdom that does not observe sentient beings,

original: bdag med pa la bzod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bzod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: one is said to be ‚Äúpatient with selflessness.‚Äù

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can thams cad sdud kyang shes rab kyis chos gang la yang dngos por mi 'dzin pas /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can thams cad sdud kyang shes rab kyis chos gang la yang dngos por mi 'dzin pas /
translated: Although they gather all sentient beings with the four ways of gathering, they do not apprehend any phenomenon as real due to their wisdom.

original: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, they are said to not apprehend any phenomenon.

original: 'khor ba ni khams gsum ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni khams gsum ste /
translated: Samsara is the three realms.

original: thabs kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi skyo bar sems can gyi don kyang spyod la /
analyzed: thabs kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi skyo bar sems can gyi don kyang spyod la /
translated: They do not become discouraged by the sufferings of samsara for the sake of sentient beings through their skillful means. They also engage in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis khams gsum du yang mi dmigs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis khams gsum du yang mi dmigs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And they do not observe the three realms through their wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa 'og ma sla ba dag ni ma bshad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa 'og ma sla ba dag ni ma bshad de /
translated: The lower perfections such as generosity are not explained here because they are easy to understand.

original: de dag dang 'dra bar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'dra bar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They should be applied in a similar way to the above.

original: sems la rma mi phyin pa ni bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams kyi rma mi phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sems la rma mi phyin pa ni bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams kyi rma mi phyin pa ste /
translated: Their minds are not wounded means that they are not wounded by thoughts such as I am patient.

original: bzod pa mi zad pa'i skabs su bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzod pa mi zad pa'i skabs su bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained in the context of the imperishability of patience.

original: sems dben pa ni mi dge ba spangs pa dang / dge ba rtsom pa gang la yang mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems dben pa ni mi dge ba spangs pa dang / dge ba rtsom pa gang la yang mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The mind is isolated from nonvirtue and from any thought of undertaking virtue.

original: sems la nges par sems pa ni spros pa thams cad las dben pa'i sems la rtog pa'o //üîΩtshul bzhin sbyar ba ni thos pas btsal ba'i chos de dag shes rab mi zad pa'i skabs na tshul bzhin sbyor ba sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bur sbyor ro //
analyzed: sems la nges par sems pa ni spros pa thams cad las dben pa'i sems la rtog pa'o // tshul bzhin sbyar ba ni thos pas btsal ba'i chos de dag shes rab mi zad pa'i skabs na tshul bzhin sbyor ba sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bur sbyor ro //
translated: The mind is certain in its thought, for it is free from all conceptual elaboration.üîΩThe mind is applied properly, for it is applied to the thirty-two kinds of proper application, etc.,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa las ji skad thos pa bzhin du ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi chos ston pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa las ji skad thos pa bzhin du ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi chos ston pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The mind is engaged in teaching the Dharma, for it teaches the Dharma in terms of the collections of names, words, and letters, just as it has been heard from the spiritual benefactors.

original: ming la sogs pas tha snyad btags te brjod kyang chos nyid ni brjod par mi nus pas chos nyid brjod du med par rig pa ni sems gnas pa ste ;
analyzed: ming la sogs pas tha snyad btags te brjod kyang chos nyid ni brjod par mi nus pas chos nyid brjod du med par rig pa ni sems gnas pa ste ;
translated: The mind is settled, for it knows that the Dharma-element is inexpressible, even though it is expressed by the conventional symbols of names, etc.

original: de bas na ming ni gang dang gang gis su /
analyzed: de bas na ming ni gang dang gang gis su /
translated: Therefore, whatever names there are

original: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: for whatever dharmas are expressed,

original: de la de ni yod ma yin /
analyzed: de la de ni yod ma yin /
translated: It does not exist there.

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is the reality of phenomena.

original: spros pa shin tu chad pa ni shes rab kyi tshogs thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa shin tu chad pa ni shes rab kyi tshogs thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The complete cessation of conceptual elaboration is the elimination of the conceptualization of the collection of wisdom, such as hearing and reflection.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas btang snyoms pa ni sems can la byams pa la sogs par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas btang snyoms pa ni sems can la byams pa la sogs par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The equanimity of right knowledge is the non-conceptualization of love and so forth towards sentient beings.

original: zag pa zad pa ni mngon par shes pa drug pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni mngon par shes pa drug pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of defilements is the sixth superknowledge.

original: de la mngon sum du byed pa ni 'dris par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum du byed pa ni 'dris par byed pa'o //
translated: The actualization of that is the familiarization with it.

original: dran pa yid la byed pa med pas ni dran pa nya bar gzhag pas lus la @80b sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so sor yid la byed pa de dag mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa yid la byed pa med pas ni dran pa nya bar gzhag pas lus la @80b sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so sor yid la byed pa de dag mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The absence of attention to mindfulness is the non-apprehension of those attentions to the characteristics of the body and so forth through the meditative equipoise of mindfulness.

original: dbang bo med pa'i chos ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa sta /
analyzed: dbang bo med pa'i chos ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa sta /
translated: The Dharma that is beyond the sense faculties is the pure realm of phenomena,

original: dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends the domain of the sense faculties.

original: mi brdzi ba'i ye shes ni stobs nyid du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mi brdzi ba'i ye shes ni stobs nyid du gyur ba ste /
translated: The invincible wisdom is the very strength,

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa la bya'o //
translated: It is not overcome by adverse factors such as lack of faith.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag yang dag par byung ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun skyed par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag yang dag par byung ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun skyed par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The arising of the factors of enlightenment has the meaning of producing the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log par sa dang po la rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log par sa dang po la rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of skill in fully discerning phenomena is the wisdom that realizes the suchness of phenomena without error on the first ground.

original: gar yang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba la lam gyi don ni chol ba'i don yin pas gar yang mi 'gro ba ni gnas su phyin zin pas lam tshol ba dang bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gar yang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba la lam gyi don ni chol ba'i don yin pas gar yang mi 'gro ba ni gnas su phyin zin pas lam tshol ba dang bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not going anywhere means that since one has already arrived at the destination, one is free from seeking a path.

original: zhi gnas kyi sems zhi ba ni zhi gnas tshol ba'i dbang gis sems rtse gcig tu gyur zin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi sems zhi ba ni zhi gnas tshol ba'i dbang gis sems rtse gcig tu gyur zin pa la bya'o //
translated: A peaceful mind of ≈õamatha means that the mind has already become one-pointed through seeking ≈õamatha.

original: rgyu rtogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ma rig pa 'gag pa la sogs pa yin par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rtogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ma rig pa 'gag pa la sogs pa yin par rtogs pa'o //
translated: and the cause of the purification aspect is the cessation of ignorance, etc.

original: rgyu kun shes pa ni rgyu de dag mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu kun shes pa ni rgyu de dag mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the cause is the non-apprehension of those causes.

original: chos la nan tan byed pa ni gzhan gyi sgra las ji skad thos pa bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos la nan tan byed pa ni gzhan gyi sgra las ji skad thos pa bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The practice of the Dharma is the practice in accordance with what one has heard from another.

original: lus kyi rgyan ni mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa thob par rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rgyan ni mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa thob par rtsom pa'o //
translated: The adornment of the body is the undertaking to attain the major and minor characteristics, etc.

original: lus kyi chos nyid ni lus ngang rgyan de dag mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩngag gi rgyan ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yan lag lnga 'am drug cu 'am /
analyzed: lus kyi chos nyid ni lus ngang rgyan de dag mi dmigs pa'o // ngag gi rgyan ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yan lag lnga 'am drug cu 'am /
translated: The reality of the body is the non-apprehension of those adornments of the body.

original: stong phrag grangs med pa dang ldan pa thob par rtsom pa'o //üîΩ'phags pa mi smra ba ni smra ba'i spros pa spangs te /
analyzed: stong phrag grangs med pa dang ldan pa thob par rtsom pa'o // 'phags pa mi smra ba ni smra ba'i spros pa spangs te /
translated: The adornment of speech is the undertaking to attain the speech of the Tathagata endowed with five or six or countless thousands of aspects.

original: sems nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The noble silence is the abandonment of the proliferation of speech and the abiding in the correct placement of the mind within.

original: byed pa med pa ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo sgrub pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo sgrub pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of activity is the door of liberation of being free from accomplishment.

original: 'jug pa dang gnas pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de la 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang gnas pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de la 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: In order to teach the inclusion of engagement and abiding, it is said: ‚ÄúWhat is engagement?

original: gang thabs su lta ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang thabs su lta ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is the view of method.‚ÄùüîΩThe methods such as generating the mind of awakening and ripening sentient beings, the activities of the bodhisattvas, the engagement in conventions based on names, symbols, and so on,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i thabs rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams la rtsom pa dang / ming dang brda la sogs pa la brten te /üîΩtha snyad kyi 'jug pa rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i thabs rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams la rtsom pa dang / ming dang brda la sogs pa la brten te / tha snyad kyi 'jug pa rnams ni /
translated: andüîΩthe engagement of the mind

original: sems kyi 'jug pa zhes @81a * //
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa zhes @81a * //
translated: are called ‚Äúengagement.‚Äù

original: bya'o ; / shes rab kyis byang chub kyi sems dang sems can la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mthar phyin te /
analyzed: bya'o ; / shes rab kyis byang chub kyi sems dang sems can la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mthar phyin te /
translated: Through praj√±ƒÅ, the bodhisattvas do not observe the mind of awakening, sentient beings, and so on, and they perfect the activities of the bodhisattvas.

original: nyams su lon pa dang / ming dang brda las 'das pa'i chos nyid brjod du med pa la sogs pa don dam pa rtogs pa ni sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su lon pa dang / ming dang brda las 'das pa'i chos nyid brjod du med pa la sogs pa don dam pa rtogs pa ni sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization of the ultimate, which is the inexpressible reality that transcends names and symbols, is called the ‚Äústilling of the mind.‚Äù

original: de la sems kyi brtson 'grus mi zad pa de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems kyi brtson 'grus de dag rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du thabs ji lta bus 'jug pa ston to //
analyzed: de la sems kyi brtson 'grus mi zad pa de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems kyi brtson 'grus de dag rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du thabs ji lta bus 'jug pa ston to //
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúin order to perfect the imperishability of mental effort,‚Äù and so on, the text shows the manner in which bodhisattvas engage in the perfection of those mental efforts.

original: 'jug pa thams cad dang gnas dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa thams cad dang / gnas pa thams cad la yang gnas la /
analyzed: 'jug pa thams cad dang gnas dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa thams cad dang / gnas pa thams cad la yang gnas la /
translated: ‚ÄúFree from all engagement and abiding and from all signs‚Äù means that although they abide in all engagements and all abidings,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid lus dang dag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan ma thams cad dang yang dag par bral bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid lus dang dag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan ma thams cad dang yang dag par bral bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: they are completely free from all the signs of the activities of body, speech, and mind, which are characterized by subject and object.

original: 'o na dge ba'i rtsa ba bsgrub pa dang sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la sogs pa yang mi byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dge ba'i rtsa ba bsgrub pa dang sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la sogs pa yang mi byed dam zhe na /
translated: Well, then, do you not perform the activities of accomplishing the roots of virtue and benefiting sentient beings?

original: de mtshan ma'i las thams cad du yang 'jug pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de mtshan ma'i las thams cad du yang 'jug pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, One engages in all activities with signs.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pa la sogs pa la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pa la sogs pa la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one engages in the activities of ripening sentient beings and purifying a buddhafield through body, speech, and mind.

original: ye shes kyi las la yang gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi las la yang gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for the activities of wisdom, it says, One abides in...

original: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the line beginning, The cause of the roots of virtue...

original: ye shes gang gi mthus 'dus byas su yang mi gtong /
analyzed: ye shes gang gi mthus 'dus byas su yang mi gtong /
translated: The power of the wisdom that does not abandon the conditioned

original: 'dus ma byas su yang mi ltung ba ni ye shes kyi las zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su yang mi ltung ba ni ye shes kyi las zhes bya'o ;
translated: and does not fall into the unconditioned is called the activity of wisdom.

original: / de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i rgyu 'dus byas su yang mi gtong ba ni 'dus byas su mi gtong ba'i ye shes kyi las te /
analyzed: / de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i rgyu 'dus byas su yang mi gtong ba ni 'dus byas su mi gtong ba'i ye shes kyi las te /
translated: The cause of the roots of virtue and the cause of great compassion for all sentient beings is not to be given over to the conditioned. This is the action of the knowledge that does not give over to the conditioned.

original: de gnyis ni khams gsum du sbyor ba 'dus byas kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni khams gsum du sbyor ba 'dus byas kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two are the cause of the conditioned that connects to the three realms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
