analyzed: bsgral ba ni ngan song dang / srid pa'i sdug bsngal las bsgral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Liberation is liberation from the sufferings of the lower realms and of existence.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i bsam ba sngon du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i bsam ba sngon du gtong ba'o //
translated: The thought of all sentient beings is the thought of benefiting and bringing happiness to all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan mi zad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa la dbang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan mi zad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa la dbang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to perfect the inexhaustible concentration of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äù and so on teaches the distinctive purity of mastery in not interrupting the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan ni gong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan ni gong du bshad pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the tathƒÅgatas was explained above.

original: bsam gtan des 'jig rten gyi khams gong du dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan mi grag pa ni grag par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan des 'jig rten gyi khams gong du dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan mi grag pa ni grag par byed /
translated: By means of that concentration, in world systems above where the names of the Three Jewels are not known, they cause those names to be known.

original: gang du grag par ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang du grag par ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi chad par byed de /
translated: And in those places where the names are known, they cause the lineage of the Three Jewels to be uninterrupted.

original: de ltar byed pa'i bsam gtan de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa'i bsam gtan de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa'o //
translated: Because they engage in that concentration in order to perfect it, the concentration of the bodhisattvas does not interrupt the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyams pa med pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyams pa med pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are always in equipoise‚Äù and so on teaches the distinctive purity of being without degeneration.

original: 'gro ba dang 'dug pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pas ma nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'dug pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pas ma nyams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúundiminished‚Äù because it is equipoise in all situations, such as going and sitting.

original: spyod lam thams cad du nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is undiminished in all activities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba @83b la sogs pas ye shes kyi khyad par la gnas pa bstan te /üîΩstobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba @83b la sogs pas ye shes kyi khyad par la gnas pa bstan te / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pas na /
translated: The passage beginning ‚Äúin order to perfect all buddhadharmas‚Äù teaches the distinctive wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe bodhisattvas‚Äô meditative concentration that is the wisdom controlling all phenomena‚Äù because it engages in order to perfect the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la dbang sgyur ba'i ye shes dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la dbang sgyur ba'i ye shes dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the wisdom that controls the buddhadharmas.

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthar phyin pa'i bdag nyid chen po dang ldan pa bstan te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthar phyin pa'i bdag nyid chen po dang ldan pa bstan te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚Äúbecause of the greatness of wisdom‚Äù teaches the possession of the greatness of culmination.

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid che ba ni ye shes kyi mthu che ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid che ba ni ye shes kyi mthu che ba'o //
translated: The greatness of the nature of intuition is the greatness of the power of intuition.

original: de ltar bu dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni nam mkha' khyab ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bu dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni nam mkha' khyab ces bya ste /
translated: Since they possess such a nature, the contemplations of the bodhisattvas are said to be spacelike,

original: nam mkha' bzhin thogs pa dang chags pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin thogs pa dang chags pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: meaning that they are like space, free from obstruction and attachment.

original: bsam gtan rnam par dag pa bcu drug po de dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang med na 'jig rten pa rnams la ltag la yod ces bstan pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi bdag nyid che ba brjod do //üîΩbsam gtan shin tu sbyangs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam par dag pa bcu drug po de dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang med na 'jig rten pa rnams la ltag la yod ces bstan pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi bdag nyid che ba brjod do // bsam gtan shin tu sbyangs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The sixteen kinds of purity of contemplation are not even found among the disciples and hermit buddhas, much less among mundane beings. This shows the greatness of the nature of the bodhisattvas contemplation.

original: de la bsam gtan yongs su sbyangs pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan yongs su sbyangs pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The result of the purification of contemplation is taught in the passage beginning with the line, ‚ÄúWhat is the purification of contemplation?‚Äù

original: bsam gtan yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi yongs su sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi yongs su sbyangs pa ste /
translated: Thorough training in concentration is the thorough training in concentration.

original: sems las su rung ba'i 'bras bu gang sbyang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba'i 'bras bu gang sbyang ba la bya'o //
translated: The purification of concentration is the result of the flexibility of mind.

original: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang mngon par shes pa dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang mngon par shes pa dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is the perfection of the higher knowledges and wisdom.

original: 'og nas smos pa lta bu'i mngon par shes pa dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa rnams ni sems las su rung ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og nas smos pa lta bu'i mngon par shes pa dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa rnams ni sems las su rung ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of the higher knowledges and wisdom mentioned below is the result of the flexibility of mind.

original: gang gis gzugs su snang ba thams cad mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gi tshar phrugs lngas ni lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa rnams go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs su snang ba thams cad mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gi tshar phrugs lngas ni lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa rnams go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The five groups of verses beginning with ‚Äúhe sees all forms that appear‚Äù teach the divine eye, divine ear, knowledge of the minds of others, recollection of former lives, and the superknowledge of psychic power, respectively.

original: de man chad tshig gi tshar phrugs gsum gyis ni zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: de man chad tshig gi tshar phrugs gsum gyis ni zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa bstan te /
translated: The next three verses explain the superknowledge of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: dngos gsal ba rnams ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: dngos gsal ba rnams ni ma bshad do //
translated: The explicit topics are not explained.

original: gang gis gzugs thams cad kyi chos nyid mi zad par @84a * //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs thams cad kyi chos nyid mi zad par @84a * //
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of all forms,üîΩeven though it is known, is not actualized.

original: shes kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis gzugs bzang po dang ngan pa la sogs pa lha'i mig gis mthong ngo cog thams cad kyi chos nyid chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid shes kyang mi zad pa'i chos mngon sum du mi byed de 'phags
analyzed: shes kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis gzugs bzang po dang ngan pa la sogs pa lha'i mig gis mthong ngo cog thams cad kyi chos nyid chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid shes kyang mi zad pa'i chos mngon sum du mi byed de 'phags
translated: This is the knowledge of the bodhisattva who, by means of the divine eye, sees all forms, good, bad, and so forth, and even though he knows the reality of all forms, the emptiness of the ultimate expanse, he does not actualize the extinction of phenomena.

original: pa'i nyan thos dag ltar mya ngan 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i nyan thos dag ltar mya ngan 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the knowledge that does not actualize nirvana, unlike the noble sravakas.

original: gang sgra thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar brjod du med bar shes pa ni sgra chen po'am chung du la sogs pa lha'i rna bas thos so cog 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mthar brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: gang sgra thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar brjod du med bar shes pa ni sgra chen po'am chung du la sogs pa lha'i rna bas thos so cog 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mthar brjod du med pa ste /
translated: The knowledge that all sounds are inexpressible in terms of the past and future is the divine ear that hears all sounds, whether great or small, etc.

original: dmigs su med par shes pa ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med par shes pa ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that they are not apprehended is called ‚Äúpristine wisdom.‚Äù

original: sems 'gog par shes pa ni sems kyi chos nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems 'gog par shes pa ni sems kyi chos nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral bar shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge that the mind is stopped is the knowledge that the reality of the mind is free from the duality of object apprehended and subject apprehender.

original: de ltar shes kyang sems kyi chos nyid sems 'gog pa mngon sum yang mi byed pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes kyang sems kyi chos nyid sems 'gog pa mngon sum yang mi byed pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though one knows that, if one does not manifest the stopping of the mind, which is the reality of the mind, this is called ‚Äúpristine wisdom.‚Äù

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' rjes su dran pa ni bdag dang pha rol rnams 'das pa'i dus na ji lta bur gyur cing byed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdag dang pha rol rnams ji ltar 'gyur ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' rjes su dran pa ni bdag dang pha rol rnams 'das pa'i dus na ji lta bur gyur cing byed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdag dang pha rol rnams ji ltar 'gyur ba shes pa'o //
translated: The recollection of past lives is the knowledge of how oneself and others were in the past, and the knowledge of how oneself and others will be in the future.

original: gang dus gsum la ma chags par shes pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams la mtshan ma dang dngos po nyid du mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gang dus gsum la ma chags par shes pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams la mtshan ma dang dngos po nyid du mi 'dzin cing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe knows the three times as unattached‚Äù means that he does not grasp the things of the three times as signs or as real things.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the three times as equality.

original: zhing nam mkha' dang mtshungs par shes pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' gser dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin ba ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhing nam mkha' dang mtshungs par shes pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' gser dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin ba ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe knows the field as like space‚Äù means that he knows the buddha fields as emptiness, just as space is not the intrinsic nature of anything, such as gold, lapis lazuli, and so on.

original: dbyer med pa'i chos ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rnam par grol bar ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i chos ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rnam par grol bar ro gcig pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe knows the Dharma as undifferentiated‚Äù means that the uncontaminated dharmas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Bhagavat Buddhas are the same in being liberated.üîΩThe desire to attain that is a superknowledge.

original: de lta bu thob par 'dod pa 'di ni mngon bar shes pa yin la de'i 'og tu zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang mnyam par mthong ste /
analyzed: de lta bu thob par 'dod pa 'di ni mngon bar shes pa yin la de'i 'og tu zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang mnyam par mthong ste /
translated: After that, he sees those uncontaminated dharmas as equal.

original: rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin du yang mi dmigs pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa la ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin du yang mi dmigs pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa la ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is spontaneously present in the nonconceptual gnosis that is not observed as having the nature of liberation is called ‚Äúwisdom.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni bzo dang / gso ba rig pa la sogs pa 'jig rten thams cad dbyer med cing thun mong du @84b gyur pa'i shes pa ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni bzo dang / gso ba rig pa la sogs pa 'jig rten thams cad dbyer med cing thun mong du @84b gyur pa'i shes pa ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya la /
translated: The ‚Äúknowledge of the characteristics of all worlds as being undifferentiated‚Äù is the knowledge that all worlds are undifferentiated and common, such as the knowledge of arts and medicine.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres par shes pa ni ye shes yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres par shes pa ni ye shes yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The knowledge that nonconceptual gnosis is not mixed with any worldly phenomena is wisdom.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mthus brgya byin la sogs pa mthu dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mthus brgya byin la sogs pa mthu dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa yin la /
translated: The ability to overpower ≈öakra and so on through the power of having exhausted the defilements is knowledge.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las kyang khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las kyang khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: It is superior to all the worldly and supramundane knowledge of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: spyi bor zhes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: spyi bor zhes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The ‚Äúcrown‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúwisdom.‚Äù

original: mdor na gang ji tsam du mtshan ma dang rtsol ba dang bcas pa thams cad la ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mdor na gang ji tsam du mtshan ma dang rtsol ba dang bcas pa thams cad la ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya /
translated: In brief, all that is associated with signs and effort is called ‚Äúsuperknowledge.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par shes pa thams cad ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par shes pa thams cad ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: All that is signless and spontaneously accomplished is called ‚Äúpristine wisdom.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dpag tu med pa'i gnyen por gyur pas gnyen po tshad med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dpag tu med pa'i gnyen por gyur pas gnyen po tshad med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the immeasurability of the antidotes to the immeasurable discordant classes,

original: yang sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba ji snyed par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: yang sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba ji snyed par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever the mental afflictions and distractions of all sentient beings are‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ji snyed yod pa dang / dmigs pa de dang de dag la brten nas skad cig kyang mi gnas pa'i sems g-yeng ba ji snyed yod pa dang / spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang /
analyzed: / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ji snyed yod pa dang / dmigs pa de dang de dag la brten nas skad cig kyang mi gnas pa'i sems g-yeng ba ji snyed yod pa dang / spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang /
translated: The accumulations of mental afflictions of all sentient beings, and the distractions of the mind that do not remain for even a moment in dependence on this and that object of observation, and the accumulations of meditative stabilization of the bodhisattvas that are the antidotes that abandon those, are immeasurable.

original: sems gzhag pa shes pa yang de snyed cig yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems gzhag pa shes pa yang de snyed cig yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is what it says.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dpag tu med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dpag tu med de /
translated: It teaches that the afflictions of sentient beings and the distraction of the mind are immeasurable.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa shes pa yang dpag tu med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa shes pa yang dpag tu med do zhes ston to //
translated: Likewise, the accumulation of the bodhisattva‚Äôs meditative stabilization and the knowledge of the placement of the mind are also immeasurable.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi tshogs ni bsam gtan gyi rgyu la bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi tshogs ni bsam gtan gyi rgyu la bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the accumulation of meditative stabilization should be understood as the cause of meditative stabilization.

original: sems gzhag pa shes pa ni 'bras bu la bya'o //
analyzed: sems gzhag pa shes pa ni 'bras bu la bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the placement of the mind should be understood as the result.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba ji snyed pa de snyed du byang chub sems dpas kyang bsam gtan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba ji snyed pa de snyed du byang chub sems dpas kyang bsam gtan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva should accomplish the accumulation of meditative stabilization to the same extent as the afflictions and distraction of all sentient beings‚Äù

original: sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba de ltar dpag tu med pas na /
analyzed: sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba de ltar dpag tu med pas na /
translated: teaches that since the afflictions and distraction of sentient beings are immeasurable,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi tshogs bsgrub par 'dod pas kyang /üîΩsems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dpag tu med pa'i gnyen po @85a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi tshogs bsgrub par 'dod pas kyang / sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dpag tu med pa'i gnyen po @85a * //
translated: Also, bodhisattvas who wish to accomplish the requisites of meditative stabilizationüîΩshould accomplish the requisites of meditative stabilization, which are the antidotes to the immeasurable afflictions and distractions of sentient beings,

original: bsam gtan gyi tshogs kyang dpag tu med pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tshogs kyang dpag tu med pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: and which are immeasurable.

original: nges pa'i tshig gis dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa la gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gis dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa la gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the purification of the nondiscursive stabilization on the object,

original: mnyam pa nyid de la gnas pas na de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la gnas pas na de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause of abiding in that sameness, therefore it is called meditative stabilization.‚Äù

original: gang du smos pa sems gzhag pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu zhum pa dang / rgod pa spangs pa yin pas mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang du smos pa sems gzhag pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu zhum pa dang / rgod pa spangs pa yin pas mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the placement of the mind, which is mentioned above, is the result of the requisites of meditative stabilization, and is called ‚Äúsameness‚Äù because it is the abandonment of laxity and excitement.

original: de la gnas pas na /
analyzed: de la gnas pas na /
translated: Abiding in that,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called ‚Äúthe mind in meditative stabilization.‚Äù

original: yang na sngar smos pa lta bu'i chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pas na mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sngar smos pa lta bu'i chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pas na mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúequipoise‚Äù because one places the mind one-pointedly on the sameness of phenomena, as mentioned above.

original: yang na mnyam pa nyid de ni 'og nas smos pa ste /
analyzed: yang na mnyam pa nyid de ni 'og nas smos pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that sameness is mentioned below.

original: gang dang gang dag mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang gang dag mnyam zhe na /
translated: What is the sameness of?

original: sems can mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to what is said, ‚Äúthe sameness of sentient beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can las nyon mongs pa ming gis smos pa de dag ni yang dag par na ji skad du brjod pa bzhin grub pa med de thams cad ro gcig cing mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can las nyon mongs pa ming gis smos pa de dag ni yang dag par na ji skad du brjod pa bzhin grub pa med de thams cad ro gcig cing mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Those sentient beings, whose karma and afflictions are mentioned by name, do not truly exist as they are described. They are all of one taste and the same.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la gnas pas na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la gnas pas na /
translated: Because one abides in that sameness,

original: de phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is therefore called ‚Äúequipoise.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang dang mnyam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes byang chub kyang de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang dang mnyam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes byang chub kyang de dang mnyam ste /
translated: The characteristic of samƒÅdhi, the one-pointed mind, and the nondual wisdom of awakening are the same.

original: stong pa nyid du 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means they are the same in emptiness.

original: de bzhin du tshig 'og ma rnams la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩbyang chub gang dang mnyam pa stong pa nyid kyang de dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig 'og ma rnams la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o // byang chub gang dang mnyam pa stong pa nyid kyang de dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same should be extensively applied to the following lines.üîΩThat emptiness which is the same as enlightenment is also the same as the meditative stabilization of emptiness.

original: byang chub dang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rang bzhin gcig ste /
analyzed: byang chub dang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rang bzhin gcig ste /
translated: This means that enlightenment and the meditative stabilization of emptiness are of the same nature,

original: yang dag par na tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par na tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and that in reality they are not different.üîΩThat non-conditioning which is the same as non-arising is also the same as the non-arising of the element of dharmas.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang dang mnyam pa mi skye ba yang de dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid dang / mi skye ba don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang dang mnyam pa mi skye ba yang de dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid dang / mi skye ba don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that the reality free from the conditioning of virtue, non-virtue, and so forth, and non-arising are synonymous.

original: de bzhin du mi 'byung ba dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po med par yang rang bzhin gcig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'byung ba dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po med par yang rang bzhin gcig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, non-occurrence, the non-existence of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, and the absence of entities are also of the same nature.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa'i dri ma'i dngos po med de de dang bral ba nyid rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa'i dri ma'i dngos po med de de dang bral ba nyid rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: There is no substance of the stain of the conception of the apprehended and the apprehender, and it is just the freedom from that which is purity,

original: glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of being free from the stain of adventitious defilement.

original: rang gi sems kyi rang @85b bzhin de ltar gzod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du mnyam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yang 'dra bar yun ring po nas bsgom zhing mnyam pa nyid de la zhugs pas na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi rang @85b bzhin de ltar gzod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du mnyam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yang 'dra bar yun ring po nas bsgom zhing mnyam pa nyid de la zhugs pas na de'i phyir /
translated: The nature of one‚Äôs own mind is like that, primordially pure by nature, and the nature of the mind of all sentient beings is the same. Having cultivated that sameness for a long time, and having entered into that sameness,

original: snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore, it is called ‚Äúequipoise.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid la byed pa spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas phan par byed pa dang / phan par mi byed pa thams cad la snyoms shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid la byed pa spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas phan par byed pa dang / phan par mi byed pa thams cad la snyoms shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In terms of abandoning the mental activity of the discordant side, it is said, ‚Äúbeing even-minded toward all those who are helpful and those who are not.‚Äù

original: phan par byed pa ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are helpful are those who benefit.

original: phan par mi byed pa ni gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: phan par mi byed pa ni gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: Those who are not helpful are those who harm.

original: de gnyis la 'dra bar sems pas na snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la 'dra bar sems pas na snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these two are considered to be similar, it is called ‚Äúevenness‚Äù.

original: snyoms pa'i dpes bstan pa'i phyir sa dang mnyam pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snyoms pa'i dpes bstan pa'i phyir sa dang mnyam pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to illustrate evenness, he says, ‚Äúa mind that is like the earth‚Äù, and so on.

original: mi mtho ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pas rlom sems su mi byed par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi mtho ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pas rlom sems su mi byed par gnas pa'o //
translated: Not elevated means that one does not become conceited by attaining a special meditative concentration.

original: mi dma' ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mang zhing rgya che bdag thos nas bsgrub mi nus so snyam du sems zhum pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mi dma' ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mang zhing rgya che bdag thos nas bsgrub mi nus so snyam du sems zhum pa med pa ste /
translated: Not low means that one‚Äôs mind does not become discouraged, thinking, ‚ÄúI cannot practice after hearing about the many and vast meditative concentrations of the bodhisattvas‚Äù.

original: de ltar mi mtho mi dma' bar gnas pas mi g-yo bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mi mtho mi dma' bar gnas pas mi g-yo bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by remaining neither elevated nor low, one becomes unshakeable.

original: gang gis kyang bskyod mi nus par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis kyang bskyod mi nus par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes incapable of being shaken by anything.

original: spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus dang / sems dang / ngag yongs su dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus dang / sems dang / ngag yongs su dag pa bstan te /
translated: In all activities, he is said to be ‚Äúequipoised‚Äù, and so on. This teaches the complete purity of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'gro ba dang 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa dang / de yang so sor kun tu brtags nas mnyam par gzhag pa ltar bcos pa ma yin pas spyod lam ma bcos pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa dang / de yang so sor kun tu brtags nas mnyam par gzhag pa ltar bcos pa ma yin pas spyod lam ma bcos pa ste /
translated: And since he is not in meditative equipoise by way of a contrived, fabricated meditative equipoise, he is in uncontrived activities.

original: tshig de gnyis kyis ni lus yongs su dag par bstan te ;
analyzed: tshig de gnyis kyis ni lus yongs su dag par bstan te ;
translated: These two phrases indicate the purity of his body.

original: so sor kun tu brtags nas snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: so sor kun tu brtags nas snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: He is not in meditative equipoise by way of a contrived, fabricated meditative equipoise.

original: dus thams cad du rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs pa dang / rgyu ba'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul la mi rgod pa dang / gnas pa'i tshe 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems la sogs pa la mi g-yeng ba'i tshig de gsum gyis sems yongs su dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: dus thams cad du rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs pa dang / rgyu ba'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul la mi rgod pa dang / gnas pa'i tshe 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems la sogs pa la mi g-yeng ba'i tshig de gsum gyis sems yongs su dag pa bstan to //
translated: He is naturally in meditative equipoise at all times, and when he moves, he is not agitated by the objects of the sense faculties such as the eyes, and when he stays still, he is not distracted by desire, malice, and so forth. These three phrases indicate the purity of his mind.

original: ran par smra zhing mang du mi smra bas mu cor mi smra ba dang / chos smra ba dang bden par smra bas tshig ma 'chal pa de gnyis kyis ni ngag yongs su dag pa bstan to //üîΩdon shes pa la sogs pas ni bsgom @86a * //
analyzed: ran par smra zhing mang du mi smra bas mu cor mi smra ba dang / chos smra ba dang bden par smra bas tshig ma 'chal pa de gnyis kyis ni ngag yongs su dag pa bstan to // don shes pa la sogs pas ni bsgom @86a * //
translated: By speaking appropriately and not speaking much, one does not speak nonsense. By speaking Dharma and speaking the truth, one does not speak falsely. These two show verbal purity.

original: par bya ba'i dan dang chos dang / sgom pa'i dus shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: par bya ba'i dan dang chos dang / sgom pa'i dus shes pa bstan te /
translated: By knowing the meaning, etc., one knows the object of meditation, the Dharma, and the time of meditation.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi don shes pa dang / ming dang tshig dang yi ges bsdus pa gsung rab kyi yan lag gi chos shes pa gnyis kyis ni gang bsgom par bya ba shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi don shes pa dang / ming dang tshig dang yi ges bsdus pa gsung rab kyi yan lag gi chos shes pa gnyis kyis ni gang bsgom par bya ba shes pa bstan to //
translated: By knowing the meaning of the dharmas such as emptiness and selflessness, and by knowing the Dharma of the branches of the scriptures subsumed by names, phrases and letters, one knows what is to be meditated upon.

original: dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid dang / sos ka'i dus gang gi tshe ji ltar bsgom pa shes pas dus shes pa dang / de la yang nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la sogs pa gang gi che bsgom pa shes pas tshod shes pa dang /üîΩ'di ni ldang ba'i dus so //üîΩ'di ni zas kyi dus so //
analyzed: dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid dang / sos ka'i dus gang gi tshe ji ltar bsgom pa shes pas dus shes pa dang / de la yang nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la sogs pa gang gi che bsgom pa shes pas tshod shes pa dang / 'di ni ldang ba'i dus so // 'di ni zas kyi dus so //
translated: Knowing the time of meditation by knowing the time of day, such as the first part of the night, the last part of the night and so forth.üîΩKnowing the time of meditation by knowing the right time, such as this is the time to rise, this is the time to eat, this is the time to sleep, this is the time to walk, this is the time to meditate.üîΩKnowing the wrong time, such as this is the time to rise, this is the time to eat, this is the time to sleep, this is the time to walk, this is the time to meditate.

original: 'di ni 'chags pa'i dus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa shes pa ni dus min pa shes pa ste tshig de dag gis ni bsgom pa'i dus shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chags pa'i dus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa shes pa ni dus min pa shes pa ste tshig de dag gis ni bsgom pa'i dus shes pa bstan to //
translated: By these words the knowledge of the time of meditation is taught.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su snyegs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bas zin pa ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su snyegs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bas zin pa ston te /
translated: By following all worldly ways and so forth, the bodhisattva's concentration is taught as being embraced by the union of means and wisdom.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa yin yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ched du rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs la sogs pa 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su snyegs te de dag mthun par spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa yin yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ched du rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs la sogs pa 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su snyegs te de dag mthun par spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang yang ldan la /
translated: As previously explained, he is in meditative equipoise in all activities. However, in order to bring sentient beings to full maturity, he follows all worldly people, such as those of the warrior and noble classes, and he also possesses the skillful means of acting in accordance with them.

original: shes rab kyis zin pas de dag gi nang na gnas kyang 'jig rten dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zin pas de dag gi nang na gnas kyang 'jig rten dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: But because he is embraced by wisdom, he remains among them without being contaminated by the world.

original: ji ltar ma 'dres she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'dres she na /
translated: How is he uncontaminated?

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las 'das pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las 'das pa /
translated: He is beyond the eight worldly concerns.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is uncontaminated by any afflictions.

original: 'du 'dzi'i nang na yang spyod lam dben pa ni sems can gyi don la 'jig rten gyi rjes su snyegs shing 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na gnas na yang sems dben cing rtse gcig tu gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i nang na yang spyod lam dben pa ni sems can gyi don la 'jig rten gyi rjes su snyegs shing 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na gnas na yang sems dben cing rtse gcig tu gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even though he acts in the midst of crowds and follows worldly people in order to benefit sentient beings, he remains in a solitary state of mind. This means that he remains in a state of single-pointed concentration even while living in the midst of crowds.

original: de lta bu'i chos la gnas pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i chos la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos la gnas pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i chos la gnas pa ste /
translated: Abiding in such Dharma is abiding in the Dharma just explained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni shes rab kyis yongs su brin pas nyon mongs pa dang 'jig rten gyi chos dag gi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi 'dor la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni shes rab kyis yongs su brin pas nyon mongs pa dang 'jig rten gyi chos dag gi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi 'dor la /
translated: That bodhisattva, through being fully engaged in wisdom, does not fall under the influence of the afflictions and mundane phenomena, and thus he does not abandon the state of non-equipoise.

original: thabs kyis yongs su zin pas 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams @86b cad du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: thabs kyis yongs su zin pas 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams @86b cad du yang snang ngo //
translated: And through being fully engaged in method, he also appears in all mundane activities.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i bsam gtan zhes bshad na /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i bsam gtan zhes bshad na /
translated: Having explained the concentration that is accomplished through method and wisdom,

original: thabs dang shes rab gang yin snyam nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i thabs ni gang shes rab ni gang zhen zhes dris pa dang / gnyen po rnam par dag pa la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gang yin snyam nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i thabs ni gang shes rab ni gang zhen zhes dris pa dang / gnyen po rnam par dag pa la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: it is wondered what method and wisdom are, and so it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattva‚Äôs method? What is wisdom?‚Äù

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gzhog pa na sems can la blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan thabs dang shes rab kyis zin pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gzhog pa na sems can la blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan thabs dang shes rab kyis zin pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The extensive explanation of the bodhisattva‚Äôs meditative concentration, which is embraced by method and wisdom, is stated in the lines beginning with ‚ÄúWhen the bodhisattva is resting in equipoise, he sees sentient beings.‚Äù

original: mnyam par gzhog pa ni zhes bya ba ni dang po rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhog pa ni zhes bya ba ni dang po rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúResting in equipoise‚Äù refers to the time of first entering into the yoga of meditative equipoise.

original: snying rje chen po'i dmigs pa la sems can 'dogs pa ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyis bsdus pa'i sems can thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du sdug bsngal ba yin no snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i dmigs pa la sems can 'dogs pa ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyis bsdus pa'i sems can thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du sdug bsngal ba yin no snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed
translated: The mental engagement that is the object of great compassion is the mental engagement that is the basis of the bodhisattva‚Äôs meditative concentration. The bodhisattva thinks, ‚ÄúAll sentient beings included within the realms, transmigrations, and birthplaces are suffering in accordance with the three types of suffering.‚Äù

original: pa ste ; de ni thabs so //
analyzed: pa ste ; de ni thabs so //
translated: This is the method.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yang rab tu spangs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yang rab tu spangs te /
translated: After that, the bodhisattva completely abandons the signs of sentient beings‚Äô suffering and so on.

original: rtog pa zhi ba dang spyod pa rab tu zhi bar bsam gtan du byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rtog pa zhi ba dang spyod pa rab tu zhi bar bsam gtan du byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva is the pacification of discursive thought and the pacification of activity in meditation.

original: tshig mthun pa rnams ni 'og ma dag la yang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig mthun pa rnams ni 'og ma dag la yang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: The same expression is to be applied to the following perfections.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni ye shes bzhi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni ye shes bzhi ste /
translated: The knowledge of the Buddha is the four knowledges.

original: de dag thob par bya'o snyam nas bsam gtan la 'jug pa ni ye shes la ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thob par bya'o snyam nas bsam gtan la 'jug pa ni ye shes la ston pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva enters into meditation thinking, ‚ÄúI will attain those.‚Äù

original: chos gang la yang mi gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la sogs pa gang la yang ma chags par bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang mi gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la sogs pa gang la yang ma chags par bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva practices meditation without attachment to anything, not dwelling on anything, not even the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: dam pa'i chos ni gsung rab kyi yan lag bcu gnyis po ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni gsung rab kyi yan lag bcu gnyis po ste /
translated: The holy Dharma is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de dag gi don dang tshig rnams gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan la 'jug pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don dang tshig rnams gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan la 'jug pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la lta ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva enters into meditation in order to retain their meaning and their words. This is called ‚Äúthe view of retaining the holy Dharma.‚Äù

original: gsung rab kyi yan lag de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba /
analyzed: gsung rab kyi yan lag de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba /
translated: All of the branches of the scriptures are directed toward suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa /
translated: they flow toward suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid la bab pa'i don du 'dra bar 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan ni chos dbyer med par bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la bab pa'i don du 'dra bar 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan ni chos dbyer med par bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: The concentration that observes the Dharma, which is the same and mixed in the sense of being based on reality, is the concentration on the indivisibility of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i rgyan ni mtshan dang dpe byad dge ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i rgyan ni mtshan dang dpe byad dge ste /
translated: The ornaments of the Buddha‚Äôs body are the major and minor marks.

original: de dag re re nas yid la byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag re re nas yid la byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: To keep them in mind one by one is to actualize them.

original: chos kyi sku dbyer med pa @87a * //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dbyer med pa @87a * //
translated: The indivisibility of the body of truth

original: ni mtshan dang dpe byad dag gis mtshan nyid du dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: ni mtshan dang dpe byad dag gis mtshan nyid du dbyer med pa'o //
translated: is the indivisibility of the major and minor marks.

original: chos nyid brjod du med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis btags te brjod pa yang 'dul ba'i skye bo'i ngor brjod par zad kyi chos nyid ni des kyang brjod du med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid brjod du med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis btags te brjod pa yang 'dul ba'i skye bo'i ngor brjod par zad kyi chos nyid ni des kyang brjod du med par shes pa'o //
translated: The inexpressible nature of phenomena is the nature of the Buddha‚Äôs speech, the melody of Brahma‚Äôs voice, which is designated and expressed by the Buddha in accordance with the beings to be trained, but one should understand that the nature of phenomena is not even expressed by that.

original: sems rdo rje lta bur byin gyis rlob pa ni sems la nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rma mi phyin pa dang / sems kyi nyon mongs pa rnams 'bigs par mthu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems rdo rje lta bur byin gyis rlob pa ni sems la nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rma mi phyin pa dang / sems kyi nyon mongs pa rnams 'bigs par mthu skyed pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the mind as being like a vajra is the development of the power not to be wounded by defilements in the mind and to pierce the defilements of the mind.

original: rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba med par bsam gtan byed pa ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba med par bsam gtan byed pa ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Meditation without natural distraction is the nature of mind free from subject and object, slackness, excitement, and so on.

original: de kho na bzhin du bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: Meditation is just that.

original: sngon gyi smon lam ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes smon lam btab pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes smon lam btab pa ste /
translated: Previous aspiration is the aspiration made at the beginning when one first generates the intention to become enlightened, namely, to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: des da yang bsam gtan la brten nas rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes sems kyi mthu bskyed cing /
analyzed: des da yang bsam gtan la brten nas rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes sems kyi mthu bskyed cing /
translated: On that basis, one now generates the power of mind to bring sentient beings to full maturity by means of supernormal powers and so on, in dependence on the meditative absorptions.

original: byin gyis rlob pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa ni thabs so //
translated: Empowerment is the method.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa ni bsam gtan 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed do snyam du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa ni bsam gtan 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed do snyam du dmigs pa'o //
translated: The special focus on all the roots of virtue is the focus on the thought that through this meditative absorption one will generate the roots of virtue such as absence of attachment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ni bsam gtan dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis ka yang rang bzhin med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ni bsam gtan dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis ka yang rang bzhin med par mthong ba'o //
translated: The root of virtue is the insight that both are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bzhin las grub pa /üîΩtha gru che zhing mnyam pa la sogs pa mdo bzhin las grub pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bzhin las grub pa / tha gru che zhing mnyam pa la sogs pa mdo bzhin las grub pa /
translated: The field of the Buddha is established from karma.üîΩIt is vast, level, and so forth, as described in the scriptures.

original: tha gru che zhing mnyam pa la sogs pa mdo dag las gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: tha gru che zhing mnyam pa la sogs pa mdo dag las gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is vast, level, and so forth, as described in the scriptures.

original: de lta bu dag gzung bar sems pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag gzung bar sems pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: To conceive of such a field is to actualize it.

original: byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan bkod pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i tshe bskal pa du mar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus byang chub kyi shing dang / rdo rje'i gdan la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa mdo dag las gsungs pa ste de lta bu thob par bya ba'i bsam pa sngon du gtong ba ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan bkod pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i tshe bskal pa du mar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus byang chub kyi shing dang / rdo rje'i gdan la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa mdo dag las gsungs pa ste de lta bu thob par bya ba'i bsam pa sngon du gtong ba ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The array of ornaments of the site of enlightenment is actualized by the prior intention to attain the perfection of the tree of enlightenment, the adamantine throne, and so forth, as described in the scriptures, through the cause of accumulating the collections of merit and knowledge over many eons at the time of manifest enlightenment.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang bcas pa ste /
translated: All afflictions are afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, together with their latent states.

original: de dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhig sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhig sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúpacify‚Äù is applied to them.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'dod pa @87b ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa bshad par bya ba'i bsam pa sngon du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'dod pa @87b ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa bshad par bya ba'i bsam pa sngon du gtong ba'o //
translated: The desire to turn the wheel of the Dharma is the prior intention to explain the four noble truths and so on, after the attainment of manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: bskor ba yang med pa ni chos rnams brjod du med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa bshad du med pa'o //
analyzed: bskor ba yang med pa ni chos rnams brjod du med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa bshad du med pa'o //
translated: The non-turning is the inexplicability of the four noble truths and so on, because phenomena are inexpressible.

original: mi bskor ba yang med pa ni ji ltar brjod du med kyang de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs tsam du ming dang brdar btags te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskor ba yang med pa ni ji ltar brjod du med kyang de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs tsam du ming dang brdar btags te bshad pa'o //
translated: The non-non-turning is the mere method for realizing that, which is the explanation by the designation of names and symbols, even though it is inexpressible.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste de gnyis la sems rtse gcig tu bsgom pa'i bsam pa mngon du gtong ba ni rnam par mi g-yeng ba mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste de gnyis la sems rtse gcig tu bsgom pa'i bsam pa mngon du gtong ba ni rnam par mi g-yeng ba mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The collection of the limbs of enlightenment is serenity and insight, and the intention to cultivate those two with a one-pointed mind is the manifestation of non-distraction.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: The torment of the afflictions and secondary afflictions is passion, etc.

original: de dag nyid sems kyi rgyud gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid sems kyi rgyud gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They torment the continuum of the mind.

original: de dag su'i spyod yul zhe na /
analyzed: de dag su'i spyod yul zhe na /
translated: Whose domain are they?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are known by the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag thams cad las kyang kha cig ni sems dang ldan /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag thams cad las kyang kha cig ni sems dang ldan /
translated: Some of those afflictions and secondary afflictions are associated with mind,

original: kha cig ni sems dang mi ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems dang mi ldan pa yin la /
translated: and some are not associated with mind.

original: de dag gi nang nas kyang kha cig ni 'du shes med pa /
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas kyang kha cig ni 'du shes med pa /
translated: Among them, some are without ideation,

original: kha cig ni 'du shes dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'du shes dang bcas pa ste /
translated: and some are with ideation.

original: de dag bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In order to eliminate them,

original: nges par gyur pa ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mngon sum du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: nges par gyur pa ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mngon sum du rtogs pa ste /
translated: The certain is the realization of the direct intuition of the pure Dharma-element on the first spiritual level,

original: de las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to change that.

original: de dang mthun pa ni sa dang po rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa mos pa dang spyod pa'i sa gzhi po rnams kyi shes pa bskyed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa ni sa dang po rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa mos pa dang spyod pa'i sa gzhi po rnams kyi shes pa bskyed pa la bya'o //
translated: The concordant is the knowledge of those on the stages of faithful action and the tenfold stage of action out of faith, which is concordant with the realization of the first spiritual level.

original: mdor na ji tsam du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i smon pa dang / re ba sngon du gtong ba ni thabs su shes par bya la /
analyzed: mdor na ji tsam du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i smon pa dang / re ba sngon du gtong ba ni thabs su shes par bya la /
translated: In brief, one should know that the method is the aspiration and hope that precedes the possession of signs, for the sake of the full maturation of sentient beings, the full maturation of the qualities of the Buddha, and the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: ji tsam du de dag gi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: ji tsam du de dag gi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: And the full maturation of the Buddha-qualities is the non-apprehension of the nature of those.

original: shes rab tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab tu shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the latter is wisdom.

original: de lta mod kyi sems rab tu sbyangs pa'i mthus byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe na dus gcig tu thabs dang shes rab gnyis la spyod kyang thabs kyi dbang du gyur pas mtshan ma 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa'am /üîΩshes rab kyi dbang du gyur nas thabs dang bral na mtshan ma med pa nyi tshe @88a * //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sems rab tu sbyangs pa'i mthus byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe na dus gcig tu thabs dang shes rab gnyis la spyod kyang thabs kyi dbang du gyur pas mtshan ma 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa'am / shes rab kyi dbang du gyur nas thabs dang bral na mtshan ma med pa nyi tshe @88a * //
translated: However, when he is under the influence of method, he only focuses on signs,

original: sgom pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgom pa yang ma yin te /
translated: or when he is under the influence of wisdom, he is without method and only meditates on signlessness.

original: gnyis ka la lhun gyis grub par spyod pa de ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la lhun gyis grub par spyod pa de ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: But when he practices both spontaneously, that is called concentration that is the union of method and wisdom.üîΩAnd all mƒÅras will find no opportunity to harm him.

original: bdud thams cad kyis kyang de la glags mi rnyed ces bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni bdud rnams kyis bar chad bya bar yang mi nus la /
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis kyang de la glags mi rnyed ces bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni bdud rnams kyis bar chad bya bar yang mi nus la /
translated: The mƒÅras are unable to create obstacles for the bodhisattva who is abiding in the perfection of concentration as just explained.

original: bdud rnams kyi dbang du yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdud rnams kyi dbang du yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and also, he does not come under the power of the demons.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod kyang nye bar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni gsung rab thams cad kyi snod du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod kyang nye bar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni gsung rab thams cad kyi snod du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And he is also a vessel for all the Buddha-dharmas means that he becomes a vessel for all the scriptures.

original: de ltar ting 'dzin 'di dag mtha' yas dpag med de //
analyzed: de ltar ting 'dzin 'di dag mtha' yas dpag med de //
translated: Thus, these samadhis are infinite, immeasurable.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du ming gis smos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dag dang / ting nge 'dzin de dag lta bu gzhan yang mtha' yas te 'di snyed cig yod do zhes dpag par mi nus pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du ming gis smos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dag dang / ting nge 'dzin de dag lta bu gzhan yang mtha' yas te 'di snyed cig yod do zhes dpag par mi nus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those samadhis mentioned above by name, and other samadhis like them, are infinite, and their number cannot be measured.

original: bsam gtan bye ba khrag khrig dag gi pha rol song //
analyzed: bsam gtan bye ba khrag khrig dag gi pha rol song //
translated: He has gone beyond a trillion samadhis.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa /
translated: The meaning is that he has gone beyond the perfection of samadhi explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin de ltar mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa rnam par dag par rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin de ltar mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa rnam par dag par rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: bsam gtan mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsam gtan mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The imperishability of meditative stabilization has now been explained.

original: // / shes rab mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos la mi nyams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: // / shes rab mi zad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos la mi nyams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the imperishability of wisdom is called the bodhisattva who does not decline in the Dharma.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: btsun pa sha ra ca ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyang mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra ca ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyang mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, the wisdom of the bodhisattvas is also imperishable.

original: de mi zad pa yang 'og nas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa ji snyed pa shes rab dang ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang 'og nas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa ji snyed pa shes rab dang ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: And its imperishability is demonstrated below by statements such as: The wisdom and gnosis activities of the bodhisattvas are equal to the number of minds and activities of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa nam mkha' bzhin mtha' thug pa med pa la dmigs pas zad mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa nam mkha' bzhin mtha' thug pa med pa la dmigs pas zad mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it focuses on the minds and activities of all sentient beings, which are as limitless as space.

original: yang na snying rje chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi phyir bsgrub pa dang / shes bya mtha' med pa'i yul la dmigs pa dang / rnam par ma rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pa'i phyir shes rab mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na snying rje chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi phyir bsgrub pa dang / shes bya mtha' med pa'i yul la dmigs pa dang / rnam par ma rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pa'i phyir shes rab mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is called inexhaustible wisdom because it arises from the cause of great compassion, it is accomplished for the sake of all sentient beings, it focuses on the object of limitless knowable phenomena, and it is imbued with nonconceptual wisdom.

original: shes rab mi zad pa de yang rnam pa @88b bdun du lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa de yang rnam pa @88b bdun du lta ste /
translated: That inexhaustible wisdom is also viewed in seven aspects:

original: shes rab kyi rnam pa dang / 'jug pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang yul dang / las rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rnam pa dang / 'jug pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang yul dang / las rnams so //
translated: its aspects, its engagement, its verbal expression, its result, its nature, its object, and its activity.

original: de las rnam pa ni thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhis bstan /
analyzed: de las rnam pa ni thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhis bstan /
translated: Its aspects are taught by the eighty-four aspects of wisdom.

original: 'jug pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa sum cu rtsa gcig gis bstan /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa sum cu rtsa gcig gis bstan /
translated: Its engagement is taught by the thirty-one kinds of proper mental attention.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni rigs pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi tshar gyis bstan te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni rigs pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi tshar gyis bstan te /
translated: The definition is the words of reasoning.

original: 'bras bu ni tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan /
translated: The result is taught by ‚Äúthe proper way is all phenomena‚Äù and so forth.

original: rang bzhin ni 'grogs pa bcu drug dang lhan cig mi gnas pas bstan /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni 'grogs pa bcu drug dang lhan cig mi gnas pas bstan /
translated: The nature is taught by ‚Äúit does not abide together with the sixteen faults.‚Äù

original: yul ni chos brgyad la mkhas pas bstan /
analyzed: yul ni chos brgyad la mkhas pas bstan /

analyzed: yang na shes rab mi zad pa de yang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang / shes rab kyi 'jug pa dang / shes rab kyi rgyu dang / shes rab de shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa dang / shes rab kyi yul dang /
translated: Alternatively, that inexhaustible wisdom is also taught by the nature of wisdom, the engagement of wisdom, the cause of wisdom, the mixing of wisdom with the factors that are incompatible with wisdom, the domain of wisdom, the result of wisdom, and the essence of wisdom.

analyzed: shes rab kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / shes rab kyi 'bras bu dang / bstan pa'i bdag nyid chen po brjod pas bstan to //

analyzed: de la thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhi ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa sum cu rtsa gnyis ni shes rab kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa sum cu rtsa gnyis ni shes rab kyi 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rgyu'o //

translated: Therein, ‚Äúwisdom does not abide together with the sixteen companions‚Äù and so forth are the unadulteratedness of that wisdom with the factors that are discordant with wisdom.

original: phung po la sogs pa chos brgyad ni shes rab kyi yul lo //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa chos brgyad ni shes rab kyi yul lo //
translated: The eight dharmas such as the aggregates are the object of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: Moreover, the etymology of wisdom is as follows: ‚ÄúIt is the thorough knowledge of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena, etc.‚Äù

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô imperishable wisdom.

analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa 'dis ye shes mi zad pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Through this imperishable wisdom, they attain imperishable gnosis.‚Äù This is the result of wisdom.

translated: ‚ÄúThis chapter on the Dharma that teaches the imperishability of wisdom,‚Äù etc.

original: pas ni bstan pa'i bdag nyid chen po brjod pa bstan to //üîΩshes rab de'i rnam pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni shes rab de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pas ni bstan pa'i bdag nyid chen po brjod pa bstan to // shes rab de'i rnam pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni shes rab de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'jug pa ni ci zhes bya ba ni shes rab des chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la ji ltar rtog ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni ci zhes bya ba ni shes rab des chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la ji ltar rtog ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is its engagement?‚Äù This means, ‚ÄúHow does that wisdom investigate the characteristics of phenomena?‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i sgra ni rtog par byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgra ni rtog par byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúengagement‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúto understand.‚Äù

original: de skad dris pa dang lan du thos pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de skad dris pa dang lan du thos pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: When asked in this way, the answer is that hearing is the aspect,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'jug pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'jug pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: and proper mental attention is the engagement.

original: thos pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: thos pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin la /
