analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sgo nas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because one comes to understand the characteristics of phenomena through proper mental attention, proper mental attention is called the engagement.

original: yang na rnam pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu bye brag tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu bye brag tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the aspect is the discernment of the nature of wisdom,

original: de yang thos pa las shes rab kyi bye brag phyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang thos pa las shes rab kyi bye brag phyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and that is discerned through wisdom that arises from hearing.

original: de bas na thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag las shes rab 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag las shes rab 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because wisdom arises from those eighty-four aspects of hearing,

original: brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po dag ni shes rab kyi bye brag gam rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po dag ni shes rab kyi bye brag gam rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
translated: those eighty-four are called the different types or categories of wisdom.

original: yang na shes rab de'i rnam pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yang na shes rab de'i rnam pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
translated: Or, what is the aspect of that wisdom?üîΩThis is a question about its cause.

original: shes rab de'i rgyu gang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab de'i rgyu gang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the cause of that wisdom?

original: 'di lta ste 'dun pa'i rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag gang yin pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dun pa'i rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag gang yin pa ston te /
translated: It is taught that the fourteen aspects of hearing are as follows:

original: 'dun pa ni chos nyan par 'dod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni chos nyan par 'dod pa la bya ste /
translated: Aspiration is the desire to listen to the Dharma.

original: nyan par 'dod pa las thos pa dang shes rab 'byung gi 'dod pa med na mi 'byung bas de'i phyir 'dun pa ni shes rab 'byung ba'i rgyur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan par 'dod pa las thos pa dang shes rab 'byung gi 'dod pa med na mi 'byung bas de'i phyir 'dun pa ni shes rab 'byung ba'i rgyur rig par bya'o //
translated: Wisdom arises from hearing, not from the absence of desire to hear. Therefore, aspiration should be known as the cause of the arising of wisdom.

original: yang na thos pa las 'dun pa'i rnam pa 'byung gi ma thos pa las ma yin pas thos pa ni 'dun pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: yang na thos pa las 'dun pa'i rnam pa 'byung gi ma thos pa las ma yin pas thos pa ni 'dun pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Or, the aspect of aspiration arises from hearing, not from not hearing. Therefore, hearing is the cause of the arising of aspiration.

original: 'dun pa dang thos pa gnyis gcig gi rgyu gcig yin par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang thos pa gnyis gcig gi rgyu gcig yin par blta'o //
translated: Both aspiration and hearing should be seen as the cause of each other.

original: yang na shes rab kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu zhes dris pa na /
translated: Or, when asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of wisdom?‚Äù

original: 'dun pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab de 'dun pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab de 'dun pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe aspect of aspiration‚Äù means that wisdom has the nature of aspiration.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa'i sgra ni bsam pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa'i sgra ni bsam pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the term ‚Äúaspect‚Äù should be applied to the remaining categories, such as the aspect of reflection.

original: bsam pa'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: bsam pa'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspect of reflection

original: gong du bsam pa mi zad pa'i skabs su rgya cher bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bsam pa mi zad pa'i skabs su rgya cher bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: is the same as the one that was explained in detail above in the chapter on the Inexhaustibility of the Bodhisattvas‚Äô Generosity.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na bsam pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na bsam pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, there are two kinds of reflection:

original: phan par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: phan par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: the reflection that seeks to benefit and the reflection that seeks to bring happiness.

original: @89b de la phan par bya ba'i bsam pa ni mi dge ba'i gnas nas ston nas dge ba'i gnas su 'god par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @89b de la phan par bya ba'i bsam pa ni mi dge ba'i gnas nas ston nas dge ba'i gnas su 'god par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reflection that seeks to benefit is the desire to remove beings from opportunities nonvirtuous and to establish them in opportunities virtuous.

original: bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa ni sems can phongs pa dang / mgon med pa dang / rten med pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can spangs te phan pa'i dngos po bsgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa ni sems can phongs pa dang / mgon med pa dang / rten med pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can spangs te phan pa'i dngos po bsgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reflection that seeks to bring happiness is the desire to remove the afflicted emotions of those who are destitute, helpless, and without support and to provide them with the necessities of life.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa ni gong du lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa'i skabs su rgya cher bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa ni gong du lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa'i skabs su rgya cher bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: The aspects of superior intention should be understood as they are explained in detail in the chapter on the inexhaustibility of superior intention.

original: sbyor ba'i bsam pa ni sbyor ba mi zad pa'i skabs su rgya cher bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bsam pa ni sbyor ba mi zad pa'i skabs su rgya cher bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: The attitude of application should be understood as it is explained in detail in the chapter on the inexhaustibility of application.

original: de yang mdor bsdus na rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdus na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Moreover, in brief, it is sixfold:

original: phongs pa sel ba'i sbyor pa dang ; mos pa la sbyor ba dang / bsgrub pa la sbyor pa dang / shes bzhin du srid par skye ba la sbyor ba dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs par sbyor ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa bzod pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phongs pa sel ba'i sbyor pa dang ; mos pa la sbyor ba dang / bsgrub pa la sbyor pa dang / shes bzhin du srid par skye ba la sbyor ba dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs par sbyor ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa bzod pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application in eliminating poverty, application in devotion, application in accomplishment, application in consciously taking birth in existence, application in completing the collections, and application in enduring the hardships of practice.

original: sems can dngos po gang gis phongs pa de la de gtong ba ni phongs pa sel ba la sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can dngos po gang gis phongs pa de la de gtong ba ni phongs pa sel ba la sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Application in eliminating poverty is the giving of whatever things sentient beings lack.

original: de yang sbyin pa mi zad pa'i skabs su zas 'dod pa la zas sbyin par byed pa dang / btung ba 'dod pa la btung ba sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa mi zad pa'i skabs su zas 'dod pa la zas sbyin par byed pa dang / btung ba 'dod pa la btung ba sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, in the context of inexhaustible generosity, it is said that ‚Äúone gives food to those who desire food, one gives drink to those who desire drink,‚Äù and so on.

original: mos pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid la mos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid la mos par byed pa'o //
translated: Application to devotion is devotion to suchness, which is characterized by the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sgrub pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni rtag tu gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni rtag tu gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Application to accomplishment is always accomplishing the aims of others.

original: gang sbyor ba mi zad pa'i skabs su dge ba'i rtsa ba la rab tu gzung pa'i phyir sems can byang chub kyi sems 'dzin du 'jug pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sbyor ba mi zad pa'i skabs su dge ba'i rtsa ba la rab tu gzung pa'i phyir sems can byang chub kyi sems 'dzin du 'jug pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the context of inexhaustible application, it is said that ‚Äúthe intention to cause sentient beings to take up the thought of awakening in order to firmly grasp the roots of virtue is the bodhisattva‚Äôs inexhaustible application.‚Äù

original: shes bzhin du srid par skye ba la sbyor ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes bzhin du srid par skye ba la sbyor ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Application to consciously engage in birth in existence is not to be born in the three realms through the power of karma and afflictions.

original: smon lam gyis shes bzhin du 'khor bar skye ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyis shes bzhin du 'khor bar skye ba'o //
translated: It is to consciously engage in birth in cyclic existence through aspiration.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sbyor ba ni bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sbyor ba ni bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ste /
translated: Application to complete the collections is to practice the six perfections in order to complete the collections of merit and wisdom.

original: gang gong du sbyin pa mi zad pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gong du sbyin pa mi zad pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the intention of inexhaustible generosity and so on is the inexhaustible application of a bodhisattva.

original: dka' bar spyad pa bzod pa la sbyor ba ni sems can yongs @90a * //
analyzed: dka' bar spyad pa bzod pa la sbyor ba ni sems can yongs @90a * //
translated: Application to endure difficult conduct is to endure the suffering of sentient beings.

original: su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir nang gi sdug bsngal mgo dang / rkang lag la sogs pa btang ba dang / phyi'i sdug bsngal grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa bzod pa ste /
analyzed: su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir nang gi sdug bsngal mgo dang / rkang lag la sogs pa btang ba dang / phyi'i sdug bsngal grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa bzod pa ste /
translated: In order to ripen those who are not yet ripened and to ripen those who are already ripened, they endure the internal sufferings of giving their heads, legs, arms, and so on, and the external sufferings of heat, cold, and so on.

original: de yang gang du btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang du btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba mi zad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Subh≈´ti, these four are the bodhisattvas‚Äô inexhaustible applications.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi sbyor ba mi zad pa dang / chos sbyin ba ston pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi sbyor ba mi zad pa dang / chos sbyin ba ston pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The inexhaustible application of the thought of awakening, the inexhaustible application of teaching the gift of Dharma, the inexhaustible application of ripening sentient beings, and so on.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The chapter on the spiritual teacher.

original: bskyod par byed pa dang / 'jog par byed pa dang / stobs par byed pa dang / skyabs dpag tu med par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskyod par byed pa dang / 'jog par byed pa dang / stobs par byed pa dang / skyabs dpag tu med par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya'o //
translated: The spiritual teacher is one who causes one to move, to be placed, to be strengthened, and to be protected.

original: de la bskyod par byed pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba bcu spyod pa las bskyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la bskyod par byed pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba bcu spyod pa las bskyod par byed pa ste /
translated: Among these, the spiritual teacher causes one to move away from the practice of the ten unwholesome deeds such as killing.

original: las ngan pa spong du 'dzud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las ngan pa spong du 'dzud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he causes one to enter into the abandonment of evil deeds.

original: 'jog par byed pa ni srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu la 'god par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jog par byed pa ni srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu la 'god par byed pa'o //
translated: He causes one to be placed in the ten wholesome deeds such as turning away from killing.

original: stobs par byed pa ni lha dang mi'i bde ba sbyin par byed pa nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu'i bar du sbyin pa dang 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs par byed pa ni lha dang mi'i bde ba sbyin par byed pa nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu'i bar du sbyin pa dang 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: He causes one to be strengthened in the giving and attainment of the happiness of gods and humans up to the fruit of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: skyabs dpag tu med par byed pa ni mu stegs can la sogs pa'i lta ba ngan par mi ltung bar skyob pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dman par mi ltung bar skyob pa dang / 'khor pa'i lam ngan par mi ltung bar skyob pa dang /
analyzed: skyabs dpag tu med par byed pa ni mu stegs can la sogs pa'i lta ba ngan par mi ltung bar skyob pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dman par mi ltung bar skyob pa dang / 'khor pa'i lam ngan par mi ltung bar skyob pa dang /
translated: The incalculable refuge is the refuge that protects from falling into bad views, such as those of the heterodox; the refuge that protects from falling into the lower vehicles, such as that of the Sravakas; the refuge that protects from falling into the bad paths of cyclic existence;

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas ngan song du mi ltung bar skyob pa'o ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas ngan song du mi ltung bar skyob pa'o ;
translated: and the refuge that protects from falling into the miserable states of suffering.

original: / chos thos pa las sems can thams cad mi dge ba las bskyod par byed pa dang / dge ba la 'jog par byed pa dang / 'bras bu stobs par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa las skyob par byed pas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / chos thos pa las sems can thams cad mi dge ba las bskyod par byed pa dang / dge ba la 'jog par byed pa dang / 'bras bu stobs par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa las skyob par byed pas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspects of the spiritual teacher are so called because, by hearing the Dharma, one causes all sentient beings to turn away from non-virtue, to take up virtue, to obtain its fruit, and to be protected from immeasurable suffering.

original: nga rgyal med pa ni cho rigs dang shes nyen la sogs pas mi snyems pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa ni cho rigs dang shes nyen la sogs pas mi snyems pa'o //
translated: The absence of pride is the absence of conceit with regard to one's family, learning, etc.

original: bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The conscientiousness is the antidote to heedlessness.

original: bag med par yang gzhan las 'byung ba dang / bdag las 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: bag med par yang gzhan las 'byung ba dang / bdag las 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: There are two kinds of heedlessness: that which arises from others and that which arises from oneself.

original: gzhan las 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That which arises from others is also of two kinds:

original: byur las byung ba dang / sems can las byung ba'o//
analyzed: byur las byung ba dang / sems can las byung ba'o//
translated: that which arises from misfortune and that which arises from sentient beings.

original: @90b de la byur las byung ba ni tshe rabs snga ma'i mi dge ba'i las kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: @90b de la byur las byung ba ni tshe rabs snga ma'i mi dge ba'i las kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las byed pa'o //
translated: That which arises from misfortune is the arising of the roots of unwholesome action such as passion, etc. , and the performance of unwholesome actions such as killing, etc. , due to unwholesome action in previous lives.

original: sems can las byung ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul nye bar 'ongs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can las byung ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul nye bar 'ongs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from sentient beings is the arising of the defilements such as passion, etc. , due to the presence of objects which give rise to passion and hatred.

original: bdag las 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag las 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That which arises from oneself is also of two kinds:

original: lus kyi 'du 'dzi las 'byung ba dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du 'dzi las 'byung ba dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from bodily distraction and that which arises from false imagination.

original: de la lus kyi 'du 'dzi las 'byung ba ni bdag nyid khye'u dang / bu mo dang / 'gro ba bzang mo dang / rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa dang 'dre bar mos pas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi 'du 'dzi las 'byung ba ni bdag nyid khye'u dang / bu mo dang / 'gro ba bzang mo dang / rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa dang 'dre bar mos pas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of afflictions from physical distractions is the arising of afflictions through the imagination of being a boy, a girl, a beautiful woman, a kshatriya, a brahmin, and so on.

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba ni 'dod pa dang 'dun pa dang gnod sems la sogs pa la rtog pa'i rgyus nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba ni 'dod pa dang 'dun pa dang gnod sems la sogs pa la rtog pa'i rgyus nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: The arising of afflictions from false imagination is the arising of afflictions through the cause of conceiving desire, ill will, and so on.

original: thos pa las de dag sngon 'byung ba yang spong par byed la /
analyzed: thos pa las de dag sngon 'byung ba yang spong par byed la /
translated: Through learning, one abandons those that have arisen previously and prevents their future arising.

original: phyis kyang mi 'byung bar byed pas na bag yod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang mi 'byung bar byed pas na bag yod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the aspect of heedfulness.

original: gus par byed pa ni chos dang chos smra pa la brnyas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gus par byed pa ni chos dang chos smra pa la brnyas pa med pa ste /
translated: Respect is not despising the Dharma or the Dharma teacher.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las dge slong dag ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge ni ri bong la mchong na yang bsgrims te mchong gi ma bsgrims par ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge ni ri bong la mchong na yang bsgrims te mchong gi ma bsgrims par ma yin no //
translated: Monks, when the lion, king of beasts, jumps on a rabbit, he jumps with full force, not without full force.

original: rta dang glang po la mchong na yang bsgrims te mchong gi ma bsgrims par ma yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin du chos dang chos smra ba la brnyas pa med par byas nas gus par nyan pa'o //
analyzed: rta dang glang po la mchong na yang bsgrims te mchong gi ma bsgrims par ma yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin du chos dang chos smra ba la brnyas pa med par byas nas gus par nyan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, listen with respect, without despising the Dharma or the Dharma teacher.

original: mthun par 'dzin pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pas ji skad bstan pa bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: mthun par 'dzin pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pas ji skad bstan pa bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Agreement‚Äù means to practice in accordance with the instructions of your preceptor, teacher, and so on.

original: / bka' blo bde ba ni phyir mi ldog par nyan pa dang / spyod lam gus pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: / bka' blo bde ba ni phyir mi ldog par nyan pa dang / spyod lam gus pa ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Agreeable‚Äù means to listen without turning away and to show respect in your behavior.

original: bsnyen bkur byed pa ni chos dang chos smra ba la ci rigs par phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa lus dang ngag gis rim gro byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed pa ni chos dang chos smra ba la ci rigs par phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa lus dang ngag gis rim gro byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Service‚Äù means to serve with your body and speech, by prostrating to the Dharma and the Dharma teacher, and so on, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: yang na bsnyan bkur mi byed pa'i gnyen po ni /üîΩbsnyen bkur byed pa ste ;
analyzed: yang na bsnyan bkur mi byed pa'i gnyen po ni / bsnyen bkur byed pa ste ;
translated: Alternatively, the antidote to not serving is service.üîΩThe antidote to not listening is listening.

original: bsnyen bkur med pa ni nyan pa khri mtho la /üîΩ'chad pa khri dma' ba la bzhag cing /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur med pa ni nyan pa khri mtho la /üîΩ'chad pa khri dma' ba la bzhag cing /
translated: The antidote to not respecting is respect.

original: rkang lag brkyang ba dang kha glal ba la sogs pas ngan don nyan pa ste /
analyzed: rkang lag brkyang ba dang kha glal ba la sogs pas ngan don nyan pa ste /
translated: Listening with outstretched limbs and yawning is listening with disrespect.

original: thos pa dang ldan pa rnams ni chos bla mar byed pa de lta bu med de /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa rnams ni chos bla mar byed pa de lta bu med de /
translated: Those who are learned do not have such a lack of respect for the Dharma.

original: de bas na bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rnam ba zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de bas na bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rnam ba zhes bya'o//
translated: Therefore, it is called the aspect of service.

original: @91a * // rna ba blags te nyan pa ni phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang du gnyid dang rmugs pas sems bsdus pa chos nyan pa'i dri ma gnyis med par nyan pa ste /
analyzed: @91a * // rna ba blags te nyan pa ni phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang du gnyid dang rmugs pas sems bsdus pa chos nyan pa'i dri ma gnyis med par nyan pa ste /
translated: Listening with ears open is listening without the two faults of listening to the Dharma: distraction to external objects and a mind withdrawn into the body due to sleepiness and lethargy.üîΩA sutra also states:

original: mdo las kyang dge slong dag gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyan pa'i dri ma ste /
analyzed: mdo las kyang dge slong dag gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyan pa'i dri ma ste /
translated: Monks, these two are faults of listening to the Dharma.

original: de khyed rnams kyis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de khyed rnams kyis spang bar bya'o //
translated: You should abandon them.

original: gnyis gang zhe na ;
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the two?

original: sems rgod pa dang zhum pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rgod pa dang zhum pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An excited mind and a depressed mind.

original: yid la byed pa ni ji skad bstan pa bzhin du chos nyid phyin ci ma log pa dang / dgongs pa phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni ji skad bstan pa bzhin du chos nyid phyin ci ma log pa dang / dgongs pa phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Attention is holding the meaning of the teaching and its intention without error, in accordance with the teaching.

original: de la chos nyid phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa 'byung gi /
analyzed: de la chos nyid phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa 'byung gi /
translated: The unmistaken apprehension of reality is the arising of the formations due to the condition of ignorance,

original: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu las skye bar mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu las skye bar mi rtog pa'o //
translated: and not the non-apprehension of arising from a cause or from a non-homogeneous cause.

original: dgongs pa phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: dgongs pa phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The unmistaken apprehension of the intention is the realization that the statement, ‚ÄúAll feelings are suffering,‚Äù

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang gnyis ka ma yin ba'i tshor ba rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang gnyis ka ma yin ba'i tshor ba rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: is not the natural suffering of the feeling of pleasure or the feeling that is neither.

original: 'gyur ba dang 'du byed kyi 'du byed la dgongs pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang 'du byed kyi 'du byed la dgongs pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the intention of the Buddha that they are suffering due to change, or due to the formations, and so on.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba ni g-yeng ba rnam pa gsum po rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang du g-yeng ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba ni g-yeng ba rnam pa gsum po rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang du g-yeng ba med pa ste /
translated: Non-distraction is the absence of the three kinds of distraction: natural distraction, external distraction, and internal distraction.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba ni chos nyan pa'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su rtog pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba ni chos nyan pa'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su rtog pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: Natural distraction is when, while listening to the Dharma, the consciousnesses of the eye, etc. are engaged in various kinds of discursive thought.

original: phyi rol du g-yeng ba ni chos nyan pa'i tshe nyan par mi 'dod cing skyo ba skye la /
analyzed: phyi rol du g-yeng ba ni chos nyan pa'i tshe nyan par mi 'dod cing skyo ba skye la /
translated: External distraction is when, while listening to the Dharma, one does not want to listen and becomes weary,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la rtog pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la rtog pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: and discursive thought about forms, etc. arises.

original: nang du g-yeng ba ni chos nyan ba'i tshe zhum pa'am rgod pa'i dbang du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nang du g-yeng ba ni chos nyan ba'i tshe zhum pa'am rgod pa'i dbang du gyur ba'o //
translated: Internal distraction is when, while listening to the Dharma, one becomes depressed or excited.

original: gnas ni lus kyi spyod lam mi rgod pa ste ;
analyzed: gnas ni lus kyi spyod lam mi rgod pa ste ;
translated: The basis is the physical posture,

original: gnas gcig na 'dug cing nyan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gcig na 'dug cing nyan pa'o //
translated: sitting in one place and listening.

original: rin po cher 'du shes pa ni thos pa de nyid rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon pas 'du shes nas nyan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rin po cher 'du shes pa ni thos pa de nyid rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon pas 'du shes nas nyan pa la bya'o //
translated: The perception of jewels is the perception that listening to the Dharma is like a jewel, because it is rare.

original: yang na dam pa'i chos nyan pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang shin tu dkon pa dang / bsgrub dka' par 'du shes bskyed nas nyan pa ni rin po cher 'du shes pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i chos nyan pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang shin tu dkon pa dang / bsgrub dka' par 'du shes bskyed nas nyan pa ni rin po cher 'du shes pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, listening to the holy Dharma is the cause of benefit and happiness, and one should generate the idea that it is very rare and difficult to obtain. Listening with the idea that it is a jewel is called the aspect of the idea of a jewel.

original: de la phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni lha dang mi'i bde ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi bde ba 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni lha dang mi'i bde ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi bde ba 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, it is the cause of benefit because it is the cause of obtaining the happiness of gods and humans up to the happiness of nirvana.

original: bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni mu stegs can gyi dka' thub bdag nyid ngal par byed pa'i @91b mtha' dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' gnyis spangs ba dbu ma'i lam bde ba la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni mu stegs can gyi dka' thub bdag nyid ngal par byed pa'i @91b mtha' dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' gnyis spangs ba dbu ma'i lam bde ba la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of happiness because it is the cause of entering the happy middle way, which is the avoidance of the two extremes: the extreme of self-mortification, which is the austerity of the tƒ´rthikas, and the extreme of indulgence in pleasure, which is the indulgence in pleasure of those who enjoy desire.

original: shin tu dkon pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa brgya lam na 'jig rten du 'byung zhing dam pa'i chos bshad pa yang brgya lam na 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: shin tu dkon pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa brgya lam na 'jig rten du 'byung zhing dam pa'i chos bshad pa yang brgya lam na 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is very rare, because Tathagatas appear in the world only once in a while, and the explanation of the holy Dharma also occurs only once in a while.

original: / bsgrub par dka' ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam mnyan pa yang bsod nams dang ye shes gyi tshogs dpag tu med pas bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / bsgrub par dka' ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam mnyan pa yang bsod nams dang ye shes gyi tshogs dpag tu med pas bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to practice, because even listening to a single verse of four lines from the scriptures of the Tathagata requires the practice of immeasurable collections of merit and knowledge.

original: sman du 'du shes pa ni thos pas dug gsum gyi nad sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: sman du 'du shes pa ni thos pas dug gsum gyi nad sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te ;
translated: It is like medicine, because the disease of the three poisons is cured by listening.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i rnam pa zhes tshig gong ma gsal bar bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i rnam pa zhes tshig gong ma gsal bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúaspect‚Äù in the previous verse is clarified.

original: dran pa'i snod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dran pa'i snod ces bya ba la /
translated: It is a vessel of mindfulness,

original: dran pa nyid snod yin pas na dran pa'i snod de /
analyzed: dran pa nyid snod yin pas na dran pa'i snod de /
translated: because mindfulness itself is a vessel.

original: dran pa'i sgras ni thos pa'i shes rab la bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i sgras ni thos pa'i shes rab la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù refers to the wisdom of listening.

original: snod kyi sgras ni mi brjed pa'i gzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: snod kyi sgras ni mi brjed pa'i gzhi la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúvessel‚Äù refers to the basis of non-forgetfulness.

original: thos pa las yid gzhungs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: thos pa las yid gzhungs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Intelligence arises from listening.

original: mi brjed pa'i gzhi byed pas na thos pa ni dran pa'i snod kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i gzhi byed pas na thos pa ni dran pa'i snod kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the basis of nonforgetfulness, listening is called the aspect of the vessel of memory.

original: rtog pa zhes pa ni bsam pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: rtog pa zhes pa ni bsam pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
translated: Realization refers to the wisdom of reflection.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab kyang mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bzhag pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab kyang mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bzhag pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The wisdom of reflection is twofold, according to whether it is in equipoise or not.

original: de la rtogs pa des shes pas na rtogs pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la rtogs pa des shes pas na rtogs pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is known through that realization, it is called the knowledge of realization.

original: rtogs pa shes pa'i sgras ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i shes rab la bya'o //üîΩblo gros 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pa shes pa'i sgras ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i shes rab la bya'o // blo gros 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term knowledge of realization refers to the wisdom of equipoise.

original: blo gros kyi sgra ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros kyi sgra ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
translated: The term intelligence refers to the wisdom of nonequipoise.

original: 'di ltar thos pa dang ldan pa blo che ba la dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa dang ldan pa blo che ba la dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Thus, it is the delight of those who have great intelligence through listening.

original: yang na 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'bar ba'am gsal ba lta bu la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'bar ba'am gsal ba lta bu la bya ste /
translated: Or, the term desire refers to something like a blazing or illuminating fire.

original: thos pa la blo gros gsal bar 'gyur bas na blo gros 'dod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa la blo gros gsal bar 'gyur bas na blo gros 'dod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the intellect becomes clear through listening, it is called the aspect of the desire for intellect.

original: blo gros ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab la bya la /
analyzed: blo gros ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab la bya la /
translated: Intellect refers to the wisdom that arises from meditation.

original: 'jug pa ni goms par byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni goms par byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Engagement refers to the practice.

original: 'di ltar thos pa las blo la 'dris shing goms pa 'byung ba na thos pa ni blo la 'jug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa las blo la 'dris shing goms pa 'byung ba na thos pa ni blo la 'jug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the intellect becomes familiar with and practices what is heard, listening is called the aspect of the engagement of the intellect.

original: yang na dran pa de'i snod yin pas na dran pa'i snod de /
analyzed: yang na dran pa de'i snod yin pas na dran pa'i snod de /
translated: Alternatively, since it is the vessel of that mindfulness, it is the vessel of mindfulness.

original: dran pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ji ltar bzung ba'i chos dang don mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ji ltar bzung ba'i chos dang don mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the Dharma and meaning as they were previously apprehended.

original: dran pa de'i snod ni thos pa'i shes @92a * //
analyzed: dran pa de'i snod ni thos pa'i shes @92a * //
translated: The vessel of that mindfulness is the wisdom of listening,

original: rab ste ; sngon thos pa'i gzhi las dran pa 'byung gi mthos pa las ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab ste ; sngon thos pa'i gzhi las dran pa 'byung gi mthos pa las ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because mindfulness arises from the basis of what was previously heard, not from what was not heard.

original: blo de la 'jug pas na blo la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: blo de la 'jug pas na blo la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Since the intellect engages with that, it is the engagement of the intellect.

original: blo ni thogs pa dang chags pa med pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: blo ni thogs pa dang chags pa med pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: The intellect refers to the wisdom that is free from obstruction and attachment.

original: 'jug pa ni mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: Engagement refers to the actualization.

original: thos pa las de bzhin rtogs pa'i ye shes /
analyzed: thos pa las de bzhin rtogs pa'i ye shes /
translated: The wisdom that realizes thusness from hearing is direct

original: mngon sum du 'gyur bas na thos pa ni blo la 'jug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur bas na thos pa ni blo la 'jug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is direct, hearing is called the aspect that engages the mind.

original: yang na blo 'dis 'jug pas na blo la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang na blo 'dis 'jug pas na blo la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the engagement of the mind because it engages the mind.

original: blo ni bsgom pa'i shes rab la 'jug pa ni brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid chos bdag med pa rtogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: blo ni bsgom pa'i shes rab la 'jug pa ni brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid chos bdag med pa rtogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The mind is the wisdom of meditation, and engagement is the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, which is inexpressible.

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis de bzhin rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis de bzhin rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes thusness through the wisdom of meditation.

original: de'i rgyu yang thos pa'i shes rab yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu yang thos pa'i shes rab yin te /
translated: And the cause of that is the wisdom of hearing.

original: de bas na skabs 'dir yang thos pa ni blo la 'jug pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na skabs 'dir yang thos pa ni blo la 'jug pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, in this context, hearing is also applied as the aspect that engages the mind.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa bla na med pa ste mi ngoms par nyan pa ni de dag nyan pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa bla na med pa ste mi ngoms par nyan pa ni de dag nyan pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's teachings are the vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the unsurpassed vehicle. Listening to them without satiety is being insatiable in listening to them.

original: gtong ba ni ji skad du thos pa'i chos rnams 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni ji skad du thos pa'i chos rnams 'chad pa'o //
translated: Giving is explaining the teachings as they have been heard.

original: spel ba ni gang zag 'ga' tsam la phyogs gcig tsam du bar 'ga' 'chad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: spel ba ni gang zag 'ga' tsam la phyogs gcig tsam du bar 'ga' 'chad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not that one teaches a few people in only one direction for a while.

original: sems can thams cad la phyogs kun tu rtag tu 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phyogs kun tu rtag tu 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is that one teaches all sentient beings in all ways forever.

original: yang na gtong ba spel ba ni sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir kha na mtho ba med pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //üîΩde la sus sbyin par byed /
analyzed: yang na gtong ba spel ba ni sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir kha na mtho ba med pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o // de la sus sbyin par byed /
translated: Or, the increase of giving is that one gives gifts that are irreproachable in order to obtain the ornament of the mind, the equipment of the mind, the equipment of yoga, and the attainment of the highest goal.üîΩBy whom is it given?

original: su la sbyin par byed /üîΩci zhig sbyin par byed /
analyzed: su la sbyin par byed / ci zhig sbyin par byed /
translated: To whom is it given?

original: ci sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ci sbyin par byed /
translated: What is given?

original: ji ltar sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin par byed /
translated: How is it given?

original: ci'i phyir sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: Why is it given?

original: smras pa / sus sbyin par byed pa ni thos pa dang ldan pa gtong pa po'i gang zag gis so //
analyzed: smras pa / sus sbyin par byed pa ni thos pa dang ldan pa gtong pa po'i gang zag gis so //
translated: It is said: By whom is it given? It is given by the person who is a giver, who is endowed with learning.

original: su la sbyin par byed pa ni bzhi la ste /
analyzed: su la sbyin par byed pa ni bzhi la ste /
translated: To whom is it given? It is given to the four:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug pa dang / khyad par can la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug pa dang / khyad par can la sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives to those who are suffering, those who are helpful, those who are loved, and those who are extraordinary.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pas phongs pa mgon dang skyabs med pa'i bram ze dang tshong pa dang / gdol ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pas phongs pa mgon dang skyabs med pa'i bram ze dang tshong pa dang / gdol ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are suffering are the poor, such as Brahmins, merchants, and outcastes, who are without protector or refuge, lacking food, clothing, and so on.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni pha ma dang sdug bsngal dpag tu med par zhugs pa las 'byin pa'i gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni pha ma dang sdug bsngal dpag tu med par zhugs pa las 'byin pa'i gang zag rnams so //
translated: Those who are helpful are one‚Äôs parents and other people who have helped one to avoid immeasurable suffering.

original: sdug pa ni smos 'drin gang @92b dag de la byams pa'am /
analyzed: sdug pa ni smos 'drin gang @92b dag de la byams pa'am /
translated: Those who are loved are friends and acquaintances, those who are dear to one because of affection,

original: gtam 'dres pa dang / phebs par smra ba dang / 'grogs bshes rnams so //
analyzed: gtam 'dres pa dang / phebs par smra ba dang / 'grogs bshes rnams so //
translated: conversation, intimacy, and companionship.

original: khyad par can ni gang nyon mongs pa gdul ba la zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par can ni gang nyon mongs pa gdul ba la zhugs pa'am /
translated: Those who are extraordinary are those who are engaged in subduing the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa btul ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa btul ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: and those who abide in the result of having subdued the afflictions.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i gnas ni sems can thams cad de su la sbyin pa ni sems can thams cad la'o //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i gnas ni sems can thams cad de su la sbyin pa ni sems can thams cad la'o //
translated: Alternatively, the field of the bodhisattva‚Äôs generosity is all sentient beings, and he gives to all sentient beings.

original: ci zhig sbyin pa ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: ci zhig sbyin pa ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po'o //
translated: What is given? External and internal things.

original: cis sbyin pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las chags pa med pa dang / gtong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyis so //
analyzed: cis sbyin pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las chags pa med pa dang / gtong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyis so //
translated: By what means is it given? By the mental action of the mind that is free from attachment, and by the physical and verbal actions of giving.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa ni ma 'ongs pa la blta pa dang / 'bras bu mthong ba'i dad pas sbyin par byed pa dang / brnyas pa med par rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa ni ma 'ongs pa la blta pa dang / 'bras bu mthong ba'i dad pas sbyin par byed pa dang / brnyas pa med par rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: How is it given? By giving with a view to the future, by giving with faith in seeing the result, and by giving with one's own hand without contempt.

original: ci'i phyir sbyin pa ni sems can thams cad la snying rje ba'i rgyus sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin pa ni sems can thams cad la snying rje ba'i rgyus sbyin pa ste /
translated: For what purpose is it given? It is given through compassion for all beings.

original: sbyin pa de lta bu yang sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa de lta bu yang sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba dang ldan pa /
translated: Such giving is endowed with compassion for all beings.

original: longs spyod thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar snying po med par 'dzin pa ;
analyzed: longs spyod thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar snying po med par 'dzin pa ;
translated: It is the giving of one who holds all enjoyments to be insubstantial, like a dream.

original: gzhan gyi don la gtso bor byed pa'i gang zag thos pa dang ldan pa rnams la 'byung gi gzhan las ma yin pas na thos pa ni gtong ba spel ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la gtso bor byed pa'i gang zag thos pa dang ldan pa rnams la 'byung gi gzhan las ma yin pas na thos pa ni gtong ba spel ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, learning is called the aspect of increasing generosity.

original: 'dis ni chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa rgya cher byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa rgya cher byed pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the extensive generosity of Dharma and material things.

original: dul ba ni gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba dang ldan pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yul la mi 'jug pas dul ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams dul ba ste /
analyzed: dul ba ni gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba dang ldan pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yul la mi 'jug pas dul ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams dul ba ste /
translated: Discipline is the cause of that, because it is the cause of the increase of the cultivation of the antidote. One is disciplined because one's eyes and other faculties do not engage with objects, and because one's afflictions such as desire are disciplined.

original: de'i rgyu'o // de lta bu dul bas na cang shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu'o // de lta bu dul bas na cang shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One who is like that is called well-disciplined.

original: cang shes pa ni lam drang po nas ji srid bgrod par bya bar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: cang shes pa ni lam drang po nas ji srid bgrod par bya bar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: One who is well-disciplined is called skilled because one goes straight to the destination by the straight path.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result.

original: de la lam drang po ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam drang po ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The right path is the union of means and insight, the eightfold noble path, the four noble truths, and so on.

original: bgrod par bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
translated: The goal is to be understood as nirvana.

original: de lta bu 'phags pa'i lam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyang thos pa las byung bas na thos pa ni dul zhing cang shes pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmang du thos pa la brten pa ni mang po las rnam pa mang du chos gang thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba /
analyzed: de lta bu 'phags pa'i lam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyang thos pa las byung bas na thos pa ni dul zhing cang shes pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o // mang du thos pa la brten pa ni mang po las rnam pa mang du chos gang thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba /
translated: Since such an aryan path, which has the characteristics of cause and effect, is also derived from hearing, hearing is called the aspect of self-discipline and self-mastery.

original: tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba /
translated: Relying on much hearing means to hear mostly the sutras that are called good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end,

original: don bzang po //
analyzed: don bzang po //
translated: good in meaning,

original: tshig 'bru bzang po //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po //
translated: good in words,

original: ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa /
translated: unmixed,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: complete,üîΩpure,

original: yongs su dag pa /üîΩ@93a * // yongs su byang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo sde phar cher thos pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa /üîΩ@93a * // yongs su byang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo sde phar cher thos pa la bya'o //
translated: and purified.üîΩThe good in the beginning refers to the four noble truths, the good in the middle to the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and the good in the end to the eightfold noble path.

original: de la mang po la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po la thos pa'o //
analyzed: de la mang po la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po la thos pa'o //
translated: Here, from many means from many spiritual friends.

original: rnam pa mang du zhes bya ba ni chos de nyid la lan grangs mang du thos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa mang du zhes bya ba ni chos de nyid la lan grangs mang du thos pa ste /
translated: Many aspects means listening to that Dharma again and again.

original: de yang thos pa las 'byung gi / ma thos pa las ma yin pas ni thos pa ni mang du thos pa la brten pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thos pa las 'byung gi / ma thos pa las ma yin pas ni thos pa ni mang du thos pa la brten pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That also comes from listening, not from not listening. Therefore, listening is called the aspect based on much learning.

original: bsti stang du byas te dga' ba myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩbsti stang du byas pa ni chos dang chos smra ba'i gang zag la /
analyzed: bsti stang du byas te dga' ba myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba la / bsti stang du byas pa ni chos dang chos smra ba'i gang zag la /
translated: One should listen with reverence, experiencing joy.

original: lus dang dag dang yid kyi bsti stang du byas nas nyan pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang dag dang yid kyi bsti stang du byas nas nyan pa ste /
translated: Reverence means listening with physical, verbal, and mental reverence to the Dharma and the person teaching the Dharma.

original: de ltar bsti stang du byas te mnyan na /
analyzed: de ltar bsti stang du byas te mnyan na /
translated: Having listened with such reverence,üîΩ one should listen with reverence, experiencing joy.

original: dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba bzang po dang ldan par 'byung bas na thos pa ni bsti stang du byas te dga' ba myong bar byed pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba bzang po dang ldan par 'byung bas na thos pa ni bsti stang du byas te dga' ba myong bar byed pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, listening is called the aspect of listening with reverence and experiencing joy.

original: de la lus kyi bsti stang du byas te nyan pa ni dus thams cad du lus kyi spyod lam mi mdzes pa mi ston cing /
analyzed: de la lus kyi bsti stang du byas te nyan pa ni dus thams cad du lus kyi spyod lam mi mdzes pa mi ston cing /
translated: Listening with physical respect means that at all times one does not display any unseemly physical behavior,

original: 'dud pa dang / thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud pa dang / thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: but rather bows, puts one's palms together, and so forth.

original: sems kyis gus par byas te nyan pa ni chos dang chos smra ba la gnod pa'i bsam pa dang / 'phyas gdags pa'i bsam pa dang / klan ka'i bsam pa med cing /
analyzed: sems kyis gus par byas te nyan pa ni chos dang chos smra ba la gnod pa'i bsam pa dang / 'phyas gdags pa'i bsam pa dang / klan ka'i bsam pa med cing /
translated: Listening with mental respect means that one listens with a mind free of thoughts of harming the Dharma or the Dharma teacher, free of thoughts of contempt, and free of thoughts of finding fault,

original: chos don du gnyer ba'i bsam pas bla na med pa'i lam stobs par byed pa'o snyam du bsams nas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: chos don du gnyer ba'i bsam pas bla na med pa'i lam stobs par byed pa'o snyam du bsams nas nyan pa'o //
translated: thinking I will listen with a mind that seeks the Dharma, thinking 'I will follow the path to unsurpassed [enlightenment].'

original: ngag gis gus par byed de nyan pa ni chos smra ba'i gang zag la nams kyang zher 'debs pa'i tshig mi smra zhing /
analyzed: ngag gis gus par byed de nyan pa ni chos smra ba'i gang zag la nams kyang zher 'debs pa'i tshig mi smra zhing /
translated: Listening with verbal respect means that one never speaks words that disparage the person who teaches the Dharma,

original: rtag tu de'i yon tan rdzong par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu de'i yon tan rdzong par byed pa'o //
translated: but always praises their good qualities.

original: thos pa las sems ma 'khrugs shing /
analyzed: thos pa las sems ma 'khrugs shing /
translated: One's mind is not disturbed by what one hears,

original: zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur la /
translated: and one attains meditative stabilization, which is the defining characteristic of ≈õamatha.

original: zhi gnas dang ldan par mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul la mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ldan par mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul la mi 'jug cing /
translated: When one is endowed with serenity, the eyes and so on do not engage the objects of the senses,

original: sems rnam par rtog pa mang pos g-yen spyo ba med pas sems bde bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems rnam par rtog pa mang pos g-yen spyo ba med pas sems bde bar 'gyur la /
translated: and the mind is not disturbed by many discursive thoughts. Thus, the mind becomes happy.

original: sems bden lus bde bar 'gyur bas lus bde ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems bden lus bde bar 'gyur bas lus bde ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And when the mind is happy, the body becomes happy. Thus, it is called the aspect of bodily happiness.

original: thos pa las shes rab kyi mtshan nyid lhag mthong thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: thos pa las shes rab kyi mtshan nyid lhag mthong thob par 'gyur la /
translated: One attains insight, the characteristic of wisdom that comes from listening.

original: lhag mthong gis the tshom dang yid gnyis sel bar byed pas sems rab tu dga' ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis the tshom dang yid gnyis sel bar byed pas sems rab tu dga' ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because insight eliminates doubt and uncertainty, it is called the aspect of mental joy.

original: brtson 'grus kyi skyon gnyis so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi skyon gnyis so //
translated: There are two faults of diligence:üîΩexcessive diligence and laziness.

original: ha cang brtun drags pa dang / g-yel ba las phyis chos nyan par mi 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: ha cang brtun drags pa dang / g-yel ba las phyis chos nyan par mi 'dod pa'am /
translated: The former is not wanting to listen to the Dharma later because of overexertion,

original: ched 'ga' nyan /üîΩched 'ga' mi nyan pa ni skyo ba ste /
analyzed: ched 'ga' nyan / ched 'ga' mi nyan pa ni skyo ba ste /
translated: and the latter is listening sometimesüîΩand not listening at other times because of discouragement.

original: de @93b lta bu med pas mi skyo bar nyan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de @93b lta bu med pas mi skyo bar nyan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one does not have such faults, it is called listening without discouragement.

original: don dang chos dang nan tan nyan pa rnam pa gsum gyis ni thob par bya ba dang / bshad par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba nyan par rim bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: don dang chos dang nan tan nyan pa rnam pa gsum gyis ni thob par bya ba dang / bshad par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba nyan par rim bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The three types of listening are listening for the sake of the goal, listening for the sake of the teaching, and listening for the sake of practice.

original: de la don ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la don ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
translated: The goal is nirvana,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of the practice of the noble path.

original: chos ni gsung rab kyi yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: chos ni gsung rab kyi yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: The teaching is the twelve branches of the scriptures,

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: the sutra, the geya, the vyakarana, the gatha, the udana, the nidana, the avadana, the itivrttaka,

original: skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde dag go //
analyzed: skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde dag go //
translated: the jataka, the vaipulya, the adbhutadharma, and the upadesa.

original: de la mdo sde gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mdo sde gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sutra?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu 'dul ba de dang de dag dang / 'dul ba'i spyod pa rnams las brtsams te phung po dang ldan pa'i gtam dang / skye mched dang ldan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu 'dul ba de dang de dag dang / 'dul ba'i spyod pa rnams las brtsams te phung po dang ldan pa'i gtam dang / skye mched dang ldan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the sense sources, dependent origination,

original: zas dang ldan pa dang / khams dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang ldan pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: zas dang ldan pa dang / khams dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang ldan pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: the sustenances, the elements, the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, the tathƒÅgatas, the establishments of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power,
