analyzed: skye ba la mkhas pa ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams rgyu gang las 'bras bu gang skye ba shes pa ste /
translated: Skill in birth is the knowledge of what result is born from what cause among the outer and inner dependently arisen phenomena.üîΩThus, the outer dependent origination is the knowledge that the sprout is conditioned by the seed, and so on, up to the knowledge that the fruit is conditioned by the flower, and the inner dependent origination is the knowledge that the formations are conditioned by ignorance, and so on, up to the knowledge that old age and death are conditioned by birth.

original: 'di ltar phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu zhes bya ba nas me tog gi rkyen gyis 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i bar dang / nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du phyi dang nang gi chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen las skye'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu zhes bya ba nas me tog gi rkyen gyis 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i bar dang / nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du phyi dang nang gi chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen las skye'i /
translated: One realizes that outer and inner phenomena are born from causes and conditions,

original: bdag dang byed pa po las skye ba ma yin par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang byed pa po las skye ba ma yin par rtogs pa'o //
translated: and not from a self or a creator.

original: mi skye ba la mkhas pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa'i don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa @95b ste de nyan pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba la mkhas pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa'i don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa @95b ste de nyan pa'o //
translated: Skill in non-birth is the knowledge of the ultimate, which is the nature of complete pacification, free from the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: mi sdug pa dang byams pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis 'dong chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum gyi gnyen po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum yang thos pa las 'byung bar
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang byams pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis 'dong chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum gyi gnyen po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum yang thos pa las 'byung bar
translated: The three phrases ‚Äúaspects of repulsiveness, love and dependent origination‚Äù teach that the three aspects of meditation on repulsiveness and so on are derived from hearing.

original: ston to // de la mi sdug pa ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: ston to // de la mi sdug pa ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ste /
translated: Repulsiveness is the antidote to attachment.

original: de bas na mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore a s≈´tra states:

original: dge slong rnal 'byor pas shi nas dur khrod du bor ba'i ro zhag gcig lon pa zhes bya ba nas khyi dang bya rgod dang 'phar ba la sogs pas zos pa yid la gzung bar bya ste zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong rnal 'byor pas shi nas dur khrod du bor ba'i ro zhag gcig lon pa zhes bya ba nas khyi dang bya rgod dang 'phar ba la sogs pas zos pa yid la gzung bar bya ste zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Monks, yogis should mentally retain a corpse discarded in a charnel ground, one day dead, up to being eaten by dogs, vultures, wolves and so on.

original: byams pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: byams pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
translated: Love is the antidote to anger.üîΩTherefore a s≈´tra states:

original: de bas na mdo las kyang byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa /
translated: The mind possessing love is without enmity,

original: 'gran zla med pa /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa /
translated: without rivalry,üîΩwithout anger,

original: gnod pa med pas phyogs bcur mos te khyab par byas te bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pas phyogs bcur mos te khyab par byas te bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and pervading the ten directions, one should accomplish and abide in it.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
translated: Dependent origination is the antidote to delusion.üîΩTherefore a sutra states:

original: de bas na mdo las kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: gang dus gsum gyi chos rnams la 'du byed tsam dang / chos tsam dang / dngos po tsam dang / rgyu tsam dang 'bras bu tsam ste /
analyzed: gang dus gsum gyi chos rnams la 'du byed tsam dang / chos tsam dang / dngos po tsam dang / rgyu tsam dang 'bras bu tsam ste /
translated: It is the mere conditioning, the mere phenomenon, the mere thing, the mere cause, and the mere effect of phenomena in the three times.

original: byed pa po med pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the absence of an agent.

original: gang gi tshe de yid la byas na gti mug shas che ba'i gang zag rnams gti mug bsrabs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de yid la byas na gti mug shas che ba'i gang zag rnams gti mug bsrabs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one attends to it, the delusion of persons with a predominance of delusion is reduced.

original: mi rtag pa ni dus gsum gyi 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma re rer 'jig pas gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni dus gsum gyi 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma re rer 'jig pas gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: Impermanence is the nonabiding of all conditioned states of the three times, since they disintegrate moment by moment.

original: de la 'di ltar 'das pa'i 'dus byas rnams ni skyes nas 'gag par snang la /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'das pa'i 'dus byas rnams ni skyes nas 'gag par snang la /
translated: In this regard, past conditioned phenomena appear to have arisen and ceased.

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'dus byas rnams ni skyes pa'i skad cig phan chad du gnas pa'i mthu med la ma 'ongs pa'i 'dus byas rnams ni ma skyes la 'gag pa med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'dus byas rnams ni skyes pa'i skad cig phan chad du gnas pa'i mthu med la ma 'ongs pa'i 'dus byas rnams ni ma skyes la 'gag pa med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Present conditioned phenomena have no power to remain beyond the moment of their arising. Future conditioned phenomena appear to be unborn and unceasing.

original: de ltar 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin de yang sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi rten byed pas na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: de ltar 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin de yang sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi rten byed pas na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste ;
translated: Thus, since the nature of conditioned phenomena as impermanent serves as the basis for the three types of suffering, it is called ‚Äúsuffering.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang // sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang // sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: The three types of suffering are the suffering of conditioned phenomena, the suffering of change, and the suffering of suffering.

original: de la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of conditioned phenomena is the suffering of all conditioned phenomena that are produced by causes and conditions because they are impermanent.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni 'byor ba'i @96a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni 'byor ba'i @96a * //
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering of all conditioned phenomena that are pleasant and favorable.

original: longs spyod dang / bde ba'i tshor ba yang phyis med par 'gyur zhing ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa'i yid du mi 'ong ba'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / bde ba'i tshor ba yang phyis med par 'gyur zhing ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa'i yid du mi 'ong ba'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the future unpleasant karmic maturation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnams rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba'i steng du nad la sogs pa sdug bsngal gzhan dang yang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnams rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba'i steng du nad la sogs pa sdug bsngal gzhan dang yang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of suffering is the suffering of birth, old age, death, not obtaining what one wants, and the feeling of suffering. In addition to being naturally suffering, it is also associated with other sufferings such as disease.

original: bdag med pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad med pa ste /
translated: The absence of self is the nonexistence of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de dag kyang thos pa dang ldan pas khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang thos pa dang ldan pas khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since those are comprehended by one who has heard the teachings, they are called the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
translated: Peace is nirvana, because it is the pacification of all the afflictions and all suffering.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po de dag gi don ni sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po de dag gi don ni sngar bshad zin te /
translated: The meaning of the three doors of liberation called emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness has already been explained.

original: de dag khong du chud pa yang thos pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag khong du chud pa yang thos pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And their comprehension also arises from listening.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa tshig gnyis kyis ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las spong ba dang / dad pa dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yang thos pa las 'byung zhes ston to//
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa tshig gnyis kyis ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las spong ba dang / dad pa dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yang thos pa las 'byung zhes ston to//
translated: The two phrases non-performance and performance of virtue show that the abandonment of non-virtuous actions such as killing and the performance of virtuous actions such as faith and effort arise from listening.

original: bden pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i mthu dang ldan par byed pa ste bden pa mthong ba'i mthu dang ldan par yang thos pa las 'byung bas na thos pa ni bden pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i mthu dang ldan par byed pa ste bden pa mthong ba'i mthu dang ldan par yang thos pa las 'byung bas na thos pa ni bden pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The blessing of truth is the endowment with the power of seeing the four noble truths. Since the endowment with the power of seeing the truths also arises from listening, listening is said to be the aspect of the blessing of truth.

original: yang na mdo dag las byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas rang gis dam bcas pa'i bden pa'i tshig gis byin gyis brlabs na de bzhin du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang na mdo dag las byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas rang gis dam bcas pa'i bden pa'i tshig gis byin gyis brlabs na de bzhin du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Or else, it is like the statement in the sutras that when a bodhisattva and so on bless with the words of truth that he has vowed, it becomes so.

original: de yang thos pa las 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang thos pa las 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And that also arises from hearing.

original: chud mig son pa ni las dang las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chud mig son pa ni las dang las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba'o //
translated: The eye of knowledge is the view that karma and the ripening of karma exist.

original: rang gi khan las pa ni gzhan la rag ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi khan las pa ni gzhan la rag ma lus pa ste /
translated: One's own is not dependent on another.

original: gzhan la shes pa ni rag ma lus par bya ba yang thos pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la shes pa ni rag ma lus par bya ba yang thos pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the knowledge of others is also from hearing.

original: rang gi sems srung ba ni bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems srung ba ni bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Protecting one's mind is making it not engage in what should not be done.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa la sems spro ba yin la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa la sems spro ba yin la /
translated: Effort is the delight of the mind in the creation of virtue.

original: de mi gtong ba ni rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mi gtong ba ni rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'o //
translated: Not abandoning that is always doing it and doing it respectfully.

original: chos nges par @96b sems pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa'i chos rnams blos gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: chos nges par @96b sems pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa'i chos rnams blos gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the Dharma is the mind's ascertainment of the dharmas of defilement and purification, such as the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i chos rnams mnyan nas rig pas bsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i chos rnams mnyan nas rig pas bsams te /
translated: Having listened to the Dharma as it has been explained, one should reflect on it with knowledge,

original: bsgoms na nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms na nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and meditate on it, because the defilements are abandoned. Therefore, it is called the aspect of the counteragent to the defilements.

original: rang gi phyogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs te /
translated: One's own position is the Bodhisattva's position,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang / de'i 'khor du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang / de'i 'khor du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: the dharmas of purification and the sentient beings who belong to his retinue.

original: bsrung ba ni phyogs de dag gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba ni phyogs de dag gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: Protection is the prevention of the loss of these positions by others and the prevention of their subjection to the defilements.

original: pha rol gyi phyogs bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi phyogs bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa ste /
translated: The position of the opponent is that of Mara, the outsider, etc.

original: de dag dang nyon mongs pa tshar gcod pa ni de dag mthu med cing nyams smod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang nyon mongs pa tshar gcod pa ni de dag mthu med cing nyams smod par byed pa'o //
translated: The destruction of these and the defilements is the prevention of their power and the prevention of their reproach.

original: nor bdun ni dad pa dang ngang tshul khrims dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi nor te /
analyzed: nor bdun ni dad pa dang ngang tshul khrims dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi nor te /
translated: The seven riches are the riches of faith, morality, shame, embarrassment, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: thos pa la de dag 'du bar 'gyur bas yang dag par 'du ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa la de dag 'du bar 'gyur bas yang dag par 'du ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are assembled in learning, it is called the aspect of correct assembly.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i nor bdun po 'phags pa'i nor ma yin pa'i nor las shin tu khyad zhugs pa de dag thos pa la yang dag par 'du ba'i phyir dbul ba thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i nor bdun po 'phags pa'i nor ma yin pa'i nor las shin tu khyad zhugs pa de dag thos pa la yang dag par 'du ba'i phyir dbul ba thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, since those seven noble riches are completely superior to the riches of non-noble beings and are assembled in learning, it is called the cutting off of all poverty.

original: thos pa 'dis dbul ba thams cad gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thos pa 'dis dbul ba thams cad gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that learning cuts off all poverty.

original: mdzangs pa ni rig pa'i gnas lnga khong du chud pa'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: mdzangs pa ni rig pa'i gnas lnga khong du chud pa'i gang zag ste /
translated: The wise are individuals who have mastered the five sciences.

original: thos pa ni nyes pa thams cad spong pa'i gnyen po yin pa dang / yon tan mchog rnams thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thos pa ni nyes pa thams cad spong pa'i gnyen po yin pa dang / yon tan mchog rnams thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Learning is the antidote that abandons all faults and is the cause for attaining supreme qualities.

original: mdzangs pa de dag gis bsngags pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdzangs pa de dag gis bsngags pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the aspect of praise by the wise.

original: mkhas pa ni legs par bsams pa sems pa dang / legs par smra ba brjod pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i don khong du chud par nus pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni legs par bsams pa sems pa dang / legs par smra ba brjod pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i don khong du chud par nus pa ste /
translated: The wise are those who reflect well on what should be reflected on, speak well on what should be spoken, act well on what should be acted, and are able to understand the meaning of what is well spoken and what is badly spoken.

original: de lta bu dag thos pa la mos par byed bas mkhas pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag thos pa la mos par byed bas mkhas pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are devoted to listening to such things, this is called the aspect of delighting in the wise.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gis kyang thos pa de lta bu thugs su chud pa'am /üîΩthos pa la 'phags pa rnams dgyes bas na thos pa ni 'phags pas kun shes pa'i rnam @97a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gis kyang thos pa de lta bu thugs su chud pa'am / thos pa la 'phags pa rnams dgyes bas na thos pa ni 'phags pas kun shes pa'i rnam @97a * //
translated: The noble disciples, solitary realizers, and tathagatas have understood that kind of listening,

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and since the noble ones delight in listening, listening is called the aspect of being understood by the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni so so'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni so so'i skye bo ste /
translated: Non-noble ones are ordinary beings.

original: thos pa'i shes rab de dag kyang dam pa'i chos la mos shang dad par byed nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab de dag kyang dam pa'i chos la mos shang dad par byed nus pa'i phyir /
translated: And since those wisdoms of listening are able to give rise to faith and devotion in the sublime Dharma,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa dad par byed pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa dad par byed pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the aspect of inspiring the faith of those who are not yet noble.

original: thos pa'i shes rab las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba 'byung ba'i phyir bden pa mthong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba 'byung ba'i phyir bden pa mthong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the vision of the four noble truths arises from the wisdom of hearing, this is called the aspect of seeing the truth.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i skyon skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i thabs kyang thos pa las 'byung bas na 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i skyon skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i thabs kyang thos pa las 'byung bas na 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since the method of abandoning the faults of birth, aging, and so on, which are the faults of the contaminated aggregates, also arises from hearing, this is called

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyi skyon khong du chud par byed pas na ;
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyi skyon khong du chud par byed pas na ;
translated: Since the wisdom of hearing comprehends the faults of the phenomena of cyclic existence,

original: 'dus byas kyi skyon la yongs su 'jal ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi skyon la yongs su 'jal ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the aspect of fully comprehending the faults of the conditioned.

original: don la rton pa la sogs pa rton pa bzhi po yang thos pa las 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: don la rton pa la sogs pa rton pa bzhi po yang thos pa las 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The four reliances, such as relying on the meaning and so on, also arise from hearing.

original: de dag gi don ni rton pa bzhi'i skabs nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de dag gi don ni rton pa bzhi'i skabs nas 'chad do //
translated: Their meaning will be explained in the section on the four reliances.

original: thos pa dang ldan na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi byed pas sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //üîΩbdag dang gzhan la phan pa ni bdag dang gzhan mi dge ba'i gnas nas bton te /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi byed pas sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o // bdag dang gzhan la phan pa ni bdag dang gzhan mi dge ba'i gnas nas bton te /
translated: Since one who has learning does not engage in negative actions, it is called the aspect of not engaging in any negative actions.

original: dge ba la 'jog pa'am shes pa'i mthar phyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba la 'jog pa'am shes pa'i mthar phyin par byed pa ste /
translated: Benefiting oneself and others is the aspect of benefiting oneself and others, which is to establish oneself and others in virtue or to cause them to reach the culmination of knowledge, after having drawn them out of nonvirtue.

original: de yang thos pa las byung zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang thos pa las byung zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This is also to be connected with that which arises from learning.

original: thos pa nyid dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pas legs par byas pa'i las kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa nyid dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pas legs par byas pa'i las kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since learning itself is virtuous by nature, it is called the aspect of virtuous action.

original: de ltar legs par byas pas na mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar legs par byas pas na mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Since one has acted well, it is the aspect of nonregret,

original: dge ba byas pa ni phyis 'di lta bur 'gyur ro snyam du sems la gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par du 'gro ba ni yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa las thob par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: dge ba byas pa ni phyis 'di lta bur 'gyur ro snyam du sems la gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro // khyad par du 'gro ba ni yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa las thob par bya ba 'am /
translated: because one who has performed virtue has no mental anguish, thinking, I have become like this through having performed virtue.

original: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa yan chad gong nas gong dus rnams gnon pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa yan chad gong nas gong dus rnams gnon pa la bya ste /
translated: Progress is the aspect of progress, which is to attain what has not been attained, through special qualities, or else it is to overcome higher and higher levels, beginning with the level of earnest aspiration.

original: de yang thos pa las 'byung bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang thos pa las 'byung bar sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, it is applied to what arises from hearing.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All the qualities of a Buddha are the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag thams cad kyang thos pa la brten nas 'thob par 'gyur gyi de las thabs gzhan med pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'thob pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag thams cad kyang thos pa la brten nas 'thob par 'gyur gyi de las thabs gzhan med pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'thob pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, all those qualities of a Buddha are obtained in dependence on hearing, and there is no other method than that. Therefore, it is called the aspect of obtaining all the qualities of a Buddha.üîΩWith regard to the explanation of the engagement of wisdom, it is said:

original: shes rab kyi 'jug pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'jug pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the bodhisattvas‚Äô engagement in proper mental attention is thirty-two-fold.‚Äù

original: de la @97b tshul ni 'phags pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la @97b tshul ni 'phags pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, the path of the noble ones and nirvƒÅ·πáa are the way.

original: de dang mthun par sems shing bsgom pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dang mthun par sems shing bsgom pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Mentally attending to and meditating in accordance with that is called proper mental attention.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa des de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug cing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa des de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug cing /
translated: That proper mental attention engages the meaning of reality.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Engaging proper mental attention is called ‚Äúengaging reality.‚Äù

original: de ltar don la 'jug pa de yang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab pa'i chos de la bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis goms par byas nas don rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar don la 'jug pa de yang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab pa'i chos de la bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis goms par byas nas don rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, that engagement with the meaning is the wisdom of reflection, which, having ascertained the Dharma, cultivates it with the wisdom of meditation and realizes the meaning.

original: de bas na 'di ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the wisdom of reflection and meditation.

original: yang na tshul 'di 'phags pa'i lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: yang na tshul 'di 'phags pa'i lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: Or, this method is the ƒÅrya path, nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rigs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rigs pa'am /
translated: or reasoning such as direct perception and inference,

original: ma nor bar ston pa'i mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi man ngag la bya ste /
analyzed: ma nor bar ston pa'i mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi man ngag la bya ste /
translated: or the instructions of a preceptor and master who teach without error.

original: de dang mi 'gal bar yid la byed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mi 'gal bar yid la byed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Mental attention that is not in contradiction with those is called ‚Äúproper mental attention.‚Äù

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de la 'jug pas na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa ste /üîΩ'jug pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de la 'jug pas na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la 'jug pa ste / 'jug pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la gnas pa'am /
translated: It is the entrance to proper mental attention because it engages that.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de dag gis rang bzhin dang / rab tu dbye ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de dag gis rang bzhin dang / rab tu dbye ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: Entrance is the abiding in proper mental attention or it is the realization of the nature and divisions of proper mental attention.

original: zhi gnas kyi gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of calm abiding.

original: zhi gnas nyid gnas yin pas zhi gnas kyi gnas te /üîΩzhi gnas de la 'jug pa ni zhi gnas kyi rang bzhin rtogs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas nyid gnas yin pas zhi gnas kyi gnas te / zhi gnas de la 'jug pa ni zhi gnas kyi rang bzhin rtogs par byed pa'am /
translated: Calm abiding itself is the basis, hence the basis of calm abiding.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: The entrance to that calm abiding is the realization of the nature of calm abiding or it is the abiding in that concentration.üîΩThe investigation of insight.

original: lhag mthong gis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pas na lhag mthong rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pas na lhag mthong rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya la /
translated: Since insight thoroughly differentiates the general and specific characteristics of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, it is called the investigation of insight.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad pa las de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur bas 'jug pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad pa las de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur bas 'jug pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since the meaning of reality is realized through such investigation, it is also called entrance.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de nyid kyang sems las su rung ba la 'jug pas bshad de /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de nyid kyang sems las su rung ba la 'jug pas bshad de /
translated: And just that serenity and insight are explained as the engagement of the pliant mind,

original: dmigs par bya ba'i don la ci dgar gnas su btub pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i don la ci dgar gnas su btub pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa la 'jug pa gnyis kyis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa la 'jug pa gnyis kyis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The two, the engagement in the solitude of body and the engagement in the solitude of mind, demonstrate the application to the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: spong ba dang mthun pa'i gnas lam brag phug dang nags tshal la sogs pa la gnas na chags par 'gyur ba'i yul 'gro ba bzang mol sogs @98a * //
analyzed: spong ba dang mthun pa'i gnas lam brag phug dang nags tshal la sogs pa la gnas na chags par 'gyur ba'i yul 'gro ba bzang mol sogs @98a * //
translated: When one dwells in a solitary place, such as a cave or forest, which is conducive to abandonment, and is free from the objects of attachment, such as a beautiful woman,

original: pa med pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa rtog pa med pa na ni gnas dang lhag mthong la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa med pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa rtog pa med pa na ni gnas dang lhag mthong la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then one engages in the solitude of body and in insight, because there is no discursive thought, such as the desire for sensual pleasure.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: Dependent origination is twofold, by the distinction of internal and external, as has already been explained.

original: de la 'jug pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To engage in them means to understand their characteristics.

original: bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: In conformity with the truths means to attend properly to the four noble truths.

original: yang na khams gsum la yid byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i tshogs rnams dang bral bar dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu phyogs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam sgrub par mos pa ni bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na khams gsum la yid byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i tshogs rnams dang bral bar dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu phyogs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam sgrub par mos pa ni bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the cause for understanding the four noble truths is the disgust with the three realms, the joy in being free from the mass of afflictions, the one-pointed focus on nirvana, and the aspiration to practice the noble path. Therefore, it is called in conformity with the truths.

original: yang na bden pa bzhi ni mthong ba'i lam gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pas de dang mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi yin no //
analyzed: yang na bden pa bzhi ni mthong ba'i lam gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pas de dang mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi yin no //
translated: Alternatively, since the four noble truths are to be understood by means of the path of seeing, that which is in conformity with them is the four aspects of the factors conducive to insight.

original: bden pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i chos des 'jug pas na bden pa'i rjes su mthun par 'jug pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i chos des 'jug pas na bden pa'i rjes su mthun par 'jug pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called in conformity with the truths because it engages in them through the Dharma that engages in the truths.

original: chos des de kho na'i don rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos des de kho na'i don rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthat dharma causes one to realize the meaning of reality.‚Äù

original: yang na bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug ces bya bar yang bshad do //
analyzed: yang na bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug ces bya bar yang bshad do //
translated: Or, it is also explained that ‚Äúone engages in accordance with the truth‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúone engages in accordance with realization.‚Äù

original: chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa tshig gnyis ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa tshig gnyis ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúwithout annihilation‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout permanence‚Äù teach the unmistaken realization of the meaning of dependent arising.

original: phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skad cig ma'i tshul gyis skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / de dag nyid kyang mi rtag pa yin par rtogs na /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skad cig ma'i tshul gyis skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / de dag nyid kyang mi rtag pa yin par rtogs na /
translated: If one realizes that external and internal dependent arising arises through dependence on causes and conditions in the manner of moments, without interruption, and that they are impermanent,

original: chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called ‚Äúengaging without annihilation and without permanence.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of that,

original: rgyu dang rkyen la 'jug pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la 'jug pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: it says ‚Äúengaging in causes and conditions.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa dang sa bon lta bu ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sa bon lta bu ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Ignorance is like a seed, which is a cause.

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa ni rkyen yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa ni rkyen yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Earth, water, and so on are known to be conditions.

original: bdag la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis bdag tu btags pa'i ming gi rnam grangs ni sngar bshad par zad de /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis bdag tu btags pa'i ming gi rnam grangs ni sngar bshad par zad de /
translated: The synonyms for the self and so on that are imputed by the tƒ´rthikas have already been explained above.

original: de dag med par rtogs par byed pas na bdag med pa nas gang zag gi bar du med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med par rtogs par byed pas na bdag med pa nas gang zag gi bar du med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it causes one to realize that they do not exist, it is called ‚Äúthe entry into the nonexistence of the self up to the nonexistence of the person.‚Äù

original: 'od ba dang 'gro ba dang gnas pa med ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dang 'dug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'od ba dang 'gro ba dang gnas pa med ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dang 'dug pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of light, going, and abiding‚Äù means the absence of birth, cessation, and remaining.

original: de ltar rtogs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called ‚Äúthe entry into realization.‚Äù

original: mi 'pho zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba la @98b 'jug pa ni 'di nas pha rol du chos rdul tsam yang 'phos pa med pa la /
analyzed: mi 'pho zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba la @98b 'jug pa ni 'di nas pha rol du chos rdul tsam yang 'phos pa med pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe entry into the nontransference and the nonexpiration of cause and effect‚Äù means that not even an atom of a phenomenon is transferred from here to a faraway place.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu yang chud mi za bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu yang chud mi za bar shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that the effects of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions do not expire.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa 'dris par byed pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di man chad kyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam shes rab dang snying rjes zin par ston te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa 'dris par byed pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di man chad kyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam shes rab dang snying rjes zin par ston te /
translated: The section beginning with ‚Äúengaging in the cultivation of emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness‚Äù teaches the path of nonabiding nirvana, which is embraced by wisdom and compassion.

original: 'khor ba na gnas kyang shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid la sogs par khong du chud pas 'khor ba'i skyon gyis kyang mgos la /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas kyang shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid la sogs par khong du chud pas 'khor ba'i skyon gyis kyang mgos la /
translated: Even though one abides in cyclic existence, through wisdom one comprehends that all things of cyclic existence are emptiness and so forth, and so one is not sullied by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar khong du chud kyang snying rjes sems can gyi don du 'khor bar 'jug bas na stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa mngon sum du mi byed pa la 'jug par yang byed ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud kyang snying rjes sems can gyi don du 'khor bar 'jug bas na stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa mngon sum du mi byed pa la 'jug par yang byed ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Even though one comprehends this, through compassion one enters cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings. Thus one engages in not actualizing emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness.

original: 'og ma dag la yang lam gnyis kyis zin par de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang lam gnyis kyis zin par de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the other paths, which are embraced by the two.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / nam mkha' mdzod dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams shes rab kyis bskyed pa'i tshul la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / nam mkha' mdzod dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams shes rab kyis bskyed pa'i tshul la 'jug ste /
translated: They enter the way of generating the four concentrations, the sky treasury concentration, the heroic stride concentration and so on and the serial absorptions through wisdom.

original: dbang byed kyang snying rje'i dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams la lta ba'i phyir bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag gi dbang gis mi skye ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: dbang byed kyang snying rje'i dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams la lta ba'i phyir bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag gi dbang gis mi skye ba la 'jug go //
translated: And although they have mastery over them, they enter the concentrations and so on without being born by the power of those concentrations and so on, since they look after sentient beings of the desire realm through the power of compassion.

original: mngon par shes pa nyid ye shes yin pas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes yin pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa nyid ye shes yin pas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes yin pa'am /
translated: Since the superknowledges are wisdom, they are the wisdom of the superknowledges.

original: yang na bsam gtan mi zad pa'i skabs su bshad pa ltar mngon par shes pa dang ye shes zhes phye ste shes rab kyis de lta bu dag bskyed pa la 'jug kyang snying rjes zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa la 'jug go
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan mi zad pa'i skabs su bshad pa ltar mngon par shes pa dang ye shes zhes phye ste shes rab kyis de lta bu dag bskyed pa la 'jug kyang snying rjes zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa la 'jug go
translated: Or, as explained in the section on the imperishability of the concentrations, they are classified as the superknowledges and wisdom. They enter the way of generating those through wisdom, but through compassion they do not manifest the exhaustion of defilements.

original: // shes rab kyis kyang kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams rang bzhin med cing sems tsam du shes pa ni nang du rtogs pa la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: // shes rab kyis kyang kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams rang bzhin med cing sems tsam du shes pa ni nang du rtogs pa la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: And by wisdom, one realizes that all imagined phenomena are essenceless and mind only, which is to enter into the realization of the inner.

original: de ltar shes kyang snying rje'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa des par gyur par 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar shes kyang snying rje'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa des par gyur par 'jug go //
translated: And even though one knows that, by the power of compassion, one does not enter into the peace of nirvana.

original: shes rab kyis 'dus byas kyi skyon mi rtag pa la sogs pa la yongs su 'jal yang snying rjes 'dus ma byas kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed par 'jug go //
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'dus byas kyi skyon mi rtag pa la sogs pa la yongs su 'jal yang snying rjes 'dus ma byas kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed par 'jug go //
translated: By wisdom, one fully comprehends the faults of the conditioned, such as impermanence, and yet by compassion, one does not actualize the unconditioned phenomena of nirvana.

original: shes rab kyis sems can thams cad la bdag med par so sor rtogs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis sems can thams cad la bdag med par so sor rtogs te /
translated: By wisdom, one individually cognizes all sentient beings as selfless.

original: don bya ba'i gnas rang bzhin med par shes kyang /
analyzed: don bya ba'i gnas rang bzhin med par shes kyang /
translated: And even though one knows that the basis of benefitting others is essenceless,

original: snying rje chen pos @99a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos @99a * //
translated: by great compassion,

original: mi gtong ste /
analyzed: mi gtong ste /
translated: one does not abandon sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don yang byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don yang byed do //
translated: And one also benefits sentient beings.

original: de la rnam pa bdun gyis na snying rje las snying rje chen po khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bdun gyis na snying rje las snying rje chen po khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: In seven ways, great compassion is superior to compassion.

original: rang bzhin ni zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is non-hatred and non-delusion.

original: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gcig dang gnyis nas sdug bsngal brgya stong mang po'i bar la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gcig dang gnyis nas sdug bsngal brgya stong mang po'i bar la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its aspect is the observation of one, two, up to many hundreds of thousands of sufferings.

original: dmigs pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its object is the observation of all world systems.

original: sa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sar gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sar gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its stage is the fourth meditation.

original: rgyud ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyud la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyud la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its lineage is the lineage of the bodhisattva.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa ni 'dod pa'i khams thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsnying rje'i skye mched mi mnyam pa ni sems can thams cad la skyob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa ni 'dod pa'i khams thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i phyir ro // snying rje'i skye mched mi mnyam pa ni sems can thams cad la skyob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its attainment of freedom is the attainment of freedom from the attachment of all the desire realms.üîΩIts object field is the five aggregates in the desire realm.

original: skye ba thams cad ni 'gro ba rgyud lnga'i skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad ni 'gro ba rgyud lnga'i skye ba rnams te /
translated: Its birth is in all five types of beings.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ltar skye ba de dag tu nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas yang dang yang du skye bas 'jigs par lta ba ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ltar skye ba de dag tu nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas yang dang yang du skye bas 'jigs par lta ba ni shes rab ste /
translated: And their wisdom is the view that they are afraid of being born again and again under the power of defilements, like ordinary beings.

original: de ltar rtogs kyang snying rje chen po'i smon lam gyi dbang gis rtag tu bsams bzhin du shes pas srid pa thams cad kyang yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs kyang snying rje chen po'i smon lam gyi dbang gis rtag tu bsams bzhin du shes pas srid pa thams cad kyang yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: And even though they have this understanding, they always take on all existences intentionally, by the power of their prayers of great compassion.

original: shes rab kyis khams gsum gyi chos rnams la yid byung zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyis khams gsum gyi chos rnams la yid byung zhing /
translated: Their wisdom is the disgust they feel for the phenomena of the three worlds and their dispassion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'jug kyang snying rjes 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'jug kyang snying rjes 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: And their compassion is that they do not actualize nirvana, the state of dispassion.

original: 'dod pa nyid la dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid la dga' ba yin la /
translated: They delight in the very things that ordinary beings enjoy,

original: de dag so so'i skye bos bsten par bya ba yin pas yon tan yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag so so'i skye bos bsten par bya ba yin pas yon tan yang yin te /
translated: and these are also qualities that ordinary beings can practice.

original: shes rab kyis de dag rang bzhin med par rtogs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gang la yang chags pa dang sdang ba med de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis de dag rang bzhin med par rtogs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gang la yang chags pa dang sdang ba med de /
translated: But with their wisdom, they realize that these five sense pleasures have no intrinsic existence and so they are neither attached to nor averse to any of the five sense pleasures.

original: yal bar 'dor ba la 'jug pa yin yang /
analyzed: yal bar 'dor ba la 'jug pa yin yang /
translated: It is also the case that, although one engages in letting go,

original: tshes rnams kyi don rtogs nas yid sim par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi dga' ba yang mi gtong ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: tshes rnams kyi don rtogs nas yid sim par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi dga' ba yang mi gtong ba la 'jug go //
translated: one does not let go of the joy of the Dharma that satisfies the mind through understanding the meaning of the lunar days.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i lam mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i lam mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the path of wisdom and compassion in brief,

original: spros pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong ba la 'jug pa dang / thabs mkhas pa'i spros pa dang / rnam par rtog pa mi spong bar 'jug pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: spros pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong ba la 'jug pa dang / thabs mkhas pa'i spros pa dang / rnam par rtog pa mi spong bar 'jug pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that one engages in abandoning all elaborations and thoughts and in not abandoning the elaborations and thoughts of skillful means.

original: shes rab kyis lus dang ngag gi las kyi spros pa dang / sems kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong yang dga' ldan nas 'bab pa dang / yum gyi lhums su gshegs @99b pa la sogs pa sku'i phrin las dang / chos ston pa'i gsung gi phrin las kyi thabs mkhas pa'i spros pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyis lus dang ngag gi las kyi spros pa dang / sems kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong yang dga' ldan nas 'bab pa dang / yum gyi lhums su gshegs @99b pa la sogs pa sku'i phrin las dang / chos ston pa'i gsung gi phrin las kyi thabs mkhas pa'i spros pa dang /
translated: Although one abandons all elaborations of physical and verbal actions and thoughts of the mind through wisdom, one does not abandon the elaborations of skillful means, such as the physical activity of descending from Tushita, entering the womb of one's mother, and so forth, and the verbal activity of teaching the dharma.

original: thugs kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi spong zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi spong zhes sbyar ro //
translated: And the discrimination that analyzes the characteristics of the teachings of mind is not abandoned.

original: shes rab kyi 'jug pa tshul bzhin zhes bya ba de'i don yang bstan cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'jug pa tshul bzhin zhes bya ba de'i don yang bstan cing /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcorrect engagement of wisdom‚Äù is also taught.

original: des pa'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: des pa'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the words of the wise,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang tshul bzhin zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang tshul bzhin zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, moreover, that which is called ‚Äòcorrect‚Äô is a word for reasoning.‚Äù

original: slu bar mi byed pa ni rigs pa ste /
analyzed: slu bar mi byed pa ni rigs pa ste /
translated: Nondeception is reasoning.

original: rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i shes pa la tshul bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i shes pa la tshul bzhin bya'o //
translated: Correct engagement is the wisdom that possesses the four reasonings.

original: rigs pa bzhi ni ltos pa'i rigs pa dang ; bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad par bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi ni ltos pa'i rigs pa dang ; bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad par bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: The four reasonings are the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of function, the reasoning of proof, and the reasoning of nature.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag la ltos te chos gang skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag la ltos te chos gang skye ba'o //
translated: Among them, the reasoning of dependence is the arising of any phenomenon in dependence on any cause or condition.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni chos skyes pa rnams rang gi bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni chos skyes pa rnams rang gi bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: The principle of efficacy is that things perform their own functions.

original: 'di lta ste dper na mig gis gzugs rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / rna bas sgra rnams nyan par byed pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na mig gis gzugs rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / rna bas sgra rnams nyan par byed pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the eye sees forms, the ear hears sounds, and so on.üîΩThe principle of logical possibility is that things are logically possible or impossible.

original: 'thad par bsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni chos rnams mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: 'thad par bsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni chos rnams mi rtag pa'am /
translated: For example, it is logically possible that things are impermanent,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'am /
translated: dependently arisen,

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: suffering,üîΩempty, and selfless, and it is logically impossible that they are permanent,üîΩunproduced,

original: stong pa'am / bdag med pa'o zhes tshad ma gsum po yid chos pa'i lung dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis nye bar rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: stong pa'am / bdag med pa'o zhes tshad ma gsum po yid chos pa'i lung dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis nye bar rtog par byed cing /
translated: uncompounded,üîΩand so on.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The principle of non- contradiction is that things are not contradictory.üîΩFor example, it is not contradictory that things are impermanent and also dependently arisen.üîΩThe principle of reality is that things are real or unreal.üîΩFor example, it is real that things are impermanent and unreal that they are permanent.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni ci'i phyir 'jig rten gnas pa de lta bur gyur ba yin /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni ci'i phyir 'jig rten gnas pa de lta bur gyur ba yin /
translated: The principle of efficacy is that things perform their own functions.üîΩFor example, it is efficacious that the eye sees forms and that the ear hears sounds.

original: ci'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba yin zhes bya ba nas ches thams cad la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba yin zhes bya ba nas ches thams cad la yang sbyar te /
translated: The principle of logical possibility is that things are logically possible or impossible.üîΩFor example, it is logically possible that things are impermanent and logically impossible that they are permanent.üîΩThe principle of non- contradiction is that things are not contradictory.üîΩFor example, it is not contradictory that things are impermanent and also dependently arisen.üîΩThe principle of reality is that things are real or unreal.

original: ci'i phyir de lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: For example, it is real that things are impermanent and unreal that they are permanent.

original: de ni chos nyid yin te /üîΩchos de dag gi rang bzhin de yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni chos nyid yin te / chos de dag gi rang bzhin de yin zhing /
translated: That is the nature of things.üîΩThat is the nature of those phenomena,

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid de lta bu yin pas chos nyid de gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'di rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid de lta bu yin pas chos nyid de gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'di rigs pa yin no //
translated: and since that is their very essence, that is the nature of things.üîΩThat is the very reasoning.

original: rigs pa de lta bu dag tshul bzhin yid la byed pas shes shing rtogs par byed pas na /
analyzed: rigs pa de lta bu dag tshul bzhin yid la byed pas shes shing rtogs par byed pas na /
translated: Since one understands and realizes those reasonings by properly attending to them,

original: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa'i tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa'i tshig ces bya ste /
translated: ‚Äúproper‚Äù is a word for reasoning.

original: 'og ma rnams la yang tshul de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams la yang tshul de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same method applies to the following.

original: tshul ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa'am /
analyzed: tshul ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa'am /
translated: The method is the unerring nature of phenomena.

original: yang na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi skabs su tshul gyi sgra ba shad pa de la @100a * //
analyzed: yang na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi skabs su tshul gyi sgra ba shad pa de la @100a * //
translated: Or, in the context of the thirty-two kinds of proper attention, the word method refers toüîΩ.

original: bya'o ; / sgo ni tshul bzhin te bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs ba la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa rnams sgrub pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya'o ; / sgo ni tshul bzhin te bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs ba la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa rnams sgrub pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The door is proper attention, because it is the door to accomplishing the infinite qualities of the dhyanas, superknowledges, strengths, fearlessnesses and so on.

original: yang na de'i sgo nas chos yangs shing rgya che ba rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i sgo nas chos yangs shing rgya che ba rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is the entrance because it causes the realization of the extensive and profound Dharma.

original: kha ni rten la bya ste /
analyzed: kha ni rten la bya ste /
translated: The mouth is the basis.

original: tshul bzhin la brten nas chos phra zhing zab pa rnams rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin la brten nas chos phra zhing zab pa rnams rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the entrance because it causes the realization of the subtle and profound Dharma in dependence on proper mental attention.

original: rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin te /
translated: The cause and condition is proper mental attention,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi 'gog pa zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis de med par 'gyur ba ni 'gog pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro // mi 'gog pa zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis de med par 'gyur ba ni 'gog pa zhes bya na /
translated: because it is the cause and condition of the qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe word ‚Äúcessation‚Äù means that it does not cease.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las byung ba'i shes rab dkar po'i chos kyi mthu dang ldan pas rang dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen gyis med par mi 'gyur bas mi 'gog pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las byung ba'i shes rab dkar po'i chos kyi mthu dang ldan pas rang dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen gyis med par mi 'gyur bas mi 'gog pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Since the wisdom that arises from proper mental attention possesses the power of the wholesome qualities, it does not cease due to conditions that are not in accord with it. Therefore, it is called the word ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: mi 'gal ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa las mi 'gal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa las mi 'gal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-contradiction is because of the realization of non-contradiction with the nature of things as they are.

original: tshul bzhin gyi dngos po thams cad bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi dngos po thams cad bdag med par rtogs te /
translated: Correct is because of the realization of the selflessness of all things.

original: gang la yang chags pa dang sdang ba med par btang snyoms kyi tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang chags pa dang sdang ba med par btang snyoms kyi tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Equanimity is because of the absence of attachment and aversion to anything.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pas na mi brten pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pas na mi brten pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Non-dependence is because of not dwelling in the storehouse consciousness.

original: mi gnas pa ni rten smos ma thag pa de gnyis la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni rten smos ma thag pa de gnyis la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-dwelling is because of not dwelling in those two bases just mentioned.

original: yang na gang zag gi dngos por chags pa med pas na /
analyzed: yang na gang zag gi dngos por chags pa med pas na /
translated: Or, because of the absence of attachment to the reality of the individual,

original: rten pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rten pa med pa'o //
translated: there is non-dependence.

original: chos kyi dngos por chags pa med pas na /
analyzed: chos kyi dngos por chags pa med pas na /
translated: Because of the absence of attachment to the reality of phenomena,

original: mi rten pa'o //
analyzed: mi rten pa'o //
translated: there is non-reliance.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas la gnas pa med pas na mi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas la gnas pa med pas na mi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-dwelling is because of not dwelling in the basis of the storehouse consciousness.

original: ma g-yos pa ni rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ma g-yos pa ni rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Non-movement is because of the unchanging nature.

original: tshul bzhin de ngo bo nyid kyis dag pas nams kyang rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin de ngo bo nyid kyis dag pas nams kyang rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: It is the correct one because it is pure by its very nature, and it is the unchanging one because it never changes into something else.

original: rnam par ma g-yos pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par ma g-yos pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called ‚Äúunwavering‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du gyur pa ni rnam par g-yos pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du gyur pa ni rnam par g-yos pa ste /
translated: because it is not under the sway of counteragents.

original: tshul bzhin des mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul bzhin des mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the correct one, it is not under the sway of the phenomena that are counteragents, such as the impermanent being grasped as permanent.

original: rnam par ma g-yos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma g-yos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúunwavering.‚Äù

original: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang phyin ci log bzhi'i rlung gis bskyod par mi nus pas na ma g-yos pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang phyin ci log bzhi'i rlung gis bskyod par mi nus pas na ma g-yos pa zhes bya la /
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúunwavering‚Äù because it cannot be moved by the winds of affliction such as attachment, or by the winds of the four errors.

original: phung po @100b dang khams dang skye mched la mngon par chags pa'i rlung gis bskyod par mi nus pas na rnam par ma g-yos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po @100b dang khams dang skye mched la mngon par chags pa'i rlung gis bskyod par mi nus pas na rnam par ma g-yos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúunwavering‚Äù because it cannot be moved by the winds of attachment to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.
